text: Really delicious burgers and fries. I've tried all the fries and they are addicting. My favorite is the sweet potato chipotle fries but the parmesan truffle are pretty great too. I've tried a couple of the burgers and they have all been great, but the Standard is by far the most delicious.   They also have pretty good drinks and fancy sodas, like strawberry ginger.  My only complaint is that they don't have normal flavored shakes, like chocolate and vanilla! The crazy flavors are fun sometimes but sometimes I want to go old school.  A fun, low-cost choice for burgers and fries! I definitely want to go back for brunch!

We had a fantastic dinner here! I ordered mushroom Swiss burger and it was tasty. My sangria was also pretty darn food. The fries, though, we're the real stars of the meal! Our group split three  types: sweet potato with Sriracha mayo, Parmesan and truffle cream fries, and bacon blue cheese fries. Oh my goodness. I can't wait to come back for a few drinks and a lot of fries!!

I've been back here several times since my initial review and I am keeping the rating at 5 stars because the Burgers and fries I've had here are so good.  Also the Cheese Curds are easily the best I've had in town (or at least tied for #1 with a select few other places).   I would recommend against the drinks however (I'm talking mixed drinks, the beer is still very good), the ones we had were weak and just not that tasty.

We have frequented D Lux many times since opening a few years ago and both my husband and I agree that the burgers are not as good as they used to be. The fries, cocktails and everything else about the burgers are great but the meat is very thin and over done. The atmosphere and service is great!

This is the best burger I have had in town. I have been to dotty's and the old fashion. The place was crowded and I did not have to wait long. Me and my gf both got burgers and they were cooked perfectly. We also got sweet potato fries with the siracha aoli. That was great as well  The service was great, the crowd is generally 20=30 year old professional. The place looks more modern which is great if you want something different than the usual pub look.

Gourmet burgers on the square! Certainly the best burgers for blocks and blocks. Happy hour craft cocktails were nice at a great price. Appetizers were incredible with good variety of classic flavors.

Family's favorite restaurant. An upscale take on burgers, shakes and fries. Go early unless you'll wait forever.  The sandwiches and burgers are very flavorful and bring together new flavor combinations. Even the sides like the French onion dip and the fries are better than everywhere else.  I come for the shakes mostly. They are very creamy and have texture from the mixins. They are pretty small for a milkshake so you are not left with too much regret.  Best Madison restaurant

Love this place for a lazy Sunday brunch due to their unlimited mimosa deal. For less than $10 unlimited mimosas is a steal. Good breakfast potato variations and decent breakfast sandwich options. Burger options are solid, and make sure to try all of their fry offerings.
Great milkshakes. Bartender didn't know how to make certain shots though, but was an excellent place to hang out and have a great time!

Such an amazing experience this has to be the best roof top bar ever. The location is a right next to the capital building and the atmosphere is amazing. I had the apple slaw burger with the Cheese fries. Wow this was an amazing meal. Tessa the bartender recommended it and also recommended a few drinks that hit the spot. Overall the experience was a good one with delicious food, a nice view of the capital and an exceptional bartender, Tessa. Thanks for the experience in Madison. Next time I am in Madison I will be stopping here.

If you're looking for something super greasy, the brunch here is for you. Located on the Capitol square in Madison, Dlux is situated in a great location. My friends and I came here for their highly reputed "bottomless mimosa" brunch on a Saturday morning, and there were some nice parts of the experience and some less nice parts.   I'll start with the letdowns. Coming here on a Saturday morning, I expected the atmosphere to be calm and relaxing. It felt like a club, with the latest pop/electronic hits playing in the background. Also, someone had recommended the parmesan cream truffle fries, but they did not live up to my expectations. Over a span of 15-20 minutes, the cream sauce on the fries congealed in a non-appetizing fashion.   Other than those two things though, I enjoyed Dlux. The donut balls are great. The strawberry cream sauce that accompanied them was super tasty and complemented the indulgent fried dough balls. I got the spicy sausage breakfast sandwich, and the sriracha mayo sauce made the sandwich incredible. I would also recommend getting the sweet potato fries with the aforementioned sriracha mayo dip. I'm a little biased because I love sweet potato fries, but they're worth it.  The espresso milkshake was also great. Espresso grinds mixed in with ice cream. Simple and delicious. I didn't have the bottomless mimosas, but they're exactly what I expected: a little diluted but decent.  Overall, Dlux was a great place to dine with reasonable prices. Make sure to come before the brunch rush though.

I went here for brunch, and the make your own Bloody Mary bar definitely solidified a 4 star rating over a 3-3.5 range rating. Delicious garnishes! I was starving when we got there and had to wait for friends to arrive, so that definitely helped ;-)  I'm not a beef eater, so I was THRILLED to have the option of subbing a chicken burger on any of their burgers. A+ for that. While almost certainly premade and frozen, the chicken burger (with a fried egg) was absolutely delicious. The sweet potato fries are the best I've had (except for Alchemy, but theirs are very different) and a must have menu item.  The shake I had was absolutely delicious, although some of my table mates were slightly disappointed with theirs. We all got different ones, the Espresso one and Salted Caramel seemed to be the favorites. My main complaint is that for $5, the shakes are pretty small. I shared one with my husband (usually that is plenty), but it was tiny. Definitely not like going to Monty's and getting a huge metal cup plus a glass with shake in it. You are getting 10 or 12 oz at the most, don't get too excited. Everything else was very reasonably priced so it just seemed odd.   In sum, if I hadn't gone for brunch and gotten the Bloody Mary bar, I'd probably give this place a 3. The burgers are good, the fries are great, the shakes are generally good but overpriced for what they are. Definitely not your traditional "burger and shake" joint, I guess that is kinda their whole schtick, but it is a fun place for a weekend lunch or a casual week day dinner.

My daughter told me about a Yelp event at D-Lux a week ago. I am from Chicago. Do most yelping there. I read older reviews of D-Lux and they were hit or miss. I usually discount this as you either love or hate a place. For me, D-Lux is a hit. The samplings were great. Let's start at the beginning (food wise). The dips and chips were above average. The spicy corn dip was great. A big hit at our table. The crudite was artfully displayed and for this time of the year extremely fresh veggies. The drinks were varied and skillfully prepared by our bartenders. They were extremely helpful in describing their concoctions. Next came the fries and burgers. Now folks, this is NOT Donald's Mc Donald's nor is it Johnny's Mc Donald's. The place oozes modern chic. The food carries this theme in taste and presentation. The fries were crisp and prepared with delicious variations. The truffle and cheese fries were very good. The fries were something only an upscale restaurant would conjure up and deliver. The burgers were char broiled. Great start. I just love the taste of the charred meat of the burger. My favorite (I am a meat guy) was the fish plus burger. A great idea executed even better. Bring a few friends, order and share some of their varieties. We were getting filled on these tidbits and out came the shakes. Here again, not Mc Donald's. Thank God! We left satisfied and saying to ourselves, I will be back. Keep up the good work!  Johnny
Bottomless Mimosas for $10 you cannot beat that. They serve you fast and do not skimp.   Never had the food but it looks good.

DLUX has a fun, hip atmosphere with decidedly mediocre food. You won't be upset by the fare, but you won't be impressed either. Standouts include their milkshakes and the buffalo chicken nachos. The burgers come with a variety of toppings, but are underwhelming. I understand why it appeals to the younger crowd because of the vibe, but c'mon, you can really get MUCH better and equally creative food at other establishments in Madison. If you're into bar trivia, however, they have a fun game on Tuesday nights at 8!

DLUX does two things decently, in my opinion. They have a pretty solid brunch (with a $7 bottomless mimosa) and several good $6-8 breakfast sandwiches.   Second, they are a solid late-evening high class bar to stop in and have cocktails or a beer. That being said, the food isn't all that great, so I do not think it's a great restaurant to go for lunch or dinner. However, if you hit them for a Sunday brunch or Friday around 11:30 pm, you'll probably enjoy yourself.

Friday night out in Madison, WI started with dinner at Dlux.  A swanky, new place right off the square.  We started with drinks at the bar while the very short wait for a table.  One member in our party did not get her drink with the rest and very quickly someone came to our table to apologize for the delay and also tell her they were missing an ingredient and asked if there was something else she would like and that it would be "on the house" for the inconvenience and wait.  We were all impressed.   We all were very pleased with our meals and the bleu cheese and bacon fries were delish.   We had a very friendly, attentive and personable waiter in Trevor.   You need to experience Dlux, you will not be disappointed.

Burgers and shakes were pretty good although skimpy, no sides everything is extra.  This is a hip spot but expensive for students. clean lines very open, staff were nice.  But I can't imagine going back because it was so noisy,  I have never heard anything like it, the noise was deafening nobody could hear a thing.
Great food and atmosphere! Highly suggest the truffle fries and sweet potato fries with siracha mayo. Our waitress Dakota was engaging and friendly. Great stop by the Capitol!

I would normally give them 5 stars, went in for brunch Sunday and we were told it would be a 40 min wait (which we were fine with and we had 8 people). But after 30-40 min wait we went to check to see how much longer it would be and I was told it would be another 40 mins at least. We ended up having to slip our group up and eat at different tables. Food was great and the manager was friendly. I also am only giving them 2 stars as I checked our bank account this morning and we were charged for our meal twice- we will be calling and hopefully this will be corrected- my suggestion is to check your bank account after your visit here.

Worst burger I have ever had. I got the southwest burger with green chilies, and it would have been ok if it weren't for the amount of salt. I'm guessing the burger had salt, plus the sauce, and extra seasoning sprinkled on the bun, to the point that it was crunchy! After giving up on it, I felt something strange in my mouth and realized it was a large piece of gristle. Overall it was disgusting enough that this will be my last visit.

I am really torn over DLUX. There are certain things I love about it and certain things about this place that really disappoint me. Proof -   Things I like about DLUX   1. The atmosphere is really stellar. Minus the 3 creepy paintings on the wall, I really love the decor. And I'm never terribly impressed with most Madison decor, but I love the reds and seating around a large, central bar. 2. AMAZING milkshakes. They are so damn good. Try the salted caramel. And you can make it "boozy". 3. Delicious homemade mixed drink taps. That's right. Mixed.drinks.on.tap. Delish. 4. Very clean space, very professional staff.  Things I don't like about DLUX  1. We were sat strangely. I went with a group of friends and they put us at a table clearly meant for 6 when there were 7 of us. That means 4 of us had to squeeze in on the booth side. Not cool. We were even there at an off time and it wasn't crazy busy. I would like to enjoy my food without bumping my neighbor.  2. Food is inconsistent. My friends really liked their burgers, but my breakfast sandwich was dry and mediocre.  3. Considering the crowd I also expected service to be a little more attentive.  Overall, I feel that DLUX could be really great if they worked on a couple of things.

After hearing all the reviews I really wanted to give this place 5 stars.  The atmosphere makes you feel upscale but in a very casual setting. The waiters/bartenders are up to par and are magnificently entertaining. DLUX is definitely the place to go if you want a nice burgers.  The menu is small which I very well like. Simple and to the point. Though it's small each and every dish is jammed packed with flavor. I ordered the DLUX burger and I was very happy with how everything tasted. Fresh and delicious. I also ordered the salted caramel milkshake since I've read that it was amazing from my fellow yelpers. And you know what? It really was! It was delicious!   The only downfall I had was my husbands orange creme soda milkshake. What you would expect and nothing really outstanding and the fries. Their fries were delicious but the parm sort of gave the fries a chalky after taste. My husband had the cheddar fries and yes they were great but next time i would ask them to go easy on the cheddar. Both fries are great when you first receive them but the cheese seemed to harden pretty quickly.  Overall, 4 stars. Atmosphere was incredible, staff was superb, food was delicious except for minor downfalls. DLUX, expect to see me again because you are well worth the drive.

A very hip place for brunch. I ordered the bottomless mimosa and they keep filling your glass if it gets a little low; this was honestly a bit overwhelming because it was hard to keep track of how much I drank. They also have a pretty extensive bloody mary bar with lots of toppings if you're into that kind of thing. The brunch menu is mostly sandwiches which all looked pretty good. Probably not the place to go if you want to get a huge amount of food for brunch.

This place has interesting burgers.  The patties are cooked the same way (done) and the flavors come from the stuff they put on the beef and not from the beef itself.  They are fun burgers and I have eaten three of them and will eat another one at some point.    Milkshakes are also good, but they are yuppiefied milk shakes.    I'm not quite sure what they are going for in terms of ambiance and theme.  The interior has this trendy vibe with red and black interior and low lighting but it also has this sports bar feel with the tv's.  Its' like it can't quite decide what they are going for.    This place is good and on a Wednesday night when Graze, Coopers, and The Old Fashion are all slammed, you can walk over and get a table at DLUX.  I'm not sure how Madison Mag had them as the best new restaurant in town, but it is solid.
Sunday brunch here is a must, bottomless mimosas is always a lot of fun!  I recently went for dinner for the first time and had a great experience as well.  I have yet to have a bad meal at Dlux.

Went last week on election day, had the Green Goddess salad, again, and it was great, again! Tried the sharp cheddar and green onion fries this time, awesome but not as awesome as the blue cheese and bacon fries I had the time before. They were giving out free root beer floats if you had your "I voted" sticker on.

Good burgers, great drinks. I've been here numerous times and never leave disappointed. On our last visit I had the backyard bbq burger with a fried egg added, my fiancée had the farmhouse burger...both were very good. The burgers are all priced at $8, sides are extra. We usually go with an order of the Parmesan & truffle fries...they are the bomb!  Their crafted cocktails are always perfect. Drink prices are reasonable for downtown, $5 to 8. Their tap list is about 8 beers but is filled with local brews. The downfall of dlux is that it's always busy. The place isn't the biggest either so plan on waiting for a table or even a spot at the bar. No over the phone reservations either, just plan on having a drink or two before your meal.

I've probably been here at least 10 times.  I work in the area, and it's high on my list for lunch.  The first thing that may be helpful to know about DLUX is that it's pretty much a lunch and late night establishment.  I wouldn't recommend it to someone that's "going out for dinner."   You certainly could eat some good food during the dinner hours, but I think you can get the point.     I love the Pimento Burger -- check out the photo.  It's quite unique, but it's not going to make any simple folks uncomfortable.  The bell pepper jelly on it is fabulous.  I've tried all of their burgers, and I would not hesitate to order any one of them again.  The milkshakes are excellent.  Get the peanut butter, or the raspberry (I think it was raspberry) -- see the picture I uploaded.  The atmosphere is fresh, fun, and I'd even consider it relaxed.  The staff is pleasant and very attentive.    Why not 5 stars?  I think the meat on the sandwiches could use a little extra flavor.  There's just something missing.   Everything else on them makes up for it though.

Very surprised with all the fantastic reviews.  Burgers are decent, nothing more. They are very thin, and seem to all be cooked to the same doneness. The bread overpowers it, and makes the burger look much more extravagant than it actually is. I would estimate the burgers to be no more than 4oz.   Fries were okay. Red velvet shake was too sweet, and very liquidy. Totally not worth it.

A bit disappointed on my second trip here.  The waiter was totally out to lunch. Not sure if he's a brick short or if he's just bored.  The food was ok but not like my first experience a few months ago.  Hopefully they're just having an off night.

Every time I come to Dlux I have an amazing time but this was not even close.  I know they do not take over the phone reservations but usually if I am five minutes away they will put my name on the list.  The hostess said she put my name on the list and I would have a table when I arrived, of course, they have no idea what I'm taking about.... Then a table opens up and they tell me it is held for a reservation coming in.... Doesn't make too much sense.  Besides the stupid host staff out server was great and so was the food.  I always stay with the sausage breakfast sandwich! The apple butter is to die for :).

Booooooo... 2 stars are for good service and ambiance. Perhaps if DLUX had saved some of their decor budget on fresher ingredients, I wouldn't be scornful of my grey beef patty and blatantly processed "Southern fried chicken" sandwich. Hey-maybe they could've even afforded enough letters to spell out deluxe properly.
My husband and I love DLUX! Have never had a bad meal there and I love the atmosphere!

I think that my first review was spot on, but DLUX has improved A LOT since then.  I went back tonight for a birthday party, and I was thrilled by the improvement.  The bar is still beautiful, and the lighting and music was much better.  While the staff was fine before, the service was much crisper and more professional.    I was really expecting DLUX to fall flat, so I went for broke with the cabbage soup...yep cabbage...and the green goddess salad.  Both were delicious!  I was shocked at how much I enjoyed both of them.   We also had a red velvet milkshake which was much better than either of the two milkshakes that we had tried before.  This was the kicker for me:  We ordered our dishes without meat to be vegetarian friendly, which was not a problem for the waiter.  When we got our bill, we noticed that the price had been reduced because we didn't order meat.  No vegetarian expects to have their bill reduced for holding the meat, but it is really REALLY nice to see it when it does happen.  Thank you.

GREAT SERVICE!  Love going to this place, fun atmosphere, great food, AMAZING service! Eric was our server, he was wonderful also the management there is great. They mixed up my fry order, which wasn't a huge deal because all the fries are tasty, but Eric fixed the situation immediately and one of the managers, I think her name was Amanda stopped by our table to apologize and made sure that we were happy with our meals. Not to mention, they bought my fries! Score! It's those little things that make this place so great!

I am so obsessed with DLUX. I've been here for dinner and brunch and both are excellent. All of the burgers are delicious and really reasonably priced. Do yourself a favor and get the parmesan and truffle fries. Actually all of the specialty fries are awesome, but those are by far the best.   Milkshakes are also awesome. I had the toasted marshmallow and it may have been the best thing I've ever eaten. It even came with two actual toasted marshmallows on top.  Brunch is simple but delicious. You can get the same fry options on your breakfast potatoes and they are just as good. Plus they have $10 bottomless mimosas which is basically all I want out of life. Shout out to Jamie who is our waitress almost every time we (get obnoxiously drunk) eat brunch there. She's great, super friendly and efficient. She keeps the mimosas coming so we love her.   Overall, a great place for dinner or brunch. Friendly quick service, quirky/artsy atmosphere, and delicious food for cheap. Daaa best. Plus their patio is nice in the summertime.

Perfect place for a tasty meal at the perfect price.  I tried the kegged cocktail - the DLUX Double Punch (not to be confused with a discount double check).  It was sublime.  My partner and I had burgers - both done just right.  We also tried the cheddar and green onion fries.  Oooh.  Those were good.  I wish we'd had room to try one of the shakes - but I suppose it's just a pledge to return.  (Also fun/swanky ambience - I like how they've hidden the TVs way up high so they aren't a distraction).

I'll keep this short and simple. This place is amazing. From the food to the service, DLUX never disappoints. Burgers are packed with flavor and you must try their fries. Parmesan and truffle cream's my favorite. And you CAN NOT leave without trying on of their milkshakes. They put all other milkshakes to shame! Personally i love the Salted Caramel Pecan but you really just gotta try them all. These shakes are no joke and they're packed full of incredible flavor.  Also, be sure to ask for their burger and shake specials!!

I like a menu that has limited choices. However, if you're menu is limited then what you make needs to be outstanding. Both of our burgers were dry as were the buns. The egg on my burger was over hard. In all my times of ordering a "dirty" burger, I've never had the egg fried hard. The point of the egg is for the yolk to soak into the bun and run over the meat. The truffle fries were a miss with the sauce tasting more like an Alfredo. We ended up sending them back and asking for plain fries suggesting maybe they were soggy because they sat too long. Server was pleasant and the wine was good. We won't return.

Ok, so I dropped in for the first time at lunch time.  I'd been excited because of my perceived dearth of great burgers in Madison.  I took a seat at the bar, my preferred seat in most restaurants, and was surprised by it's size.  It was a large squarish bar in the center of the room that takes up a considerable amount of floorspace - more than I would expect for a restaurant.  The decor, which is slick and mod, tells you that Dlux is really a fancy cocktail lounge that serves burgers.   And if I were judging it as a lounge, my star rating would probably start at 4 stars.  Beautiful space, nice bar, good stools - a great start. However, I'm judging it as a burger spot, and as such it's absolutely a three star kinda place.  I had "The Standard" which is what it sounds like: American cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion and pickles. I also had sea salt fries on the side. They have a number of other burgers but I wanted to give them a shot at the classic.   The food came hot which was great. The plate was very attractive as they have their own custom dlux plates.  I guess my main complaint is that the patty is too small.  I'm guessing five ounces before cooking.  It was dwarfed by the bun, which was a good potato bun.  You can order a double if you want, which pushes the price up from $8 to $11, no side.  Pretty steep for lunch. Everything else about the burger fine.  The veggies were fresh, but that's not why I would go back for a burger.  The fries were also a little off.  They were hot, but a little chewy or tough and barely salted which isn't great when you call them sea salt fries.  They had the texture of a stale french fry but were not.  I'm guessing it has to do with their cooking process combine with the fact that the potatoes seemed to be fresh cut, which is admirable when it produces a better product.  Here it didn't.   I should also mention that the service was fine.  The bartender was a little disinterested, but I've worked the lunchtime shift behind the bar myself in a former life and I get it.  It's not the greatest shift, but she kept my glass filled and my lunch came promptly.  I'll take that anytime.

Not thrilled with DLUX.  I went in last night with a group of friends and we were seated right away, which was nice until nobody looked our way for the next 20 minutes. Nobody brought water. We didn't see any servers, so we thought maybe we should order at the bar as it was around ten pm and perhaps past the normal time for dinner service. We asked the bartender if we would be getting a server and the bartender said yes, the server was just really busy because they only had two servers. We asked if we could order at the bar since the server was busy and she said no, we would have to wait for the server. She did get us drinks and water, but then we had to return to the table to keep waiting for a server that may or may not come.   When the server finally did arrive she was very pleasant and our food arrived in a timely manner after ordering it. I had the sunrise burger and sweet potato fries and I was underwhelmed. Nothing was especially impressive about it.   It might be awhile before I go back to eat average food with subpar service. There are a lot of burgers in town and dlux doesn't really seem worth the trip. A couple of my friends had milkshakes and raved about them, though.

My wife and I went here on a Friday and we were able to get a seat at the bar right away.  It was our first time here but it won't be our last.  The food was good and the drinks were mixed perfectly.  With that said, while this is a 'burger joint,' it's shooting to be a burger with 'class'.  These are not "juicy burgers" with the juices dripping down your forearms as you take your bites.  The burgers are pressed and therefore they only cook them to one temp.  I am a Medium Rare kind of guy and hate a dry burger, yet these folks were able to keep their creations moist while being medium to medium well.  This is definitely a cocktail and tidy chef made burger vs a juicy, greasy beer and burger place.  My wife ordered the Farmhouse burger and I ordered the Sunrise.  She really enjoyed hers, and while I did like mine, my only complaint would be that I wish the egg had been cooked sunny side up, so that the yolk would be runny as I bit into it.  These chef creations are unable to be substituted per their menu, but I wish they would create a blue cheese and bacon burger.  We each ordered their french fries with cheese, I got the...blue cheese and bacon fries and she the sharp cheddar and green onion.  Her only complaint is that they add a base layer of 'cheese sauce' under the actual cheese and onion which can make the fries in the middle and bottom overly soggy and mushy.  Great bartenders, wonderful mixed cocktails, and a perfect place to take a date and still enjoy a good burger.

I had a very bad lunch experience at DLUX. I've been told that doing burgers this way -- every burger grill pressed to well-done -- is a matter of taste, but I just don't get it.  I had the Farmhouse burger, cheddar-chive fries and a Shot In the Dark kegged cocktail. The tomato jam on the burger was nice and most of the condiments were good, but didn't make up for lack of a flavorful patty. The fries were pretty generic and there was not much flavor in the cheese sauce.  The cocktail was the low of the experience. It was overcarbonated and extremely sweet which gave it an acidy burn. This was not a nice alcohol warmness, but physically painful. I had to send it back.

I've only been to DLux twice, both times for lunch.  My first visit I had the chicken burger (well prepared and very moist) and shared an order of the parmesan & truffle fries which were sinfully delicious.  My second lunch trip I ordered the South by Southwest salad with chicken.  Great salad, except the roasted poblano ranch dressing was extremely bland.    Service seems good, and the lunch prices are reasonable.  I'd definitely return to DLUX.

After having a bad experience in DLUX and writing the review the manger nicely responded and said he was truly sorry for the service and gave a gift card! When we arrived today the atmosphere and ambience was great! The service was good! This time we were served by a nice and friendly server! The food was really good with some great options! I'm glad I gave a other chance to DLUX!
Best burger and fries in Madison. A must try if you live in Madison. I dream about their French fries they're so good. Check it out!

Went for a work meeting. The milkshakes are amazing! I would go there for a milkshake alone! I thought my burger was great. You purchase your side separate from the burger. I thought the portion of the fries were a bit smaller than usual, however, it was  perfectly sized for me! Love the dipping sauces that come with the fries!

I had recently eaten here on the recommendation of a family member who had previously been here.  I was disappointed on several levels.  Upon entering, it was designed for a hipster crowd, with the staff dressed in blue jeans and our server with high laced work boots.  Not what I was expecting!  Also the atmosphere did not relax me at all.  I immediately noticed some rather odd and glaring red blocks of light displayed on the back wall.  In addition to this there was some new age music playing in the background that I found unsettling.  Upon ordering, I settled for the Inside Out Burger and some fries with sour cream. cheese and bacon bits on it.  The burger was basically a beef patty placed inside two pieces of bread with some Gouda Cheese grilled on the outside of the sandwich.  It tasted OK but was nothing to write home about.  The fries were a rather small quantity and seemed somewhat pricy for what you received from the wait staff.  While the location is great being near the State Capitol; I feel that this restaurant plays to the busy lunchtime local business and college crowd and does not really focus its efforts on attracting nor catering to other  diners from outside the city.

First time at Dlux, and for the most part I was happy. The fries are stellar and we shared two different small orders. The burger was good...well done, which I would have preferred a little pink, but still good. The weird thing was, the bun. It tasted and looked pretty much like a regular old, white bread bun from the store. It wasn't toasted or grilled, and didn't seem to go with the gourmet burger (mushrooms, Swiss cheese, truffle cream sauce). It honestly really affected how much I enjoyed the burger. There is nothing like a toasted bun. Or even a bun of higher quality and flavor than what I would buy for a backyard BBQ. Next time, I'll have to try the shakes that everyone raves about.   Update: they got new buns! Hooray! And I tried the chocolate peanut butter pretzel shake. Holy yum!

I have been here many times in the past 7 months. The farmhouse burger is fabulous, love the sauce that comes with the sweet potato fries and saving room for a shake is a must! Remember you can order your burger the temp you want. The first few times I forgot, now it makes it perfect! Great for date night, dinner with the family, groups, any occasion.
The red velvet shake is very good and I also had the fried pickles and the blue cheese and bacon fries and they were also very good.
If you're gluten sensitive or trying to be healthy, not many choices. But the mimosas are great :)

DLUX is conveniently near the Capitol. Had dinner with a colleague last month on a Friday for dinner. It was definitely crowded but luckily we were offered seats at the bar. I ordered cheese curds, the green chili burger, and chocolate peanut butter pretzel milkshake. As it was a stressful day, DLUX was definitely much appreciated. Cheese curds were tasty as well as the burger, but the milkshake was the most memorable. Service at the bar was a bit slow at times, but friendly. The noise level was a bit above average, but love the vibe and decor of the restaurant. Would definitely go again.

Ok. Sweet Potato Fries. SWEET POTATO FRIES WITH SRIRACHA MAYO. So delicious. All the other fries are also delicious and it won't break the bank for you to try them all so I would really suggest it. At just 3$ a side of loaded fries, it's totally worth it. The burgers all sound amazing so it was difficult to pick, but I think it's also difficult to go wrong. My problem with it was that, as some other reviewers have noted, you can't really personalize the cook on the burger. More than that, you can't really customize the burger as much as I'm used to. No substitutions or additions really. I had the farmhouse burger, and even though the tomato jam was on the side, it just didn't go with the burger at all for me. It was waaay too sweet, and if you know me at all, that's not really something I say. Still, I've never had a fried green tomato on a burger, so good on them for creativity. Honestly, looking at the menu now, I must have had some sort of brain aneurism cause some of the other burgers sound way better. The decor is quite modern but very comfortable, and the service (at least at 3 pm) was extremely on point. My server brought me a free sample of milkshake because they were training a new waitress, and all I cant say is, next time, I'm ordering a full milkshake. I walked by once during a brunch service and i if I'm ever back in Madison, I want to do that. a DIY bloody bar sounds amazing. I love me a good spicy briny bloody. Also, bottomless mimosas. Come on. Havent tried the brunch yet, but overall I would put one greasy thumb up for this place.
Not a fan. The food is scant at best. The only thing keeping this place going is their rare drink specials, such as Sunday mimosas.

Came here with my family of six and was unsure what to expect! What we found was an upscale burger place that was extremely affordable and equally delicious. We sampled from the appetizers, burgers, and milkshakes- all SO GOOD! Perfect for a date night or a night with the family! Peanut butter pretzel shake was superb.
Bottomless mimosas. Till 3pm weekends. I like that they set boundaries (see attached photo) Good service. Pleasant staff. Matt is the best. Very helpful and pleasant. RECOMMEND.
Great spot for brunch (yummy food + bottomless mimosas) or dinner and drinks (yummy food + 2for1 drink specials). Basically, if you're a fun foodie, go here.

Just moved to Madison, didn't want to eat at a chain place so we decided to head downtown. Actually saw this place on yelp and decided to try it. We ate on the patio but the inside seemed pretty busy on a Wednesday around 8pm. My boyfriend and I ordered bbq bacon coleslaw burgers and shared a cheddar green onion fry. Food came out fast.  Service was good. Our food was super tasty. Burger cooked perfectly. Bacon cooked perfectly not hard and not slimy. Coleslaw was so good and I really don't even like it in any other instance. Fries were so good and unique. We were pleasantly full. Under $30 for 2 burgers, 2 cokes, and a large fry. I would definitely go back.

If you get the french onion dip make sure you love onions. It is large chopped up onions in a cream sauce. Chips are delicious but sauce was not edible. Bring a breath mint if you want to enjoy! Haha.

This is one of our happiest places in Madison. Everything is just plain delicious with interesting variations on classic things to make it seem like a special occasion. Nice staff, great prices considering the high level of execution and attention to detail.
The red velvet milkshake just exploded in my mouth! Super crazy delicious it's a must! The burger is one of the beats I've had along w the seasoned chips. Super excited to come here again!
S'Mores Shake with alcohol in it?  Bloody Mary Bar? Need I say more? Need I?

This place used to be our regular haunt but now we find ourselves going to other of the many burger options in the area instead.   Why?  On our recent visits the burgers arrived lukewarm and dry while the fries were greasy and soggy.  Their milkshakes have remained constantly good though.   We do appreciate the interesting twist to your typical hamburger but the meat pattie could use a little revamping.

The shakes were definitely the highlight of our meal.  We tried the salted caramel pecan and the toasted marshmallow, they were both incredible!  The fries were also fantastic although the fries in our parmasan and truffle cream order were a little undercooked (I like thick cut fries crispy). The burgers were just okay.  Don't get me wrong, they were good but for $8 and compared to everything else we tried, they just didn't stack up.  I would probably skip the burger next time and order soup or salad.   No complaints about the service and I did enjoy the ambiance.

People go here for the unlimited mimosas (which is great, especially because it's the only place in Madison that does this which is sad for many reasons) but that's pretty much all I would recommend it for. The food, while delicious, consists of a few "burger"-type items with a few sides. They also have some delicious boozy milkshake items. The decor it what gets me, though. It's like they tried really hard to be super contemporary and also kind of asian clubby but missed the mark on both or whatever kind of combination was supposed to happen, so it ends up just kind of tacky.

Here's my beef:  1) These guys advertise themselves with this motto in tow: "Burgers, Cocktails, and General Swank..." The thing is, if you have to advertise the presence of swank in your establishment, there's some trying too hard going on. It's sorta like having to explain a joke after telling it. I've had to explain jokes before. It's not cool...or swanky.  2) I ordered a cocktail while seated in one of their booths and when the waitress delivered it, there was a fly hanging out in the bottom of my glass. The waitress was super apologetic about it when I introduced her to my dead, floaty friend but I was turned off nonetheless.  3) Tipsy Cow, Graze, Merchant...they're all right down the street. And they will serve me a burger medium-rare. That's considerate.  Real talk.

The breakfast mushroom sandwich is amazing, and the bottomless mimosa is well worth the price. I would recommend adding a few more vegetarian options to the brunch menu. My husband and I only had one option to choose from. Otherwise, we will be back to enjoy the atmosphere, breakfast potatoes, and cocktails! It was well worth our visit! Oh, and prices are reasonable.

Review is for how they treated us here.  We stopped here after the farmers market last weekend.  Hostess refused to seat us even with empty tables in the restaurant and outside.  A member of our party stayed behind to find out why and she heard them comment about the fact that we had our 5 year old son with us.  Sorry, but we were here during the early daylight hours, not at night, and this isn't fine dining (where we know not to bring our son).  Won't be going here even for an adults only night anymore.  Guess if you like being greeted by snotty millennials who smell like patchouli and hemp, then this is the place for you.  We went to the Great Dane where they were happy to have us.

After a less than stellar experience at DLUX, the owner, Caitlin reached out to me and invited to come out for a couple of cocktails.  I'm happy to report that I had a much better experience.  For those of you that have complained about the cocktails being too sweet, make sure to speak up!  The bar is happy to customize most drinks to make them less sweet or your server can help steer you in the right direction.  If you're like me and love bourbon, get the bourbon smash (less sweet, of course) and you'll be very happy.    OH! and please try the sweet corn dip with fritos.  I'm in love with that -ish and need to recreate it at home (or go back and order it again and again).

I ended up coming here because Graze and other sit down restaurants had long waits that night.  I'm going to describe this place as a very hip, sleek, modern burger joint. I mean I understand the demographic may want burgers but I was shocked when I saw the menu.  I tried to fight the system and have a salmon sandwich. Was ok. And what are these reviews about incredible sweet potato fries? Can you even mess those up? Here's the secret: they're fried.  I will admit they may have some of the best bartenders though. Extremely attentive because they don't just allow the mass of people in. Great service.  TL;DR - take a date here if your lady is into good booze and a burgers...

I'm not going to lie, I've only been here for brunch, but it's a fun trendy brunch place! The parking situation isn't great with it being so close to the capitol, but it's worth the walk. Also expect a wait on Sunday mornings, because it's always busy. It's well lit with their huge windows and has cozy big booths. You come for the $6 Bloody Mary bar (lots of options for seasoning and fixings) or $12 bottomless mimosas (time limited, they need to turn tables), but the food is good too. They don't serve anything too fancy - simple breakfast sandwiches (only $8) and breakfast potatoes (only $3 - multiple cheese & flavor options), but they're very satisfying. They have great sandwich flavors including spicy sausage; bacon, egg & cheese; philly steak & hash; chicken fried chicken with gravy; and my favorite - portobello mushroom with Swiss cheese and truffle cream sauce.
Great place to go to dinner the burgers were great and also we have a milkshake and it was delicious..it was also very affordable I will be back :)

I've been to DLUX a couple times in the last couple years on another's request. I'm generally not initially thrilled with the idea of burgers if I'm going downtown, however I haven't been disappointed with DLUX. I would prefer to reserve the downtown burger for 1or 2am (Plaza Burger).  There are multiple burger-alternative-burgers offered. The falafel could use some crunch or other diversified texture aside from squish (multiple veggies, sauces, falafel making bread soggy too), though the flavor is there (mmm tzatziki). Cheese curds look great; I hope to try these little bundles of cheese-joy next time. DLUX offers fun, innovative milkshakes but I can't vouch for flavor as I haven't experienced these myself (need time as well).  Burgers and drinks are priced fairly, particularly for just of the Square. Although not included, sides are inexpensive and given in large portions and multiple varieties. Staff has been okay. At one time, DLUX offered trivia but trivia in Madison is always changing so definitely check that out first.

Great food, great drinks, great ambiance all at an affordable price.  My favorites of the evening:  Green Goddess Salad, Margherita Chicken Sandwich and Sweet Potato Fries.  Ended the evening sharing a Salted Caramel Shake.  Delicious!

Our food was pretty good - most of us either got a burger or a chicken sandwich, all of which were good, but not great.  However, our service was phenomenal and would keep us coming back. Our servers made great drinks, were personable, and very attentive. We were pleasantly surprised to find out that after a mistake was made on one of our orders, that meal was comped by DLUX (which was totally unnecessary, but very much appreciated).

I'm so very in-between when it comes to DLUX. Its positive aspects are not so courteously complimented by negative aspects. I'll start with the negative to end on a positive note.   First off, DLUX is again and again rated as one of Madison's top burger joints but I just don't see it. Yes, they have a heavy selection of different burgers and fries, both with various toppings but just because there's a diverse selection, doesn't automatically make the food phenomenal. Applebee's offers a wide selection and, well...you know. Don't get me wrong, it's not horrible but I just don't see it worthy as one of the top three places for BURGERS in Madison. There's no choice of preparation, they're all broiled through and the flavor is meh.   When it comes to fries, I've also had a few of their selections and once again meh. The parmesan truffle-cream fries were quite soggy. I understand, truffle cream is stated in its name but coming from a truffle lover, the cream aspect took so much away. Toss those suckers in truffle oil after they've been fried to a crisp glory--but that's just a personal preference.   Anywho, I thought their brunch menu was a lame selection, mostly basic, meh sandwiches with a very small entree selection. I get it, their specialty IS sandwiches but come on, I feel like it's appropriate to mix it up a little when it comes to brunch.   This is also where it starts to turn for the better.....   To make up for their lacking brunch menu, DLUX offers a fatty bloody mary bar with toppings galore. YES PUHLEASE.   And what else goes hand and hand with a successful brunch? MIMOSAS, they serve bottomless mimosas, $12 per two hours, I'd say that's a reasonable time limit to gobble down as many mimosas as possible.   They also have a killer happy hour, until midnight on Friday and Saturday nights. Two for one drinks and that include basically anything, wine, beer, cocktails...even double mixers. You can certainly do some work in that time span. DLUX does have a cool late night vibe,that red, back-lit wall is a staple. Being located right off the square and close to all the cool happenings makes for a great starting point to get the engine revving or just a simple chill spot. Typically, the bar is surprisingly not overcrowded like many of the other surrounding establishments. The bartenders have always been more than accommodating and tolerant of my shenanigans, and usually even willing to have some fun with you!   Finally, those shakes, boozy or not, up the ante just a tad more. There's a selection of five or six, with flavors like salted caramel or red velvet, made with Sassy Cow ice-cream. The bartenders are always prepared with a great alcohol pairing to accompany if that's your cup of tea....or milk...heh. heh.

This restaurant just makes me happy to go to. They're known for their milkshakes (you can add a shot to them). Another favorite is their cheese curds. Decently priced and good. Cozy atmosphere with lots of circular booths

I love DLUX! This is the burger place that Madison has needed for such a long time. If you're bored with the same old greasy burgers served around the downtown bars, then head over there for an awesome burger. Their fries are to die for and the drinks are always great (they did take away the gin and cucumber juice cocktail though).  The vibe is great, the service is great, and the whole place is a great place to be on any day during the week.

The good: great atmosphere, great food and drinks, not to mention brunch on weekends with bottomless mimosas for $12, and a Bloody Mary bar for those needing to nurse their hangover.   The bad: while sitting at a table allows for you to make eye contact with the people you're having a convo with, the service will be terrible. Sitting at the bar is your best bet. I don't know if the servers are inexperienced or get overwhelmed with high volume times, but you will be ignored. NOT so bottomless mimosas, I saw the bottom of my glass more than I saw a drink in it.... Tolerable, in my opinion, seeing as I always return to give it another shot.

Updating my previous review: spoke to the manager after my last post and he went above and beyond to rectify my experience.  Increasing my review of DLUX because great customer service is appreciated.

This is the best burger place in Madison!  The price for everything is perfect and the milkshakes are to die for.  The first time I went I ordered a chicken sandwich fries and a chocolate peanut butter pretzel shake. The sandwich was juicy, tender and so flavorful.  (The name escapes me and I have a feeling the menu has changed since the first time I went)  The second time I went was even better. I had the couch potato burger with bacon and blue cheese fries and a red velvet shake. If you want to know what heaven tastes like just go to Dlux and order anything, I know you wont be disappointed.

A friend recommended this place for brunch while I was visiting Madison. The bloody mary bar was pretty cool with plenty of toppings. The breakfast sandwiches seemed to lack flavor. Overall, I was disappointed with the sandwiches and expected better.  However, I would come back for the bloody mary bar :)

DLUX=Awesome.  If you want a tasty, well put together burger at a reasonable price in a really cool restaurant, you should probably go to DLUX.  I've been there twice now (but to be fair, I've only had one burger) and experiences were awesome.   The decor is very cool and trendy without being overbearing.  The booths and seats at the bar are both very comfy which is always a nice perk.  The staff here are VERY friendly and oh so helpful.  The first time we had a fantastic waitress who was attentive, perky, and gave us helpful tips.  The second time we took seats at the bar because it was a bit busier and every single person working behind the bar checked on us at least once.  The cheese curds here are definitely worth it.  The sauce is a little underwhelming which is unfortunate but they are currently sitting at number 4 on my list which is nothing to sneer at.  I've also had the jalepeno poppers which were on special that night and not on the regular menu, but they were delicious.  And they came with a berry dipping sauce which is the only way jalepeno poppers should be eaten in my opinion.   I have had the DLUX burger (comes with blue cheese, arugala, and port wine onions) and it was super tasty.  Well balanced in flavor and composition, and interestingly enough the buns that DLUX uses are really good.  Would definitely recommend.  I would also HIGHLY recommend the Chocolate Peanut Butter Pretzel Shake which is all sorts of foodgasmic and I've already had it twice.  They have other interesting shakes like Coconut Vanilla and Toasted Marshmallow, but I tend to get chocolate regret when I order sweet things so I haven't yet ventured towards those.  Pro tip, you can add booze to the shake, it's highly encouraged!  Other things to note about DLUX, they don't cook the burgers to your doneness desires, it's strictly fully cooked but they aren't dry so good on them for that.  It does keep the kitchen more expedited though and that combined with a small menu makes for a short wait time on food.  Also sides at DLUX are a la carte, so your burger will not automatically come with fries.  Which is kind of nice if you aren't the fry type (I'm sure those people exist, I just don't want to be friends with them) or aren't feeling them that particular day.    All in all, I love DLUX.  When I'm craving a good burger and milkshake, this is where I want to go.  The staff, the atmosphere, the food, the cheesecurds, and that marvelous marvelous shake will keep me coming back again and again.

Love it!! Great food, great location, great interior, modern atmosphere. The food was great and tasty!! Great service. I actually ate here at least 10 times before giving it a review. I got nothing but positive things to say!

Worst service I have ever experienced. We were told it would be a 30-40 minute wait & ended up waiting over two hours. After 50 minutes we asked how much longer it would be so we could just go elsewhere & were told 10 minutes. 40 minutes after that we were still waiting. Stay far far away from this place if you don't want your entire Sunday afternoon wasted.

Sweet potato and cheese fries were amazing... I am waiting to have a burger with my husband but the fish/shrimp sandwich was pretty good. Both friends I was with didn't care for the sauce on their burgers so I recommend getting it on the side... The marshmallow shake was superb! I would definitely go back.

I was super hyped to try this place out, and I hate to say it, but I was really disappointed by it. I even think 3 stars is generous... I liked the décor and the ambiance. It's smaller than I thought, but was cozy and friendly. They really should change the blown out bulbs in the lighting in the squares on the back wall though.  I went on a Monday night for the $5 burgers, and I'm glad I did. If I paid full price for the burger I would definitely never go back. I ordered a burger, and it was just ok. It was a ground beef patty with toppings. Nothing special, it did not stand out at all, and the fries were also just ok. The service was also just ok, at times I actually felt like I was bothering her by just being there. Paying just $8 for a burger and fries is the reason they get 3 stars, instead of 2.  Sorry DLUX, I probably won't be back.

I realize I'm going against the grain here, but I was not impressed with my first (and last) DLUX experience.   I was told by a friend from work to go there, and when my brother was in town on business, I suggested meeting up there on a weekday after work.  Cool location off the square, trendy decor, great menu with a good selection beers and burgers (but no onion rings? Really??), and had a cool waiter.  All set for what should be a great burger, right?  Meh....  I had ordered a special of the week, which was a Cuban burger.  I was looking forward to a big juicy, cheesy burger with a little spice and great condiments, however, what I got was a small, dry sandwich.  The bun seemed like it was dried out, and was not toasted or grilled or buttered or anything.  The patty seemed like it came out of a freezer package.  The only silver lining was the fries that we shared which were delicious.     I told my friend about my experience and he was shocked. I really am hoping that it was just an anomaly. I think I must try their brunch soon and jump back on the bandwagon. I'm a sucker for Bloody's!

Food: Awesome! My favorite burger is the farmhouse, I love all the fries but if I had to choose, the sweet potato fries w/siracha mayo and the bleu cheese and bacon fries would be the 2. The brunch isn't too bad, my favorite thing to get for brunch ate the bottomless mimosas and the donuts w/ the strawberry dip--great balance of warm and refreshing. I'm not much of a milkshake person, but they are truly great, my favorite I had was their espresso shake (with some booze too!)  Service: I always get good service here. You can tell who is new and who isn't with the speed of service but that wouldn't deter me from future visits. I love that they have a pick up option. I got my boyfriend hooked on their sweet potatoe fries and their burgers.  Tonight they had a private party so they weren't open to the public but they were willing to let us order food for pick up (at 10pm) after we got off work. When we got there the host informed us that our order got lost and they left us a voicemail to try to get our order again but we didn't even check as we were rushing from work to DLUX to get our food. They were closing up from the private party but offered to take our order, we would just have to wait for 10-15 minutes. We took up on that offer as we love their food and didn't really have any other dinner plans. On top of that they took care of a small part of our order for the inconvience. Later on the manager came out and spoke to my boyfriend, he apologize and explained to us what they tried to do, and he thanked us as well.  We honestly both didn't expect much because they have taken care of our order right away, but we greatly appreciate their urgency and service. I think the only thing my boyfriend wish they did differently was to continue to have the Mac Daddy burger.   Keep up the great work!!

I've had very few bad burgers in Wisconsin (they must really just know how to handle their meat here) and DLUX is another just very solid place to grab a burger in Madison. The atmosphere is sleek and open and usually pretty popping and yet is never too loud that you're not able to converse with your table mates. The DLUX Standard burger is a very good, as the name implies, standard burger with regular fixings, but my favorite is probably the mushroom swiss because I'm a total sucker for mushroom burgers. The fries are good and crispy and they have a good lunch deal where you can add fries for just a dollar more.   They also have a good drink special after 10pm - buy one get one free cocktails, tap beers, and wines. The Juni-Pear and Southern Charm are particularly delicious. They also serve food late so if after a couple drinks you get a hankering for a burger and fries, you're covered.

I've been here a few times and I love it. I've only had the chicken burgers as the entree, but man what burgers they are. I love the Margherita chicken and is by far my favorite. It's fresh and savory at the same time. I've also had the Spicy Hawaiian chicken. I absolutely love the fries. Parmesan truffle fries are my favorite, but the cheddar green onion is good too. The bottomless mimosas are definitely a go-to if you're having brunch and they go down easy.  I haven't had a chance to try the shakes but I hear good things. I definitely will continue to eat here.

I had high expectations and really wanted it to be a good place to go as I love the idea of the place, we were out on a Friday celebrating a friends birthday.  Positive: The creativity of what the burgers had on them and quality of those toppings are great as well as the variety of ways you can get french fries (garlic truffle were the best we tried).  The decor is nice and it is in a good part of town.  Service was great as well so it has a lot going for it.    The problem started with their kegged cocktails, 3 out of 4 of them tasted extremely tart and overly sugared to the point where you couldn't tell what was really in them (the margarita was good)  The other major problem was the quality of the beef patty, much like the other reviews the patty was bland and overcooked.  2 out of the 6 at our table had what they thought a patty that was cooked to where it wasn't overly dry, the rest of us felt it was dry and flavorless.    My advice is this place just needs to improve the quality of their meat, the kegged cocktails is just a matter of taste, but the flavorless dry beef patties is a big deal, nobody wants to spend $10 on a burger that relies completely on the bun and toppings.

Nice place for upscale burgers fries and shakes! The burgers were good and they had a nice selection of specialty shakes to try, we had the Caramel salted pecan and Red velvet. We will be back to sample more ! The Bacon blue cheese fries that we ordered as a small for a appetizer were so good we ordered another ! Pleasant service and staff.

Went here for brunch on Saturday morning around 11am. We sat at the bar-like seating at the window, and had pretty excellent service.   The MAJOR highlight for me was the DIY Stoli Bloody Mary bar. Here's the low-down:   -$8, which sounds pricey, but... -You can choose between plain and jalapeno vodka, and then you go up to the bar and create your own!  -There are two mixes: plain tomato/veggie juice and doctored-up garlicky tastiness. ---There's also plenty of Worcester, Siracha, Tobasco, etc. sauces (plus horseradish, a pepper mill, etc. etc.) in case it's not EXACTLY as you want it.  -Then come the garnishes, which could make an entire meal in and of themselves. To give you an idea of the selection, here's what i can remember: bacon, cheese-stuff olives, pimento-stuffed olives, pickles, asparagus, two kinds of cheese, pepperoni, a meat stick, cucumber, sweet red pepper...um, yeah. It's intense.   The other highlight of our meal were the doughnut balls. Oh. My. Science. These were incredible. Served hot, covered in powdered sugar, and with a side of raspberry-yogurt dipping sauce...and only $5 for 8 of these, which are basically about two bites each.   The reason for 4 stars and not 5? I got a breakfast sandwich with a portabella mushroom, fried egg, and I believe some kind of sauce...and it's was just kinda meh. Not terrible, but I was expecting it to pack a lot more flavor. The side of potatoes was a lot more exciting.

To be honest and fair, this review is only for brunch. I haven't been here otherwise. I am a huge proponent of the bottomless mimosa brunches, when they are done correctly. DLUX brings it. Their food is tasty and on point. They have a wide selection that can cater towards the big eaters and vegetarians alike. The mimosas are kept full and cold. Awesome job.  Why not 5 stars? Too small... too crowded... no RSVPs... they let too many people come in and drink. This place gets more packed than KK.

I gave dlux a five star because we had a great lunch experience here today. Nothing bad to say. I had two june-pear drinks and my boyfriend had the bloody Mary. My boyfriend had already been here, so he wanted to order the fried pickles and cheese curds. The bloody was good, "not a generic bloody Mary", he said. My drink was extremely sweet... which I love. My second drink was much stronger than my first though. The apps were both great. You will enjoy the fried pickles even if you are not a big pickle fan. Their burgers do not come with fries, so appetizers are something you may want to consider. My boyfriend ordered the steakhouse burger. He really enjoyed it, but it was too rich to finish. I got the spicy chicken Hawaii burger. This burger came with chicken patty, bacon, pineapple, spicy mayo and jalapenos. I had them hold the jalapeno and I'm embarrassed to admit that I added ketchup. It was really great, and a nice alternative to a beef burger. I would still suggest it.

Best Burger Place in Town!  Came here with a friend for lunch and it was excellent! The atmosphere makes you feel upscale in a casual setting, service was superb and the food delicious! I love that you can swap out the burger for a chicken burger or Portobello mushroom for free. The Parmesan & truffle cream fries are a MUST! Or any of their fries for that matter! DLUX is also a member of the food fight restaurant club which is great! I don't go out for lunch very often during work but will be coming back here soon it was so good!

One of the key things that can make or break a business for me is how the management team responds to customer feedback. All too often they discount it or seem to ignore it altogether - I can certainly say, in this area, DLUX has got them beat, hands down.  After typing a lukewarm comment or two about the mediocre service I received at DLUX I received an immediate (perhaps it was 45 seconds, but no more than that) message from one of the owners, empathizing with the situation, asking for more info, and very kindly inviting us back for another round.  It was impressive... so how could we resist heading back??  Round two was great.  A lively, modern space, DLUX impresses when it comes to ambiance.  The place has had a wee bit of a wait on both of the weeknights we've been there, which is not surprising given that the place is not as big as it appears from the outside.  Love the decor and lighting, it pulses with urban energy.  Purse hooks tucked under the bar are always a nice touch, as is validated parking at one of the nearby ramps (be sure to refer to the website to make sure you park in the right one!) The large 4-sided bar is the centerpiece of the restaurant, literally, and semi-circle booths and small rectangular tables line three of the walls, leaving a small front area open for a happy hour crowd standing and mingling.  Patio tables out front offer an urban dining experience, which I definitely enjoy.  We had Lola B. Dog with us and the DLUX staff graciously accommodated her on the patio, even offering water.   The menu is primarily burgers, with a few salads (all of which included meat, although you can ask for it without and they'll also knock $2 off the price if you do that, so that's appreciated) Plenty of vegetarian options with the burgers, as they allow a free substitution to a portabella on any of their tasty concoctions. There is also a Portabella Caprese burger on the menu along with a White Bean burger, which was excellent.  We also tried the special of the day, which was a falafal burger - it was quite good, but be warned, on the spicy side!  The size of the burgers were good for me, but probably a tad small for a strapping lad who may want to opt for the upgrade to a double (+$3). No sides come with these burgers (all $8) so if you want fries with that plan on +$2.  I'm fine with that, I don't need/want a pound of fries with my dinner anyways!  Service was good on our recent visit and the hostess was charming, even double-checking with her manager that we could have the dog on the patio (which we could as long as she didn't get under foot, of course).  The interest in customer service management takes is what trickles down to the staff and in this case DLUX seems to be off to a good start.  A nice lively, modern, urban addition to downtown.

High class burgers and high class atmosphere! Very cool vibe.  Will be more expensive than most places, so if your're a cheap-o, just stick with culvers take out.  If you can afford class, you will love this place.  Oh - and the shakes are delicious!

I was really happy when I ordered carry out from DLUX today and it came in a paper bag and fully paper takeaway containers. A few restaurants in Madison use wax coated paper takeaway containers, but as I understand the all paper containers that DLUX uses are better for the environment. I will definitely be ordering carry out from them again (and again). Thank you DLUX!

Grateful for friends who suggested DLUX for our 13 year olds birthday dinner.  We look for new places and I was honestly a bit reticent that 'burgers and shakes' might be too mundane to welcome the start of teen years.  Yet from the moment we arrived DLUX felt fun and big city, "ooh, that looks cool" - staff was very friendly and welcoming to family in mix of corporate and casual city diners. Bar was packed creating fun feel and tables were well spaced allowing for the odd 5th chair to fit in nicely. Free shake for birthday girl was nice touch as is free parking.   Drinks - good - though fancy sodas are tough to judge and not just for kids (will the ginger strawberry be too spicy, is the grapefruit lime to sour - yes!). A NOTE TO ALL RESTAURANTS - your eaters are better at judging taste profiles than ingredients, help us by giving a sense of taste not assume we know based on ingredients.. One shake (red velvet) was loved by all , the other (lemon chiffon?) too over powering to be consumed even by the table. Still fun to try.   Food - meat burgers loved by all meat eaters, salmon a little too much garlic in sauce, white fish / shrimp odd texture but tasted good. Fries 'perfect' but a little tough. Chimichurri  salad - yummy - needs more seeds, but sharing with table of meat eaters who LOVED the flank steak, really LOVED it - so much flavor.   Agree with others that "general swank" and "keeping it cahz" is trying too hard, no reservations is fine, but so is responding to email requests to check in for big night.   Definitely worth a try!

Been here twice and have enjoyed both times! The atmosphere is pretty nice, though a little dark. Service is quicker than you think it would be, which was a bonus.   I ordered the Mushroom burger the first time I went, along with the cheese curds. The burger was alright, though I'd go for something a little bit more daring on the menu. It was a little bit blander than I thought it was going to be.   The cheese curds are delicious! They're unlike most cheese curds around Madison in the sense that they have more of a cheddar taste. Also, they bread them with something that tastes like a delicious garlic biscuit (think: gourmet Red Lobster biscuits filled with cheese).   The second time I went I got the Spicy Hawaiian Chicken sorta-burger. It was really delicious. I was worried about the meat being dry, but it was perfect.   My last comment is for the shakes they have. They all look delicious, but both times I went I ordered the chocolate peanut butter pretzel shake. So delicious! Not the thickest milkshake ever, but still really yummy. They're sort of large so I suggest splitting with someone else for the perfect sized dessert!

Burgers - hits and misses BUT the hits were AWESOME.  If you ever need a reason to come to DLUX? It has the BEST milkshakes in town. Get the SALTED CARAMEL shake. *drools* it's my favorite.  To maximize your experience in DLUX, if you have a smaller stomach like me and my boyfriend, share the fries, burger and a shake. You get the whole experience, but you won't be too full to leave ;)  Favorites so far: sweet potato fries, mushroom swiss burger and SALTED CARAMEL shake ;)  Oh, and it's big and spacious, love the booths!!

I've only been here for drinks, but i had a good time. I'm often weary of dimly lit establishments  like this since I'm not much of a "nightlife dude," and there's nothing worse than a place with pulsing house music where I can't hear what others are saying. But this wasn't like that at all, and it felt very mellow, actually. Can't say more cause I didn't eat any food.

I've never been disappointed by a shake before.  I have no idea what was wrong with my blackberry shake; maybe it was the fact that it wasn't cold (it was just 'cool')..  The burger were very, very tasty.  Yeah, it's not the typical Madison fare, but a different burger (esp. ones like the pimento cheeseburger) makes for a great entree.  Their sweet potato fries are thick-cut and definitely worth getting.  The ultra-modern decor (gray) and service (curt) kinda adds to the vibe that this place caters to the passers-by and isn't interested in making any friends.  It was incredibly hard to pin the crowd that would frequent this place; while we were in for weekend lunch, there was a church group, casual bipsters (yolo), and young families.  All in all, grab a table if you're in the area.  I dunno if I'd make it a destination.
Delicious! Bloody Mary bar awesome. Way too loud and pretty trendy. Bring ear plugs if you are over 30.

Can't go wrong with a visit to DLUX. This is my fourth time here and I've left happy and full each time! Tonight's visit was a Father's Day celebration - he wanted a burger and a beer, so downtown we came! It's a great atmosphere - TVs if you want to catch a little sports, fun artwork on the walls, and bar and table seating alike.  We ordered the buffalo chicken nachos to start and they were fantastic. Even if you wouldn't normally get a buffalo chicken style dish, I recommend - I don't believe you'll be disappointed. They cover pub chips with a great flavored cheese sauce, green onions, fresh tomatoes, blue cheese and shredded chicken covered in a hot sauce - perfect amount of heat for me (normally sticking with the mild option).  I tried the Sugar Mama cocktail and loved it - grapefruit not too overpowering and the hint of St. Germain was awesome.  I'll admit I don't branch away from the Standard burger because....well, why? It's perfect. I've tried most of the fries and they are probably my least favorite part of the menu - after sampling those pub chips I'll get those next time if I need a side, or maybe that Asian slaw I was left wishing I hard ordered! My vegetarian daughter said "best I've ever had" regarding the white bean patty she subbed in for the standard.

Ohmygod I ate so much food.  Fried pickles.  French fries with all kinds of toppings.  A SALTED CARAMEL MILKSHAKE.  Burgers galore (pressed, no temp taken).  Great salads.  Reasonable prices.  Friendly faces.  Just writing this review makes me want another milkshake.

This place does some thing very well, but others just ok.  Their burgers are creative and overall pretty darn tasty.  Don't expect a gigantic 1/2 pound monstrosity.  The burgers are well portioned and made with care.  The sweet potato fires are an absolute highlight.  Get them...now!  The shakes are also fairly well done and with the added bonus of the option to make them adult.  They will make any shake boozy.  All you have to do is ask.   Their brunch is not bad either.  The menu is not extensive, but they do have a make your own bloody marry bar for $8 and $10 bottomless mimosas from 10AM-3PM.  Unfortunately my wife did have a very dry and not very flavorful turkey sausage breakfast sandwich.  I will overlook this as the breakfast potatoes were excellent with the sriracha aioli.  The service however was merely adequate.  They never seemed to care if or when food or drinks arrived and never made any objective effort to notice if you needed anything unless flagged down multiple times.   Overall, this place is still growing into its own.  I imagine it will only get better as it figures out what it wants to be (hip, retro, mod?).  DLUX is solid if all you want is a good upscale burger and a decent drink.

Ok guys. Don't mess around - Just get the boozy (Bailey's) espresso milkshake. It's the best thing you'll ever have. Ever.  We had brunch around 9:30 this morning - I had the Eggs Benedict with a side of the parmesan / truffle breakfast potatoes. The eggs benny could have used a little more flavor, but were overall tasty. The breakfast potatoes were COVERED in parm and truffle cream and were basically heaven.   My boyfriend got the chicken fried chicken breakfast sandwich - His personal review, in his own words: "I'd give it a 4/5 stars; the egg was a little over cooked. They just plopped it on a plate - Not a great presentation." (It's hard to get 5 stars outta him.)  Love coming here for the bottomless mimosas, too. FYI: There's a 2-hour table limit from the time they pour your first mimosa.

Went here last night with my boyfriend and was not disappointed. It's a pretty small space so expect to wait a little while even if you go there on a week night. The bar is great and drinks are reasonably priced. We didn't get an appetizer but we both had burgers that were very good. He had the classic burger and I had the pimento cheese burger. The pepper jam is to die for! Both of our burgers were a little bit more well done than we would have liked (we like ours medium rare, a little more towards rare), but still good. I am gluten free and was very impressed with their gluten free menu...it's pretty extensive! And they offer gluten free buns which is great and definitely not something you get everywhere. The fries were decent, but as my boyfriend pointed out tasted like something you can buy at the grocery store and make yourself. Didn't get to try a milkshake as we were so full but next time that will definitely be the first thing I order!

Not the absolutely best burger but a fun selection of styles. Atmosphere is collegiate chic, which is to say, cool enough but full of kids. It also looks shockingly like Ocean's Grill which is weird to me because if I opened a new joint I would be all about redecorating.  Milkshakes are a delightful menu option.  Sweet potato fries with spicy mayo dip? Yes please and thank you.  Would do again in hopes that I'd be tempted to go for another start. I think this place is upwardly mobile.

DLUX is a fun atmosphere. It is a typically delicious dining experience. Hence why I keep returning. Dates, duh! Friends and family, for sure! Co-workers, completely!   There are a lot of delicious burger options, so I won't go too far into descriptions other than my favorite. The Farmhouse. That tomato jam is everything and more. I always ask for extra tomato jam and extra sriracha aioli for my burger and fries. So you probably want to look away when I'm eating here. It's a little obscene and I'm not apologetic in the least!  The other burger must-have depends on the special. My most recent visit kicked the Farmhouse out to pasture! It was either a pulled-pork or short rib, mushroom, swiss divinity from the burger heavens! I thank the burger divinities for sharing with us peasants.   Vegetarian burger options have been decently done as well but I'm quite a veggie burger diva, and it's been a long time since I tried one at DLUX.  Milkshakes are also extravagant, but presentation can be a little sloppy, depending on who makes them and how busy the place is at the time. I don't indulge in milkshakes at DLUX much due to the fact that I am stuffing my tummy and expanding my waistline on fries and burgers. My guests always go cuckoo when they order them, though!  I have noticed that lunch anytime and Thursday/Friday/Saturday evenings can be busy or crowded.  It is unfortunate that I have yet to experience brunch at DLUX. If you have, message me and let me know how it is please! :)

Wife got the Velvet Shake, which was good. The fried pickles were great.   But our entrees were just o-kay sadly. Her burger was alright and my salmon burger was alright as well. Nothing terrible, but is it worth going downtown and waiting for? I'd have to say no.

What impressed me about the burgers here was the balance of ingredients. I got the signature DLUX burger, and found that no single ingredient overpowered another (even with a strong blue cheese dressing).  With other burgers you often get too much bun, or too much meat, etc; here, everything was evenly proportioned. My wife had the same thing to say about the whitefish/shrimp sandwich, a surprising delight that I will have to order for myself next time.    Okay, I concur I would rather have my burger a little rarer. But while the locally-farmed quality meat is a strong selling point, it's really the mix of all fresh ingredients (like nicely mixed arugula greens) that is the focus here. The sharp cheddar/green onion fries were also delicious, though rather soggy. I would encourage the cooks to make sure the potatoes are good and crispy before dousing them with fixin's.  Didn't get to the milkshakes, will have to try those at our next visit.  The vibe is urban cool, though more "family-friendly" than I expected.
