Bar is nice and large, and dominates the space . . . we will likely just perch ourselves there next time and continue to sample this compelling burger menu.
Always delicious. Burgers that aren't just burgers, milkshakes, brunch, mimosas,bloody bar, and amazing fries... we love DLUX

Overall way too much for too little.  I will say the burgers and fries tasted great.  The service was slow, very slow.  One of our burgers was missing a key ingredient when we asked about it the server came back and said oh it was just sitting back there and gave it to us to add to the partially eaten burger.  No sorry we forgot half your sandwich, just here you go.    Great possibilities underwhelming execution.  The ingredients were fresh and well put together, but small.  A $9 burger and $3 fries should not be the size of a Culver's snack pack.    I'd say too much glam not enough substance.  The good.  My burger was well cooked medium rare (even though they didn't ask how I would like it).  The guacamole was excellent, mild without much salsa or garlic, but good given the fact it was on a burger.  Just realized they forgot the tortilla chips that were supposed to be on my burger.  Anyway, the onions were fresh and the bun was soft and buttery.  My wife's was pretty plain even when they brought out the rest of the ingredients.  The blue cheese and bacon fries were great, good blue cheese and sauce and the fries were pretty good.  The sweet potatoes fries were better, but lacking in sauce and seasoning.

If you want a burger or an awesome mimosa, head to Dlux. Brunch here has become a staple for yuppies everywhere. Pimiento cheeseburger, sweet potato fries, and bottomless mimosas and you're good to go.
Wow the cheese curds are so good and the walnut black bean burger is great. The.fries.are.good.but ask for the cheese sause on the side if not its a bit too cheese

I've been here twice now, once for a late dinner and once for a business lunch. Dinner was very crowded, but service was fast. We were in a booth that didn't really sit the number we had in our party, so if you have a larger group try to snag a table! We were lucky to get there early for lunch and snagged a booth, much more comfortable for two people, but service was very slow. They did offer to comp a milkshake to enjoy during the wait, but as my friend had already ordered one we did not take advantage.   For dinner I had a southwest salad which was delicious! I looked forward to ordering it again for lunch, but found they had redone their menu and it was no longer available. For lunch I ordered the spicy Hawaiian "sorta burger." The chicken burger included a slab of pineapple, not just a round which was a nice touch - pineapple all the way through - but the sandwich as a whole was a little too wet and the chicken wasn't very flavorful. The only spice I really got was when biting into a jalapeño, even though there was spicy aioli and pepper jack cheese as well, it didn't really add up to "spicy" all the way through.   We also shared an order of the Parmesan truffle fries. The fries had obviously been sitting around while our food cooked. The truffle cream made them soggy and they were almost room temperature. Pretty disappointing. This restaurant may have earned four stars if the fries had come out earlier than our food when the kitchen was backed up, rather than being offered a free milkshake.   I really want to like this place. The atmosphere is cool and the food is very fresh, but I just haven't experienced the right combination of service and taste yet.

Pretty trendy place with attentive, young, friendly staff (at least on this Saturday morning!)  The "Bottomless Mimosa" deal (2 hours of unlimited refills for $12) with a group of friends and  downtown Madison readily available for wandering/wobbling afterward made for QUITE a good day.

What happened????  My beloved deluxe has become de-yucks!  I have been going to deluxe regularly since it opened. The burgers WERE big, juicy and delicious. Now they are as thin as McDonalds, skimpy on the toppings and is dry as the Sahara desert.    The drinks were weak and I couldn't taste any alcohol. Usually they were decent but now pack NO punch. What a waste of money!  Finally the service-  they were moderately busy and it took almost a half hour to get our drinks and an hour to get our food!  The waitresses blamed it on the challenge of making a Bloody Mary... Seriously???  You are a bar/restaurant, I've bartend, it doesn't take more than a few minutes, even with a lot of garnish.   Deluxe- please get your shit together and go back to the food and service of past!  Sooooo disappointed!!!  For now we are officially breaking up. Don't call me, I'll call you.  ***Update-  we went back, the service was improved and the food was better this time but still not as good as the early days when it first opened.

It pains me to down grade this place as I really liked it! I recently dined at DLUX for dinner. I usually always get the couch potato burger (maybe that was my mistake) I decided to try their DLUX burger, it was 'meh' I was regretting my choice. Myself and 2 guests I was with got the parmesan truffle cream fries which is a fav - they came out cold! booo.  I also ordered their lemongrass lemonade (one of their house made sodas) it had no taste at all! It tasted like I was just drinking club soda. Very disappointing dinner - really hoping it was just an "off" night for them.
Had the mushroom and Swiss chicken burger! Probably the best chicken burger I've ever had.  Blue cheese fries. .. Pretty good too.

I've always liked DLUX. The atmosphere for a square box is amazingly fun! It helps having a bar in the middle of the room to break things up. The burgers, and all the 'sorta burgers' I've had here have been excellent....and they are all the same price! They do rotate the menu regularly, which is great in some repects but disappointing when your fav disappears.... like the California Chicken Buger with avacado. (Hear me DLUX?!) The cheese curds are good, the fried pickles are too, but THE best side is the Parmesan and Truffle Cream Fries. It packs a punch but have a 'Shot in the Dark' cocktail.  Reminiscent of Heritage Tavern's 'Malört and Stormy', it's a great kick-ass drink! Be sure to order one of the 'to die for' shakes for dessert. The 'Salted Carmel Pecan?.....as I said...TDF! Enjoy!

We came here for dinner after my wedding. I had never been before but picked it based on proximity and that it seemed like it was reasonably priced but not fast food. There were kids with us so I also wanted something they would like too. This place was awesome! The burgers and sides were amazing and the service was great

This place has a cool atmosphere. A big bar i the middle of the restaurant, and tables around it in a square shape. I liked it a lot!  I believe they are known for their burgers here, fries also come separate. Burgers are around $9 and fries $3.25/$6.50 spending on the size.  I got the porkys revenge and Parmesan and truffle cream fries. Both were really good! I liked the porkys a lot because it had really tasty crispy pork belly. The fries also had a lot of flavors.  Oh yeah, the milkshakes are pretty bomb, you have the option to add alcohol to it. I had the chocolate peanut butter pretzel and it tasted exactly like it sounds.  Nothing too fancy but a good spot to come if you're craving better than average American classics!
Great environment good burgers and drinks. Everyone likes the weekend bottomless mimosas. This is a little known gem.

I had dinner on a busy Saturday evening with my husband.  I got the salmon-burger and the sweet potato fries.  It was good, but it didn't blow me away.  The service was excellent, but  I would like the atmosphere better if the music wasn't blaring.  Sometimes I think restaurants try too hard to be hip.  I'd go back, but I'd try something different.

The other reviews confuse me.   1) The burger patties are way too thin, ordering an extra patty is a must.   2) a burger place that can't deliver a burger cooked to the level of doneness you ask for has a problem. Ordering medium rare and instead getting a tough puck that is cooked to well done is a burger place that has a problem. With an extra patty on each burger and three people at the table, that's six chances to cook a patty right and all 6 were over cooked by a lot.   3) the toppings were flavorless. I had the farmhouse which was completely boring. One companion had the Dlux, which was also boring. Another companion had the Backyard BBQ, and that was ok minus the way overcooked and tough patty.  I'd recommend skipping this place and going to Dotty's, Alchemy, or Vintage.

This place is right off the square by the Capitol. The ambiance is real intimate. It is mainly a burger place and they have quite a selection.   My wife ordered their DLux burger. I tried their mushroom Swiss burger. Both burgers were tender and well put together. The flavors were mild and I could have used some more spice, salt, or something to get some more flavor out of it.   My friends ordered the Peanut Butter Jelly burger (burger of the week?) and their Carolina BBQ burger. The PB&J is not for anyone who doesn't LOVE peanut butter. The BBQ burger looked the best and will be the burger for me to try next time.   The place also has delicious milkshakes made from Sassy Cow ice cream. The flavor of the month is the peppermint shake. This was the highlight of the meal!  Overall, this is a great burger place for a fine dining establishment! I will be returning.

This place is absolutely delicious. They have some amazing burgers: DLUX, Backyard BBQ (probably my personal favorite), Carnegie, Mushroom and Swiss Melt, etc... Each burger is bursting with so much flavor you'll want to order one of their special house cocktails to wash it down.   I've had their Shot in the Dark, which is a delectable combination of rum, their house spicy ginger beer and lime juice. Be warned, this drink may taste delicious, but it's quite strong.  if you're into something more sweet, I'd suggest their house margarita. It's not too strong, but also not too fruity, which is just the way I like it.  Finally, if you're into the fruity stuff, get their Cherry Bounce Collins, which tastes like a Shirley Temple infused with a little bit of liquor.  Oh and I didn't even mention their desserts yet. They have toasted marshmallow milkshakes with rumchata, pina colada Malibu milkshakes and a plethora of other alcoholic flavored milkshakes. Now don't worry, you won't even taste the alcohol because it's so faint.  And to tie everything up, their service was fantastic. The waitresses (not sure if there were waiters there, meh) were extremely nice and friendly. They were super accommodating and weren't afraid to strike a conversation with just about anyone.  Anyways, I am out of good things to say about this place, so I think I will stop there.

This place has a great atmosphere and bar for happy hour. One notable drink my dinner mates and I all enjoyed was the Shot in the Dark-- it was fragrant, funky fresh.  The food was affordable and average. Service was variable--at times speedy and then very slow, even with a sparse crowd. But the winner here is the bar.

I came here for brunch with a girlfriend after hearing good things about the bloody marys and mimosas. I ordered a mushroom egg breakfast sandwich and the diy bloody mary, and she had the turkey sausage breakfast sandwich with bottomless mimosas.  To start with the breakfast cocktails, my friend seemed to really enjoy the mimosas - she took three refills. Really sweet drinks are not my thing, but the sip I had was pleasant enough.   I had high expectations for the bloody mary bar, but was underwhelmed. While the ingredients and add-ons are ubiquitous, the cheese had obviously been sitting out all morning and seemed stale and glossy. The bacon was the "ready-to-eat" variety that I ended up leaving on my plate (it seemed like a cute novel idea at the bar, but less appetizing once I sat down and actually took a closer look at it). The vegetables were a day or so from going soft, which did not bode well for the skewers available. No one wants grape tomatoes spraying all over their white top, and no one wants browning, soft celery. The bloody mary mix itself was nice - I got the spicy mix and added a little of the plain tomato juice. The vodka they provide you with has obviously been watered down - they are cutting corners and it shows.  Moving on to the food - my friend ate her whole sandwich and thought it was delicious. I on the other hand, picked away at a quarter of mine before giving up. The bun just isn't suited for an egg-only sandwich, there needs to be more substance, even if you're rounding it out with bacon or sausage There is a reason the most breakfast sandwiches are english muffins or toasts (and some substantial croissants): they are sturdy enough to balance out the more delicate texture of eggs, vegetables, and breakfast meats. A burger bun is meant for a quarter pound of beef; it is light and fluffy to contrast the heaviness of the rest of the sandwich. The bun might have been salvageable if it was toasted, but it was a dry bun with an egg, mushroom, and some cheese slapped on.  The atmosphere and staff are good. The restaurant has comfortable booths, and plenty of chairs around the bar, which is well stocked. You can have a group that enjoys Bud Light or more unique cocktails and probably please everyone. Our waiter was helpful, explaining DLUX's concept and answering all the questions we had about the food without hovering too much.  So there are two views here, hence the three star rating. My friend LOVED everything about DLUX and can't wait to go back for their happy hour. I probably wouldn't go back unless that was what everyone was set on, and I'd think twice about cocktails if they are as watered down as my bloody mary was.

Hands-down the most mouthwatering Bloody Mary bar in town. I am salivating just  picturing it to accurately describe its glory. After you pick your poison - regular or spicy jalapeno vodka - the real fun begins. You can use their Dlux fully-loaded mix or concoct your own elixir to tickle your fancy. Try to remember not to be gluttonous (yet) because this is one of those rare times in life when you'll prefer your glass not filled to the brim with liquid. The small fixins' buffet you're about to embark on warrants its own empty glass...or casserole dish. They've got the usuals - pickles, olives, appropriate citrus wedges, etc. but the magic is in the little extras: pickled veggies, raw veggies, Wisconsin cheese cubes, perfectly sized sausages, miniature surf n turf, tiramisu, tears from a virgin, and last, but certainly not least, an epic heaping pile of greasy bacon just patiently and valiantly waiting to be consumed with gusto.   Besides the obvious embellishments (can you spot the fibs?), and all kidding aside, this is what bars in heaven must be like. Not to mention $10 bottomless - and I mean truly without bottom - mimosas that seem to refill themselves instantaneously. Don't even get me started on the sausage breakfast sandwiches and loaded breakfast potatoes...unless...how much time do you have?

This place is clearly going for an upscale, trendy vibe: Scandinavian-looking furniture and lighting, throwback pop art on the walls, clubby music playing just loud enough that you need to raise your voice a little. Interestingly, the patrons were less 'urbane hipster' as you might expect and more 'college hangover crowd'...lots of Packer/Badger apparel-clad bro-dudes talking loudly. The atmosphere was not appealing for Sunday brunch, but I toughed it out. I had a sausage breakfast sandwich with breakfast potatoes and donut balls for dessert. The food was pretty good overall, though I'm not convinced the cheese sauce on the potatoes was anything more than generic Cheez Whiz. With a soda my total was $18.44, which is about what you'd expect at this type of place, though it feels a bit high for the amount and quality of food. My server was fine. The overall experience was slightly mixed, not too bad but nothing I expect to do again any time soon, or ever really. I can say it's easily my least favorite of the several Foodfight restaurants I've experienced.

I've mostly avoided this place since I'm vegetarian, but I gave it a try after seeing their menu and a few meat-free options. I opted for the southwest white bean burger and was pretty impressed. The burger was a bit mushy but many veggie burgers are. Toppings included poblano peppers and crispy tortilla strips so there was a bit of texture to mix well with the burger.   I think it's a little pricey for what you get. If fries or a little salad came on the side it would be a better meal for the price.

I ordered delivery. The burger was still a little warm, but the sweet potato fries were cold and limp. I can't blame the restaurant for that - it was the delivery service. I enjoyed the Farmhouse Burger, if you like a big greasy burger which is what I was craving when I ordered. The bacon was super crispy - yum. I'm glad the tomato jam (more like syrup than jam) was packaged separately. I tried dipping the burger in it, and it was much too sweet for my taste. Back to those fries. I reheated them in my microwave. They were still limp but now that they were hot, they were delicious. Overall, could have been better but not bad.

Three stars feels a bit harsh, but I can't give give four stars... I had the DLUX burger, good combination of toppings but I didn't even realize until my food arrived that the waitress didn't ask me how I wanted my burger cooked. I always get medium rare, so it was disappointing that it was served medium (skimming the other reviews, it's sounding like this is a standard policy here). So for me, the burger was overlooked. We had two chicken sandwiches ordered at our table and I had a small sampling of them. Both were pretty good, but the "avocado spread" that came with one chicken sandwich was a gross dark green, barely resembling guacamole :(  I'd like to see a few more beers on tap, selection was limiting (though they did have some decent bottle selections). It would also be nice to mix up the type of bun used on the different sandwiches, that would set them apart. Overall, feels like DLUX is just a hair too expensive for what they turn out, quality isn't on par with the price.   I will say that the sweet potato fries were out of this world! Quite possibly the best I've had--crunchy on the outside but moist and tender on the inside, and the sauce served with them was a real winner. Highly recommended!

D lux decor is a welcome escape  from the Wisconsin Tavern scene around the square courtesy of Food Fight.  FF does an amazing job of creating spot on ambience and this has the elegance of a big city lounge.   No complaints with our waitress or the drinks. Now to the food, where FF often lacks.  The menu is hipster cool.  Sea salt fries and an order of blue cheese bacon fries, meh.  Barely warm and odd texture, not sure if that had to do with the lack of heat or not.  Here's where I diverge into two very different experiences from my companion.  He is a carnivore and loves burgers.  Ordered the Farmhouse burger, unfortunately you can not specify how you want it done.  He loved it. He thinks it is definitely  a top contender in the burger world.  My meal, same version but with the chicken patty. Which isn't a real piece of chicken breast, but an on-site grinding and reforming of high quality chicken, according to our waitress.  I would prefer a real chicken breast.
Terrible. worst hamburger i have ever had McDonalds muh better this is a rip off. the people that think DLUX is good are really living in a dream world

I've had the vegetarian burger twice and it was fine, not good or bad.  The fries and sauces are good. The cake milkshakes are great! But really for food, I'd only go back if friends wanted to go. Maybe this is because I'm a vegetarian. I'm not sure.  The restaurant has a nice ambiance.

I go here because it's right around the corner from my office and well, sometimes you gotta have a burger.  But, as other reviewers have said - the burger's are production-line thin and way overdone, even if you ask for rare or medium-rare.  The sauces and toppings are super-yummy, and the place would be fab if they knew how to grill.

Others have described the food well so I'll just say that it was very rich but not super flavorful.  Seemed like if it was going to be that many calories it should taste better.  As for burgers, Tip Top and Weary Traveler are both better.

I'll update this to increase it by a star. I arrived on a Saturday afternoon and there was plenty of bar seating but no tables available so I told the hostess I would wait at the bar. I was then pleasantly served by the bartender who went through the drinks and told me about their kegged specialties which are cocktails that are kegged so they dispense them like beer. I had to try it so i got the Juni-Pear. If you are a gin fan you are going to love this. Its light, fruity and fresh and delish..its also strong. which is a great deal if you're not in the mood for their unlimited mimosas on the weekend ($12)! since i was here for lunch this time instead of breakfast I ordered their green goddess salad while my friend got the farmhouse burger. Both of these were delish. I loved the light dressing on the salad and it came in a pretty big portion. The burger... well...honestly you can't really mess up a burger with an egg in it...it was amazing. and the combination of the sweet and savory were perfect.   The cheese potatoes were just okay. I would recommend the cheese fries instead because the potatoes were a little cold when they came out. But the most important update about this review is the you MUST order the chocolate pretzel milkshake. this thing is golden, thick, sweet, delicious goodness.   Happy eating!
Awesome food.  Great drinks.  Great service.  Reminds me of eating and drinking in NYC.

DLUX makes a fine burger...  ...and a fine shake.  ...and fine cheese / green onion fries  ...and a fine root beer float.  So much so that while working at an event at Monona Terrace the other night, I sent several hungry people over there.  All came back stuffed and happy.  The burger combos and quality are not too far off from what you'd find at a Red Robin, but with at atmosphere that feels much less like a restaurant chain kiddie fun-land and more like a yuppie hipster paradise.    But it's the fries.  Oh those fries.  I don't even think I saw a traditional order of french fries on the menu.  The fries offered include fries covered in cheese and green onions as well as an order covered in bacon and blue cheese, among other combinations.  Did I mention shakes?  Yeah, you CAN put booze in it if you like.  Because why wouldn't you?  The burger prices are pretty reasonable, but the drink prices sit on the border of high.    Overall, as the 4 stars would say "Yay!  I'm a fan."  It's a unique atmosphere for a burger joint, but as I said earlier, they make a fine burger.

Nothing really special about this place. The burgers were good, but then again, most burgers at nice restaurants are "good." The flavor combinations were so-so. I had the salmon burger, which was a pressed salmon patty with a fried green tomato on top. I could not taste the tomato at all--it was breaded in cornmeal and really blended into the flavor of the salmon patty (which had a little too much garlic). Also, we had the DLUX burger, which was good, but nothing special. The fries were also not my favorite. They were the thicker cut kind with the peel still on. I prefer thinner, peeled french fries. The fried pickles were yummy and so were the cheese curds, although the curds were a little expensive for the portion. This place is kinda fancy, and burgers are around $9, plus an extra $2 for fries. Shakes are anywhere from $5-6. Try it out if you want that boutique burger experience, but they need to step up their flavors a bit.

Came here on a game day and it pretty much was Mimosa central in the restaurant. I was a bit worried about it being too crowded but the staff does a pretty good job with efficient and friendly service.  I had a mushroom breakfast sandwich as well as a chocolate peanut butter pretzel shake. The mushroom was nicely cooked, juicy but still firm. I loved the shake. Not too sweet with little bits of pretzels and peanuts inside. Will definitely be back to try to the burgers.

My wife and I came here for a second time for a Tuesday night dinner. We were initially seated in a booth where most of the diners were, but they honored our request to be seated somewhere more quiet, in the far corner of the room where no one else was being seated.  Our server was Tory. She was average; not terrible, not stellar. She happily explained the specials a couple times to us because we were pretty indecisive.  We started with the fried pickles, which is always delicious. My wife ordered the Farmhouse burger (bacon, monterey jack cheese, fried green tomato, baby greens, a side of house-made tomato jam). She loved the tomato jam and dipped her burger in it. The sweetness was a nice compliment to the savory burger. She ordered a side of bleu cheese and bacon fries, and I discovered that I really don't like bleu cheese. She loves it, so she was satisfied. I ordered the special that night, which was a 1/3 lb burger crusted with black peppers and fritos...and a bunch of other stuff going on. It was good. I had a side of sharp cheddar and green onion fries, which was delicious.   We're working on trying out all the burgers on their menu and maybe even some shakes, so we'll definitely be back.

This is my favorite burger joint in Madison. I love the atmosphere and the food is always great. I don't think I've ever had a bad burger or appetizer or anything from this place and I've been coming here about once a month or more.   Even when the restaurant is packed, which is almost all the time, the service is still quick and friendly.   Make sure to come here for brunch and order the bottomless Mimosas!

Been here many times for brunch, dinner, happy hour, etc. and always enjoy my experience.  While visiting Madison this past weekend, I decided to start the weekend off right by heading to DLUX (also the wait at Old Fashioned was 2.5 hours). The wait here wasn't as bad but we decided to grab a spot at the bar since it is first come first serve.   I ordered the Standard Burger - lettuce, tomato, onions, pickles, american cheese, mayo (sub cheddar cheese, hold the mayo). Not the best burger I've ever had but it always does the trick if I'm craving a burger!  For drinks, I ordered the Whisky Smash - buffalo trace bourbon, lemon, mint, seltzer - deeelicious!  I would definitely recommend DLUX, especially for brunch (bottomless mimosas) and their 2 for 1 happy hour special.

Really the only downside of this great place is that you wish it could seat more people.  Great food, unique and cool décor, and amazing specialty items.  I'm a huge personal fan of unlimited mimosas for $10 Saturday and Sunday mornings.  The parmesan and truffle fries and red velvet milkshakes are both the best of those categories that I've ever had.  The homemade French onion dip is also phenomenal.  Every burger I had is unique and excellent.  Great date place, or just a really unique place for guests from out of town.  Sensational in a word.

Good burger! We were in Madison and heard DLUX was casual and good so we gave it a shot. It was Sunday and the packers were playing later in the day, plus Sundays are unlimited mimosa day, so it was full but not overly crowded. The wait for a table was 45 minutes but luckily 3 seats were open at the bar for us so we took that option.    Service was attentive and not overbearing. Burger was pretty great, as were the fries. Good selection of draft brews, many local.
I went for lunch.  The server was very friendly and the food was top notch.  Cheddar chive fries were to die for.  Will definitely go back.

I have nothing bad to say about DLUX. Everything I tried was delicious. The burgers were the perfect size, the sweet potato fries were amazing, and the shakes are the perfect ending to the meal. I was perfectly satisfied with my experience and would definitely suggest it if you have the opportunity.

I went here with friends and ordered the DLUX with the black bean patty. The patty was flavorful and the port-wine onion marmalade was delicious! My friends enjoyed their cheese curds, too. I would definitely be back to try another of their unique burgers.

DLUX serves up the kind of brunch atmosphere that yuppies Wisconsinites probably go nuts for. I went with a few friends on a Saturday morning. DLUX is sleek, had mimosas, and offered solid vegetarian food: what else could the forever young twenty-something, environmentally conscious, "leaning Bernie Sanders but often says some weirdly Donald Trump-ish things out loud" millennial ask for?  I ordered the mushroom sandwich: it had a portobello mushroom cap, a fried egg, swiss cheese, topped with a truffle-cream sauce. I also ordered some fried cheese curds for the table, which came with this low viscosity ranch-dill dipping sauce. The mushroom sandwich was very tasty. It was filling, affordable, and all five sandwich components worked together well. I've got nothing but high praise for the fried egg: fried eggs need to be on more sandwiches. The fried cheese curds were tasty too. The coating on the cheese curds was light, and a bit peppery. I didn't really care for the dipping sauce.  I would come back if I were looking for brunch in Madison, and probably order a mimosa too.
This place has great burgers, their cheese curds are pretty good too (nicely seasoned and come with a dill ranch). The service was timely and they have pretty good shakes too!

Husband and I went there early afternoon on Saturday Dec. 6th. Sleek decor. Sat at the window so we didn't have to wait. We could tell some people were taking full advantage of the bottomless mimosas and they got loud.   We didnt do the Bloody Mary bar, but it looked like the deluxe model: olives, veggies, salami, cheese! I had the a Wisconsin Brewing Co. Porter--pretty good. Husband had the peanut butter chocolate pretzel shake and he says it was incredible. I liked the flavor, but I tend to not like gritty textures in ice cream.  The Reuben burger (only a special) was excellent tasting but could have used slightly more corned beef and less sauerkraut. The ratio was just a bit off. Very juicy and well done. The sweet potato fries were some of the best I've had. Large cut so you can taste the potato. Sriracha mayo wasn't very spicy but added a contrast tang to the fries. Backyard BBQ burger with a chicken burger substitute was my husband's choice and he liked it. He ordered the Parmesan fries and they were really covered with the white cheese sauce.

I'm honestly torn between a 4 and 5 because 5("perfect") seems really unrealistic for anywhere I've been.   Greats 1. Saturday/Sunday brunch stuff. 10am-3pm. I feel like I shouldn't even be saying it because it's already pretty busy and I imagine it'll only be busier this summer. It's annoying to try to get a seat  sometimes but its not due to lack of space..just incredible popularity at the moment..   2. Bloody Mary Bar. Awesome fun for Bloody Mary fans. $8 adds up quick but it honestly feels fair due to the quality of the ingredients and the mix.  3. $10 botomless Mimosas.  4. Food Entrees. I'm a vegetarian so I don't share some of the concerns that others have had. I've had both the meatless options that are offered in the "sorta burgers". I can tell they have a good taste and an emphasis on minimalistic/fresh ingredients. I wouldn't say I enjoy them as much as something like Red Robin but I can tell they're "better for me". The southwest bean one might be a tad too spicy for me and I actually tend to like hot food.  5. Food Desserts. The donuts with the strawberry glaze was good. Probably the most gluttonous thing I've gotten at a restaurant but awesome.   6. Music - Someone likes Rooney? :P

Bland bland bland - extra bland. I'm pretty surprised, usually places over season their food imo - not here!   The fried pickles were really good, however the chicken burger and french fries were somehow flavorless. I think this place would benefit from having some sauces on top of the burger - it's like  McDonalds chicken nuggets you know? They have no flavor as well unless you dunk it in sauce. That's how the chicken burgers are like here, not bad - just flavorless.

To quote Sam Jackson:  "DAMN! Now THAT is a tasty burger!"  But seriously though, DLUX has great burgers, fabulous apps (sweet potato fries that actually taste GOOD!), and super friendly staff. I'd go back in a heartbeat.  OK OK, so I'm a Chicago expate, and I have some expectations on what a burger and a beer should cost. Every single gastro pub style burger joint in Madison has been just wild and crazy cheap. DLUX is no exception, you'll be in and out for under 20, which is just absurd for where I'm from.

DLUX is one of my favorite restaurants in madison. It is one of my late-night-and-I'm-starving go-to spots. It's also great for family dinners, dates... You name it.  Drinks:  They have some amazing mixed cocktails, but the beer is the shining star. All craft beers on tap (some domestic/imported non-craft, and other craft beers by the bottle). Feel free to sample to find the one you love.  Food:  There are only 4 appetizers, but that's a the cheese curds are pretty freaking amazing.  Also the buffalo chicken nachos are probably one of my favorite things to get.  The burgers are all excellent, and make sure to ask your server (or usually in my case your bartender) about their burger and shake of the month. It changes each month.  The burgers are all unique, my two favorites being the DLUX burger and the green chile burger.  Also during the fall, the Harvest Burger is amazing.  The shakes are all Sassy Cow Creamery, and I have yet to find one I don't like, plus a free shake on your birthday.  Also, ask your bartender about making it boozy, they usually have some good recommendations, and its only $3 extra.  Service:   I've never in all the times I've eaten at DLUX had anything but spectacular service.

Bottomless mimosasss... truly, do I need to say more? Your limit is two hours, which is actually quite shorter than you might think. But some of the servers really work hard to help you out. I observed a guy, with six minutes left, downing a glass and then holding it up to be refilled after the server had refilled the others' at the table... and she did refill his again. The countdown continued, and he kept drinking.   The food was so excellent. We had the donut holes, the fried pickles, and the fried cheese curds. And truly the only complaint I had over any of those things was that there were only a few curds. Like maybe six or eight.. the fried pickle quantity was good though. So many, so warm, so crunchy... I wish I had them in my life right now again today.   I also had the parm and truffle cream potatoes, and split the spicy sausage sandwich and the Portobello mushroom sandwich. The Portobello was a total winner. Not entirely sure if I loved the sausage one though. The meat felt.. softer than I expected. But it tasted good nonetheless. And the food came out quick enough.  The atmosphere is fun--it's a little loud though. Not sure if that's due to the music or because everyone is drunk, but it definitely isn't a place for intimate conversation... not that you'd be doing that over bottomless mimosas.   One stars docked for the weirdest thing I've ever seen happen to someone in my party. My friends and I all paid separately, and one friend didn't tip much...like less than 10% I think. Not sure why, but by the time the check came, my head was pretty fuzzy because mimosas. And the servers came over to her, and asked her what they needed to do better and if anything was wrong with their service. It was hella awkward for everyone witnessing that conversation. My friend has been a server. I know a ton of people who have or were. And I eat out a lot... and I have never witnessed that happen ever, to anyone. (I always tip 15% minimum). Anywho, that was just a baffling experience.

I am a huge fan of brunch, and my obsession with it only grows when I come to DLUX.  Their weekend brunch menu, with unlimited mimosas and bloody mary bar is a perfect way to celebrate the weekend.   The atmosphere here is hip and trendy, but not in a way that is uncomfortable.  It draws a young crowd but by that I mean young professionals, not just the college folks.  Weekend brunch times are packed here, but that is probably because everyone else loves this place as much as I do.   Favorite Item on the Menu: Their shakes are to die for.  My favs are the red velvet or the Chocolate Peanut Butter Pretzel.

Awesome late night hang out if you're wanting good American food! The service was wicked slow, but the food and drinks were great. I highly recommend any of their gin and tonics. I can't wait to go back and get a milkshake!

Met some good friends here after work on a Friday a while back. Sat outside on the 'patio' seating in front. Very nice area and the weather was excellent - so that didn't hurt.   After a few beers which were outstanding - we tried a few items from their menu. We shared the Cheesy Spinach & Artichoke option from the Apps. Veggies and garlic crostini with a nice dip. I'm not a big broccoli fan, so I stuck with the carrots and crostini. It was good, not great but decent.   Then we tried a few burgers. I got the Sunrise - fried egg, pepperjack cheese, housemade tomato jam and shoestring potatoes. It was really excellent - the tomato jam was a bit odd - but definitely unique and yummy. The bun was very fresh and the burger was top notch. I hope to try more of their burgers down the road.   Some of our friends tried their shakes. Guess they had them before and raved about the Chocolate Peanut Butter Pretzel shake. Didn't try but it looked good.

Had a great experience when trying DLux last weekend! My husband and I were excited to find a restaurant near the capitol with good food at a decent price and fun atmosphere. We each had a burger and split an order of the green onion fries, and were not disappointed. The flavor of our burgers and the fries was amazing. Just wish the location was a bit bigger, as we were seated at a table right next to another table, about a half arm-length away, and it was difficult to have our own conversations and sit comfortably. Service could have been better, as our waitress was very slow with taking our order, refilling our waters, and bringing us the bill, but the food was so good we will definitely be returning.

Visited DLUX with my wife for a late night Saturday dinner when passing though the Madison area. First off, the ambiance was awesome. The decor is very modern and the lighting is very cool. I also noticed the excellent music playlist that was going, it sounded just like a playlist that I would have put together. The music was loud enough to create a mood, but quiet enough as to not make conversation difficult at the table.  The food was also excellent. I got a mushroom and swiss burger that was fantastic. Truffle fries...also fantastic. My wife got the Green Goddess salad, which she very much enjoyed.  Good service and reasonably priced. Would definitely go back!

My son and I both had the Spicy Hawaiian and split a large order of sweet potato fries with Sriracha mayo, and all the food  was excellent. We sat at the bar and also for great service. The bartender missed my beer on the ticket, so I just added $5 to the tip to cover it.   Our only mistake was coming in at the end of the Saturday brunch, because everyone was drunk on unlimited mimosas, and the noise was almost unbearable.

I would come here for brunchfor their unlimited mimosas, but if you're looking for real brunch food: eggs, Benedict, scrambles, etc..I would pass. they have good burgers and breakfast sandwiches, but I usually prefer a Benedict or scrambler for brunch. If you go for dinner... Their burgers are goooodddd

Definitely coming back here.  Great burgers, good size and good price. Awesome sweet potato fries and shakes. Fries aren't included in the price of the burger. Menu is simple.  It's a bit dark and kind of loud, but that seems to go with the good restaurants downtown.

This burger place is wildly creative on its flavor use on burgers. If you like the same old traditional burger place, you could just as easily go to dotty's. (Not that they won't make those traditional burgers here too.) THAT BEING SAID, they have great GREAT burgers here. Their burgers are amazing and combine flavors like no other burger place I've been before. Definitely give it a try. I recommend the farmhouse.

Going into DLUX I was not quite sure what to expect, but thinking Madison burger joint I assumed the typical, decent grass fed beef served at many places around the square. I was pleasantly surprised to find something very unique to the area. The flavors are fresh and the atmosphere is somewhat big city without the high prices. While I'm excited to go back to try everything else on the menu, it will be hard to stray from the amazing DLUX burger with cheddar and green onion fries.  The burgers hold that perfect amount of charbroiled flavor while leaving room for some incredible topping choices. Aside from the food, the drink menu is also worth a trip in itself. The Hawaii 5-0, made with a DLUX-made strawberry soda, was a refreshing flavor that I will be revisiting soon. Last but certainly not least the shakes are a perfect ending to the meal. Featuring different flavors such as toasted marshmallow and red velvet the menu is truly complete with these dessert additions. I think that my favorite part about this restaurant is that it is extremely versatile...I could pop in at lunch for a burger, fry and shake, stop in after work for a drink and the game or take it a step up at night for a classy, affordable date night.

I've been here quite a few times, only for lunch or dinner. I usually order the green goddess salad. I am a big fan of the ambiance and service I usually get here.   My one piece of advice here: definitely order the loaded fries! My favorite is the blue cheese & bacon.  It's never wowed me,but I've never left disappointed or hungry, so what more can you really ask for?

We have been frequent customers at Dlux for both dinner and brunch. Hands down, they have the best cheese curds in Madison. We often tell people this and they argumentatively and adamantly disagree. Then the next time we meet they confess and tell us how they re-ordered another round of curds.  Anything Dlux does that includes cheese is very good.   We also really enjoy brunch. Not only do they have amazing sandwiches (for cheese fanatics) but their espresso milk shake is surprisingly good.   The reason I took 1 star off is due to Dlux switching their burger recipe. Dlux used to have the absolute best moderate priced burger in town. My fiancée and I got "the standard" every time we visited along with their great sweet potato fries. While the fries are still amazing something changed with their burger patty sometime in late 2015 that made the burger taste different. We've encountered a handful of other couples that noticed the same thing. Really hope they bring back their old patty.   I really wish I could give them 3.5 stars. I would take half a star off for their cocktail menu and selection. We love craft cocktails but Dlux isn't strong in that department.   My recommendations if you go there. Cheese curds, a burger of your choice with sweet potato fries and finish it off with one of their specialty shakes. If their fortune cookie shake is on the menu first order one...then make sure to message me. We miss it.

The DLUX burger is amazing, as well as the cheddar cheese and green onion fries! So delicious. Their milkshakes are scrumptious! You really can't go wrong with anything here. Love their monthly burgers and shakes.
Super delicious burgers, stellar kegged cocktails and awesome late-night happy hour specials. The sweet potato fries are my favorite. They also have boozey milkshakes. Yum.

I am not a meat burger person, but the Green Goddess salad at DLUX is often one of my go-to's. The french fries are always cooked fantastically (surprising how many places in the area don't cook them very well) and the milkshakes are some of the absolute best I've ever had. I actually prefer them without the booze, but a boozy milkshake is never something to complain about. They've always had a good selection of beers, and I always am meaning to try their veggie burgers but I just can't stop ordering the salad... I'll get there someday. Gets very loud and busy on weekend nights and for the lunch crowd, but at the quieter times it's a great spot if you're downtown.

We were drawn in by their $12 bottomless mimosas, which was nice! However, their food was sub-par. Their "fried chicken and waffles" was a fried, once frozen, chicken nugget patty and their waffle was small and made of generic batter. I would rather spend the extra couple bucks on mimosas at another restaurant.

Really disappointed with the burgers.  We went to Doty Dumplings Dowry but there was a half hour wait so we decided to try a new place... Big mistake.   The red velvet shake was good.  The onion dip chip appetizer was good.  We ordered two cocktails including the Hawaii 5-0 and found them both terribly sweet.  Now... The sad part...  The burgers were over cooked and not very good quality.  They never asked how we wanted the burgers cooked so I'm left to believe everything is cooked like a hockey puck?  I tried the salmon burger.  It was good, but not good enough to compensate for the burger fail.  Next time... Going to Doty Dumplings Dowry!!

Tori is an amazing server. We can always get a table, especially before trivia night! Awesome boozy pretzel milkshake. The cheese curds and buffalo nachos are amazing. The salmon burger rocks! Come here for Moscow mules!
Great burgers and fries. Drink selection is poor and over priced. Nice place to grab a quality burger in style. Service is adequate, if you go alone though prepare to be mostly ignored.
Very fast and good service. Good burger but the cheddar green onion fries were delicious

Good drinks and good brunch food. I've been here twice for the Weekend Recovery and once for late-night drinks. It's always good service, good people, good food; however, my only qualm is that it's so small! This means that the wait is always long and the bar area is usually packed. I hate not being able to move when out at a bar for casual drinks, so that's an issue. Their drinks are so yummy, though, that it's easy to forgive. I would suggest trying the Sugar Mama - delicious grapefruit!  Would come here for dinner and drinks or midday brunch on a weekend.

Everything we ordered was amazing, staff was nice, decore was great.  There's nothing on the menu I wouldn't eat and I'm definitely going back.  The portions are perfect - just enough to be filling but not ridiculously huge.  And the prices are definitely right, especially for the quality and location.  Highly recommended.

Hip yet friendly, affordable yet delicious. Doesn't happen often, but I found all of the above at Dlux.   Fries, burgers, cocktails- everything I tried was great. I can't wait to go back and try a shake.  Oh, and call on your way over- they'll put your name on the wait list. We arrived at 8pm on a Saturday and were seated immediately. Can't beat that!

Ok, about a month late with this review.  Went on a Friday with friends before concert on the rooftop.  Fantastic house drinks!   Great beer selection, includin gluten free. Apps were as good as the drinks.  Burgers!  Dlux was great.  Quick late review.  Five stars.
The food is great and he staff is really friendly! The big draw here are the boozy milkshakes which are so amazing!  Combine that with some truffle fries and that makes for a wonderful evening!
YES.  1. Creative burgers 2. Crispy fries 3. Tasty housemade sodas 4. Trivia night  I wish I lived in WI because I'd be here all the damn time.

I live for how swanky and sophisticated the interior is. You never would expect this to be a burger joint considering the look of the restaurant or the formal uniforms the staff wear. Feels kind of nice mowing down on a cheeseburger in what looks to be a 5 star restaurant. Too bad it doesn't quite fit the bill. It's more like a 3.  The service was hit and miss. Nothing special. The staff mingled with one another most of the evening at the bar. Had to ask for refills. Service wasn't really engaging, but rather monotone.   The food was alright. I had the Sunrise Burger. Although I can see why people would enjoy it, it honestly wasn't my thing. The tomato jam was much too sweet and overpowered the burger. When I found bites without the jam, it tasted as if it was from the dollar menu at McDonald's, really. The sharp cheddar and green onion fries were my meals saving grace. All aside, you can't beat the prices here. Burgers are only $8 with a small side of specialty fries being $3. A dinner date for two only cost 29 bucks not including tip.  In the end I think I'm gonna go venture to the gazillion other restaurants in the area, and then perhaps I'll come back to DLUX again for another try.

Good burgers, great prices. The fries were soaked in a cheese sauce so we only ate the top half. Between the bartender constantly tucking in her shirt and scooping ice with a glass it grossed me out. Especially after watching the news about exactly that.

Nice brunch, Bloody Mary bar, all u can drink mimosa, etc. awesome donuts with strawberry cream sauce. Awesome specialty burgers. Smaller portion sizes. Good enough to make you want to go back again eventually, but not an absolute favorite, go-to, regular, good ole standby place. Slightly pretentious imo in terms of thinking they are greater than they are. Don't get me wrong, very good, but not the best ever.

I often grab lunch in this cool and modern restaurant.  I've never had a bad meal here and the service is always top notch.  If you have calories to spare, try one of their specialty shakes.  Oh, and the sweet potato fries are heavenly!

Yes, you can get a good meatless meal here.  I'm going to tell you how.  Order the white bean burger.  Have you ever had a white bean burger?  Neither had I.  Your average vegetarian has eaten far more soy burgers, black bean burgers, and pressed vegetable patties (which are gross) than they care to count.  But I had never seen a white bean burger.    Now you also want some sriracha mayo.  It comes with the sweet potato fries.  The sweet potato fries are good, but you're really after the mayo.    Ready?  Okay, now you're going to put the sriracha mayo on the white bean burger.  Take a bite.  You're welcome.    The white bean burger by itself is nowhere near as exciting as it sounds on the menu.  It's good, but it's not amazing.  But, with the addition of the sriracha mayo, you have yourself a mighty fine burger.  I sincerely believe that the burger should come with the sriracha mayo by default.

The food here is incredible! Delicious. Unique. Made with true craft. And it won't break the bank to grab brunch, lunch, dinner, drinks, apps or shakes! Whatever you are in the mood for, you will find it here at DLUX!

Went here for brunch today. The donuts were awesome, the sweet potato fries were awesome, and the sriracha mayo was awesome. The sunrise burger was a little strange because it was too sweet. The Parmesan truffle cream fries were too saucy and got kind of soggy. The sausage breakfast sandwich was good but nothing special. For the prices, the food was very good. The bottomless mimosa deal is really good.

We ended up here Memorial Day morning because our first choice (Marigold Kitchen) was closed...I can't recommend this place to vegans but the meals our friends had looked great. Your typical vegan options are salads and fries. They don't offer dairy-free creamer?. When I asked if they had any our waitress wasn't sure and said she'd check, then she never brought the sugar or normal creamer. The coffee was diner coffee as one of my friends commented on and sugar didn't help. (At least it was only 2.50).  My partner had the Thai sesame salad and enjoyed it. We also had a full order of the fries which were good but I definitely wanted a breakfast item which wasn't available for our lifestyle. I had an order of the plain breakfast potatoes for $2. Basically just fried potatoes which seemed dry and flavorless. Others had them smothered in Blu cheese and cheddar cheese which didn't seem any more interesting.  Others in our group had the spicy sausage egg sandwich, and two eggs Benedict I think. Both boys finished their Benedict's but my friend didn't finish her sausage sandwich. I think I heard her say it was too greasy. What with fried egg, oily sausage and a buttered bun I can agree.   Service could have been better. As I mentioned I had to ask a few times for sugar and cream. Coffee we had to wait for refills and she was constantly asking us if she could get anything else about every five minutes.   Overall our bill was cheap because we had to order a la carte.  2.5/5

My husband and I went to Madison for a trip and I was excited to try cheese curds. I ordered mushroom & swiss melt chicken burger and my husband ordered Margherita Chicken. They were both amazing, if you like slightly sweet flavors go with mushroom & swiss melt. You can get any of their burgers with chicken or with portabella mushroom. Ofcourse we also had Cheese curds. O-M-G yes come to mama! They are food orgasm.  Just saying... The restaurant itself is very posh looking bar meets restaurant. I will say must try if you are in the area. Enjoy!

I definitely want to come back and try more food here. Trust me, you'll want to do the same.   French Onion Dip - House-made chips and French onion dip. This is absolutely amazing and a great choice for a starter. It's going to pack some flavor while not filling so heavy as you wait for your burger.    Cheese curds - A little heavier appetizer but it's definitely worth getting. Very cheesy which is all you can ask for.   Frito Bandito Burger - Roasted poblanos, cream cheese, white cheddar, Fritos and bacon. I chose this one although I couldn't really make up my mind. I was thoroughly impressed however. So much flavor and the bacon added a nice crispy element. I always asked for a side of aioli if they have it. I enjoyed it.   Fries - The Parmesan & truffle cream fries were my favorite while the sharp cheddar and green onion fries were also good.

Ate outside here during the Art Fair and had some really good food and service. I had the Margherita chicken sandwich which was fairly big and full of flavor. Nice bun as well. My friend had the southwest chicken salad which was equally good. Sandwich came with chips that were very good too.

Let me start by saying: the burgers were great.  We called ahead to be placed on their "waiting list" since they do not accept reservations. A table was open for us when we arrived, and after a few minutes of waiting for a host or manager we were seated. We waited a while longer for a waitress.  We had cheese curds - which were amazing with hints of cracked black pepper. Two of us tried the soup de jour, which was a beer cheese. It had dill and a variety of other herbs in it which made it interesting but it was a loose base and pretty chunky. Not my favorite. Three of us had burgers and one had a chicken sandwich. The burgers were all great. Juicy and cooked perfectly. The patties were a little small for the buns, but that can be overlooked. Mine was the DLUX - With arugula, marinated onions and a bleu cheese spread. I also had their hand cut Parmesan and Truffle Cream fries which were on point. (Fries and other sides are not included with your burger - they are a small up-charge.)  My biggest complaint about this restaurant was service. I did not feel like anyone greeted us or that anyone cared we were there. The burgers were great, but overall we felt like outsiders. We may give it another shot sometime to see if service is better.

Thought it was in general an okay spot for burger and shake in town.  The interior of Dlux has a nice and modern looking. It extends to an outdoor patio which is great for summer time. The seating was comfortable. Staff was very pleasant. I got a Dlux burger and their seasonal shake. I also had a side of cole slaw and sweet potato fries. I like their shake, and it was an okay burger. For a menu that serves only burgers as entrees  I would expect their burgers to be more than an okay. Cole slaw was alright, and what came out surprising, was how great their sweet potato fries ! If that pair with a better burger, I would think I would have enjoyed that even more.

Saturday lunch on the Square - a very pleasant option with NO waiting, a low noise level and great burgers! The menu says ALL burgers are 8 dollars. note - there are no sides included, so the burger comes looking a little bit lonely on the plate. but that is OK. The Salmon burger with wasabi mayo and a jicama/carrot slaw was delish. The bun was mildly whole wheat and slightly warmed. The Bloody Mary was VERY GOOD- and very pretty, with a sword of olives and pickles. I called that my salad!! I will go back to try more burger choices and some of the sides, like the sweet potato fries seen at a neighboring table. they looked awesome. Service was quick and pleasant.  The space is modern and well- Spacious. The "game" was on - but the sound was OFF - Thank you so much!! I confess I am one of those people in this town who is NOT totally into the football thing.

This place is excellent for bottomless mimosas and the do-it-yourself bloody mary bar. However, the burger was not as good as other local Madison establishments and I did not really enjoy the truffle cream fries.

Slightly upscale burger place near the capitol.  Nice decor, courteous wait staff.  My issue with the burgers is that they cook them all to well-done.  There's full disclosure of this policy on the menu, but my burger was VERY well-done, much more so than I would have liked.  The parmesan truffle fries were quite good, as were the sweet potato fries.  The shakes were nothing to write home about, I had the peanut butter pretzel shake and it was kind of unappetizing after the first half a dozen swallows.  Our waitress dropped off the bill and then disappeared for half an hour.  We didn't mind, they had the Badgers game on, but it wasn't quick to pay and leave.    The prices are maybe a little high for what you get, but it's not bad.  We would probably only go there again with a big group to watch the game.

I went for lunch with my wife. She had a burger, I had a chicken sandwich. Both were fresh and tasted good. The blue cheese bacon fries were freaking awesome.   Lastly the shakes were delicious. I'm not one to put a lot of odd stuff in my shake. They were very accommodating when I asked them to omit an ingredient. My wife got shake as is. Both were GREAT.   I was skeptical of this place initially, but was glad I went. We'll definitely go back.

I went for brunch on a Sunday.   Had the bacon egg sandwich, regulars breakfast potatoes. My friend also got a chocolate peanut butter pretzel milkshake.   Egg sandwich was okay. Description said fried egg, which I usually take to mean a non runny yoke, but apparently I'm wrong. The bun is super soft and just becomes soggy. Im not looking to have another one anytime soon. I'm from the east coast where breakfast sandwich are a way of life, so my standards might just be higher.   The breakfast potatoes were awesome. They are deep fried, which I liked but my friend did not. Just a matter of preferences.   The milkshake was hands down outrageously delicious.   Service was great. I'm only giving three stars because I was not impressed and was expecting a more classic brunch spot.

Honestly, I'm teetering between 3 and 4 stars. I wish Yelp gave half stars (I say this every time), but I'm going to round down on this one. Went to DLux for the first time this past weekend. I don't really like their motto of "General Swank" or whatever it is--seems a bit pretentious. However, Food Fight is usually pretty solid (save for Bluephies), so this was worth a shot.  I got the farmhouse burger, which was monterrey jack cheese, bacon, a fried green onion and a side of tomato jelly. The jelly was pretty awesome--I think it may have had curry or garam masala in it--I couldn't quite pinpoint the flavors. Fried green tomato was so-so--pretty bland, actually. Now, the burgers--they don't let you specify doneness. This annoyed me to no end, because ALL the burgers are well done. I prefer some flavor in mine, so it was a let down overall.  Redemption: The cheese and green onion fries? Wow. Fantastic. Some of the best I've had in the area.   Overall? 3 stars. Would I go back? Yes, they certainly deserve another chance. I just want some more imagination and flavor punches in my burger.

Good burgers, good prices, strange little restaurant.  Burgers are a little bit blander than they should be, which would be easily remedied with a hotter skillet and better sear on the burgers. But the 'farmhouse' with a fried green tomato was fun and came with an OK tomato chutney, and the 'standard' was standardly good. The burger with corned beef was verging on great but was super duper salty. And for those who are considering non-red meat options, the whitefish sandwich was fine and did the trick, though not much better than that.   For $2 you can get a bowl of fries with béchamel-based toppings. The blue cheese with bacon was pretty good but lacked blue cheese. Similarly, the truffle-parmesan fries are literally a stroke of cheese-sauce genius, brought back to remedial quality by not having enough truffle flavor.   The housemade soda with grapefruit and lime is another great idea, but like the béchamel fries it was much blander than it should have been. I liked it, but a stronger hit of either grapefruit or lime would have made for a destination drink instead of shtick.  The dining room has a full-on identity crisis. It's so dark you can barely see your table and full of faux-pop-art, yet it's populated by children drinking milkshakes and old people. It's occupied by a gigantic bar in the middle of the room that easily loses the restaurant 10 additional tables, yet prices are surprisingly low and there's a big wait for seating.   Overall I like the concept though this place doesn't excel in any specific category except for Wisconsin eccentricity.
Good solid burger, some creative plates. Limited menu, good value, convenient location. Amazing decor. Great fries!

Overall: Great brunch experience! Bottomless mimosas and unhealthy food are a great mix.  The good: Great tasting food and presented well. Great brunch specials too. The service was excellent and friendly and attentive. The atmosphere is clean and modern and welcoming.   The bad: Not too much, maybe a tad too expensive for the amount of food and the quality. Still great. Sides are a la cart.   Atmosphere: 9/10 Service: 9/10 Food: 8/10

Young, artsy atmosphere that is welcoming to all. The service was fantastic each and every time I have been there, regardless of how busy it was.   The portobello caprese sandwich is phenomenal, especially paired with truffle fries and a red velvet milkshake!  Can't go wrong here: there are options for everyone, the price is right, and the service and atmosphere are splendid.

I come here fairly often because, come on, who can pass up a bottomless mimosa or a darn good bloody Mary bar on the reg? Today, however, I've found out I've been doing it all wrong. I used to get the spicy sausage with the truffle and parmesan potatoes. Pretty great, very happy. But yesterday, since I knew I was going to be coming back today, I thought I would mix it up a little.   Chicken fried chicken. Oh. My. Goodness. It's SPOT ON. Fried egg, perfectly fried chicken, and just the right seasoning to make it mouth watering. I've now had it two days in a row and it's been just great. I've found a new favorite breakfast sandwich in Madison!  I only subtract a star because, man, the wait gets INTENSE on the weekends. But they are pretty good at managing the flow. Just remember that they don't seat until everyone is there! This isn't a place to lie and say you have 8 when you really have 10 either-don't incur the wrath.

Finally got a chance to try their burgers here. Not disappointed! The cheese curds and fried pickles were a good way to kick off the meal. The sharp cheddar and green onion fries were amazing as well--the cheese wasn't too much and I found myself scraping the bottom of the bowl to clean it up. Mmmm cheese!  I'm a sucker for mushroom and swiss burgers so that was a no-brainer for me: the truffle cream sauce was a bit messy to eat with but it gave the burger a bit more of a flavor than usual.   My brother enjoyed his DLUX burger--he's not a fan of arugula, but he didn't mind it on this one. He actually thought that it was needed. Go figure!  My fiance ordered the Sunrise burger, which he thought it was unusual that there was tomato jam. But he LOVED it. He thought it actually gave it the kick it had--but he wished that the fried egg wasn't so overdone. He wanted some of that yolk dripping off the burger with each bite.   Overall, definitely a place to eat burgers. Maybe when there's room in our bellies we'll try some of their shakes.

This is easy, 5 STARS. I had to go to Madison so i jumped on Yelp to see what i could find for dinner, and i saw some of the reviews for this place and decided to check it out.  Let's start with the location this is right down town Madison just a few doors down from the Capitol so if you have never seen it, there's something else you can do. DLUX is kind of small but has a little out door seating. First time here was Friday night, had to wait about 20 minutes for a table but while we waited we saw the amazing looking burgers going out to other customers, i got excited to say the least.  We sat down and our server Tory (which was great btw) told us what the restaurant was about and what they do there, We started off with an order of Cheese Curds, and i don't know what it is about Madison but every place I've been too in Madison makes awesome curds, this place is no exception. MUST TRY! I decided to try the Sunrise burger (pepper jack cheese, bacon and egg and tomato jam, let's talk about the Tomato jam for a second, I HATE tomatos so i got this on the side and thought i'd try it, and it was delicious! ) it was awesome, one of the top 5 burger places i've been too... come to think of it i need to actually make a list of them...anyway. My fiance got the spicy grilled pineapple chicken burger and she loved it, i even tried a few bites and it was good, the homemade seasoned chips were good, and we also ordered the Parmesan and truffle cream french fries which are very rich but are awesome. At the end of the meal the server told us about the milkshakes they have, and said this months special was the PB&J Shake, my Fiances eyes lit up and got that, i did some salted carmel pretzel shake and that was pretty good, though my fiance wouldn't stop raving about the PB&J Shake.    We enjoyed this place so much we decided to come back sunday for more, and will be back again soon!

Great atmosphere and they have a vast array of menu options that they have mastered. I recommend the burgers, they usually have some pretty good deals on them either tuesday or wends, or maybe its thursday? Who knows! Figure it out place is great fuck yeah.  This is my second favorite food fight concept. Unlike their usual MO, they didn't try overly hard to be cute/gimmicky/authentic etc. with the space and they ended up doing a really good job on it. In terms of the food executions, all of the burgers are great and they usually have pretty good deals throughout the week. The booze milkshakes are highly lauded around town but they don't have one made with RumChata (which is a no brainer, how'd they over look that right!?) and I think they're a little more popular then they are well executed (the shakes I mean, not the establishment).

I've been to Dlux quite a few times now and have always had a positive experience. I really like the burgers, (I usually end up deciding between the Sunrise and the White Fish & Shrimp) but the star of the meal for me is always a side of sweet potato fries! They are just so tasty and I can't get enough of the sriracha aioli. Brunch has also been a consistently good experience!

On food, DLUX feels like a four, but on atmosphere, a two. The place attracts a pretty young, drunk, and loud clientele that makes it really difficult to enjoy the admittedly decent burgers and shakes. It felt like a cattle call the other day when we went late during brunch (2 p.m.) and struggled to have a conversation over the din wrought by gaggles of college girls downing their bottomless mimosas. Yeah, I sound like an old fogey. But really folks, if you're 30 or older, stop by on an off hour to enjoy the delicious milkshakes. My favorite is the toasted marshmallow, but the special shamrock shake for St. Patty's day is a close second. Beyond that, the burgers are pretty good, if a bit pricy for their petite size and lack of fries. (Fries are average, all told.) For burgers, I will stick to Mickey's Tavern for the time being.

Came in from Indianapolis and found this place to eat on a Sunday. Madison apparently goes pretty hard for brunch, so I was happy to be seated right away.   My girlfriend and I ordered cheese curds and milkshakes to start, which were great, and the burgers we had were excellent as well.   Despite being in unfriendly territory (we're Chicago Bears fans and came in wearing jerseys), the service was excellent. Definitely would recommend folks from out of town to go check this place out if they're looking for something good and reasonably priced in the downtown Madison area.

Decent burgers. Not especially juicy. Slow, inattentive service this time. Our drink orders were completed and ready at the bar long before the waitress retrieved them for us. Taco burger patty was nicely seasoned, but the cilantro spread was bland. My family liked the farmhouse and BBQ burgers. Casual, classy atmosphere.

We went for a quick lunch yesterday- we've been on the hunt for the best burger in Madison....the hunt is still on.  DLUX had a nice looking bar and atmosphere but the restaurant was thick with flies.  It was pretty gross and a borderline appetite-loser.    We had the caramel pecan shake, cheddar onion fries and green chile burger.  Good selections- the shake was full of actual pecans and delicious.  The consistency of the cheese on the fries was perfect and they tasted freshly cut.  The burger was good too-nice balance of ingredients.  So we might try again in the dead of winter when they fly population dies down but for now we're still on the best burger hunt......

4 stars for food, 3.5 for service. If you're in the mood for an indulgent brunch, this is the place for you. Rich and cheesy breakfast sandwiches and loaded potatoes are definitely worth coming for. If you're going for the bottomless mimosa I would recommend sitting at the bar; sitting anywhere else doesn't promise you the type of "bottomless" you might expect. Sitting along the front it took the waitress a good long while to realize the glass was empty (even while trying to get her attention) and once she noticed, it took her even longer to bring a refill. Didn't try any other drinks but the bloody mary looked delicious. Overall good experience here.

Been here 6 or 7 times...they specialize in burgers, but only cook thin patties at one temp. Odd. I often go for the salads, which are solid. Love the decor and the feel, but often have to wait for a booth or table. Many young people. The atmosphere is fun, especially with young weekend crowd drinking bottomless mimosas...not a place to go for a quiet brunch after church :-)
Awesome burgers, best dessert shakes (red velvet shake with vodka!!!), and even better service!  You guys rock!!!

Wow, so I received a comment about by poor review.  It explained that the champagne, which I did not like, sells for $100+.  It is funny that people believe because costs a great deal then it must be good.    I am clearly offended that because I wrote in a review that I did not like the flavor, a business would remind me of its cost.  Please read with sarcasm: If something has a large price tag then it must be good.  Not to mention none of the other issues mentioned were addressed.

Looking for a fun date night spot? Or a place to catch a bite and some drinks before catching a show with friends? Then DLUX is the place. The decor makes it feel like something you'd find downtown Chicago, definitely more swanky than what you'd expect to find just off the square in Madison. The burgers are good, not really anything to write home about. The topping combinations are interesting (side note: they'll happily remove items from a burger but will not do substitutions) The sides and appetizers are just made for sharing. The Cheesy Spinach Artichoke Dip was really yummy and its great that it comes with veggies and garlic toasts for a little variety. The sweet potato fries were good as well and my boyfriend seemed quite pleased with his fries smothered in bacon and blue cheese. The salted caramel pecan was delicious as well. I'm still a little on the fence about having nuts in a milkshake though.

If you're here for the bar, you'll probably enjoy yourself. I was pretty let down by the food, though.   The host was very courteous and even allowed our party of 5 to squeeze into a 4-top to avoid a long wait. Our server was pretty good, but service got slower and spotty as the evening went on. It was a busy Friday night, but it still shouldn't take 20 minutes just to find someone to ask for a check. The dining room was intolerably loud and small.   I got the black bean veggie burger. The toppings were very good, but the texture of the burger and bun were lacking. The buns didn't contribute much of anything to the meal besides holding everything together, and I am curious if they are house made or packaged.   My dining partners enjoyed their selections, and I sampled a few. The salmon patty was ok, but not as flavorful as I had hoped. The beef burgers were cooked medium to medium well and had a nice flavor of their own, but got a bit lost in all the toppings and huge fluffy buns. The fried chicken burger with pimento and pickles was the one item that I would return to order, that was done very well and had many interesting flavors.   Our appetizer of french onion dip and kettle chips was quite good, but I probably wouldn't order it again honestly. At the end of the day, chips and dip is still chips and dip. The soup of the day was parsnip bisque, and it was the only item on the table that wasn't eaten up. It was cloyingly sweet and seemed a far cry from crisp tangy parsnips -- more like a chowder than a bisque.   Sweet potato fries were cooked nicely, and the accompanying spicy mayo was nice. But again, it's pretty much like any other hip burger joint with sweet potato fries. The house made sodas were nice, but just too sugary for my taste. A friend agreed that if they were to use less sweetener or simply have an unsweetened option it would be just as delicious.   Final word: it's just one more "elevated" burger joint. Unless you are on a mission to try every New American pub burger in Madison, I'd skip this one. Some of their promotions and happy hour specials may be worth stopping in for, though.

We had a real nice meal here a few weeks ago.  Service was good, food was solid overall.  The red velvet shake was top notch.  Price points were a little higher, but the quality of food also tasted better than a traditional burger joint.

-some of the best cheese curds in madison -awesome vegan/vegetarian options (falafel burger, walnut black bean burger) -out of this world brunch drink menu ($8 build your own bloody mar bar and $10 bottomless mimosas) -bomb cole slaw (vinegar based, not mayonnaise based) -legit milkshakes (good with whiskey) -awesome and attentive staff -great ambiance and location   a go-to for all occasions... brunch, dinner, and drinks!

BRUNCH @ DLUX - it's lit!   I've been wanting to check their brunch out for the longest time, and I finally got the chance! It's so fun. Shout out to Aña, our server - she was dedicated to helping my friend and I get the most bang for our buck on the unlimited mimosa deal. 7 mimosas in 30 minutes, all thanks to Aña   BRUNCH FOOD: Subpar, unexpectedly. The sweet potato fries and Parmesan potatoes were charred, and devoid of flavor. The chicken on the chicken and waffles were in a similar shape. Hopefully that's not a constant.   I've had good food here during lunch and dinner, for sure!

Wow!  Thank you again Yelp for doing us solid.  In town for my daughters state cheer championships and rolled in late and hungry.  Not a lot of traditional seating but got a bar seat with full menu in less than ten minutes.  Staff was very attentive and accommodating.  Curds and buffalo chix nachos for apps.  Both very good and just the right portion size.  Dlux and sunrise burgers were both excellent.  Cooked to perfection with great extra flavors.  The specialty flavored fries were great.  I had the pamesan truffle (yea, you read right) and I would be happy with just a plate of those.  Oh, and the salted caramel milkshake was killer.  I would love to go back, and will.  Stacks up well with other top Madison food scene stops.  Nice work Dlux!

Dlux has really, truly great burgers! I've been here a few times but feel compeled to finally say something because of a truly cool thing that happened. First of all: the Frito Bandito is AMAZING, it never disappoints! The Southern Salmon and the Black Bean are really worth trying!!! Also, the burgers come only as burgers, no fries, SO! You've got to order this side: Sweet Potato Fries & Sriracha Mayo!! Totally worth getting!!! So, last time I was here, I wasn't very hungry, so I ordered the Beets & Baby Green salad, asking for no walnuts. I didn't disclose a nut allergy, just stated, "please, no walnuts." Lo and behold, the salad came with walnuts and when the server came back around to check on things, I asked him (nicely!) to take it back, then disclosed the nut allergy but prefaced it wasn't a big deal. The server (Dang, how I wish I caught his name, because he was fabulous) was sincerely apologetic and then felt terrible when I told him about the nut allergy, adding, "I can get a salad to go for you without nuts!" I told him not to worry, it wasn't a big deal. At the end of the meal, the bill came, the salad cost was removed, a Beets and Baby Green was gifted to me, sans walnuts, and again, the waiter was so eloquentley apologetic. I LOVE THIS PLACE!! AMAZING customer service and a damned good burger to boot!!! (A "shout out" to the Server Dude that night!!! You are amazing!!!)

I've been here a couple times now & it's safe to say, this place never disappoints! Burgers are phenomenal & the ambiance is amazing.
