I feel comfortable taking anyone or everyone here because I know that the food will make even the biggest foodies pleased. This has def become my go-to place in Madison!

I visited DLUX on March 13,2016, this was my first and unfortunately probably my last time to visit this establishment, unless I have a friend having a special occasion there. When my party and I arrived there was a total of 5 of us, we had a reservation and were told it would be a 45 min wait, which was fine the place was packed and it was a busy weekend. We waited by the door out of the patrons way, ordered us some all you can drink mimosas and a few other drinks. We were able to talk while we waited, we did see one empty table that stayed empty for over 30 minutes of our wait, which was later filled by 3 people who came in and were seated there immediately. While we were waiting, there for 4 gentlemen in front of us siting/standing at the bar, there was one that was obviously intoxicated, which within 5 minutes of us realizing this he spilled his drink and another all over the floor. We continued to wait for our seats and about 10 minutes later the 4 gentleman finished their meals and took their drinks to a table in the back with some ladies they knew or just met. It was very obvious they were getting settled in the back booth, so we decided to sit in the open spaces at the bar so we were not crowding the door as more customers had come in and it was getting pretty crowded and fire wise not safe. As we stood and sat at the bar and ordered more drinks a bartender came up too us and told us that we could not sit there because there were already people sitting there. I informed him that those people had made their transition to the back and were obviously very comfy. I was told by another bartender that they were going to come back, because they had not paid their bill, I then continued to let them know it was obvious they were not coming back, but it was also obvious that they were not done drinking, so in my opinion I would ask them to pay their bill now or to just continue it. Both bartenders walked away and continued to talk about the situation and give us dirty looks, during this whole time neither of them were respectful, they had attitudes and very condescending. During this time  we all including two other gentlemen next to us all had empty glasses, and we were doing are best to try to get refills and new drinks. Eventually we all received drinks, as we continued to wait one of the gentlemen that had spilled his drink earlier came back to the bar to order another drink, when i asked him if he and his group were coming back he said no, they had found a new place to sit. He also said it in front of the bartender. Unfortunately the intoxicated gentleman was not done with his business with me as he started to hit on me and then became annoying belligerent and rude, I asked him to leave me alone and when that didn't work I asked the bartender who was standing right in front of us if he could ask the patron to leave me alone. The bartender then responded to me with a " what did you do to him" comment. I informed him nothing and that it's completely obvious this guy is drunk and won't leave me alone, my friends even chimed in to let the bartender know, he still felt it was me being a bother and ignored me. So unfortunately I had to take care of the situation myself, eventually with some rudeness the gentleman walked away from me and my group. After all of the craziness things finally settled down and we were enjoying are time, what was left of it as we were extremely annoyed with not getting much service, we did order food so we waited on that, there was no issues with food everyone enjoyed what the received. After eating we finished up are drink and left. I don't like to say that I will never come back to your business, but right now and for almost the last 3 months I have been frustrated with what happen there and I bring it up a lot to people to the point of I'm sure it's annoying. I just really dislike being treated so rudely and also with being good paying customers, to have people treat us so poorly. I know it's been a couple months and I can not control what your company does, but bringing up that :we need to work a little better on our customer service even on a busy weekend, as each and every customer is a valuable customer and one positive or negative remark about our place of business can be transferred, relayed and change a lot of peoples opinions. I do wish the establishment well and hope that no one else has to be treated the way that I was.     Thank you for taking time to listen, have a great day.

Wow! Finally a great burger joint the Madison can be proud of! Excellent burger combinations that are tastefully put together, along with Fries that will have your mouth excited. Not to mention, this place is partly employee owned! Who would not want to eat here?  The interior is decorated for a good Madison downtown vibe, and it is very easy to park and find. We parked in Lot 89 off MLK, and our parking was validated by DLUX!!!!!! Free parking! DLUX is the perfect atmosphere for everything from date night to just your basic social gathering spot. They even had some nice large TVs to watch football on.   The menu was priced at a medium rate, average burger price looked to be around $8. I am very excited to go back for their Sunday breakfast sandwiches and bloody Mary bar.  If I had to pick one place in Madison right now to tell someone about it would be DLUX.   A+ for you.

First time here today. Was much busier than expected but I guess they have bottomless mimosa on Saturday and sundays before 3pm. The restaurant is cool it has art on the walls hip music playing and nice big classic booths that wrap around. Nice square bar. The service was really good. Thumbs up to them. Food was on point. Deep fried pickles I'll be coming back for! I got the black n blue burger and my friend got the smokehouse. The hand cut fries were perfect partner to the burger, so yummy! I'll be back to try more things!

I went here at almost 7p on a Thursday. Not busy at all, in fact there were many seats open. There was more traffic on the patio but we sat inside and got a comfy booth. I really enjoyed the ambiance of the place and the modern look. Their drinks are expensive so I didn't order anything but I got the farmhouse burger and fries. The burger was great. I finished it all. If I were to be picky, I didn't like the side sauce that it came with so I chose to put ketchup on it. It was an average burger, nothing bad about it but nothing to rave about to friends or family. I also wouldn't come for happy hour since their specials aren't that appealing (2 dollars off appetizers or taps and 6 dollar.. a drink of some kind, I cant remember but 6 dollars isnt a happy hour price in my book anyway). The service was great, I must say. The waitress was on time, friendly, gave opinions on what to get, and refilled water without asking! Couldn't ask for anything more. This could be because she wasn't busy but either way, I appreciated her great service. Ultimately, I wouldn't recommend this spot out of all the places on capitol square but if you do go, you'll probably leave somewhat satisfied! I don't regret trying it.

The restaurant mainly serves burger so if you are a burger fan, this is your place. Their special is the alcoholic milkshake and I usually take my friends here for their 21 birthday and order them an alcoholic milkshake. The Parmesan and truffle cream fries are addicting and I would definitely recommend it. It is so creamy and crunchy at the same time

The burgers, which all come with exciting, not-your-average-lettuce-and-tomato toppings, are hearty and always pleasing. The cheese curds are perfectly crunchy on the outside and soft/pillowy on the inside-they're a solid 9/10! And of course, the Milkshakes are a refresher- unique from any others in that they usually have yummy chunks. They're totally a dessert, so it feels wrong to me to drink one as I eat an entrée... Maybe I'll get one after my meal next time! Come here for a good meal and a comfy booth seat!

I can't add much that hasn't already been covered in the previous reviews - DLUX really does have great grub.   We ordered the parmesan truffle fries + the bleu cheese and bacon fries as appetizers for the table and they were both scrumptious. I don't like bleu cheese and I still liked the fries - a true testament to the power of bacon.  My only suggestion is to utilize their call-ahead option. They'll let you put your name on the waiting list via the phone - as long as you show up within an hour of when you called. It's not a true reservation but it really helps on a Friday night when they're quoting a two-hour wait for incoming diners (which elicits some truly priceless facial expressions).

This is a regular brunch spot for my friends and I. I enjoy the turkey sausage breakfast sandwich, and love the breakfast potatoes with parmesan and truffle sauce. However, I really go for the mimosas ($10 bottomless on weekends). The waiters are always friendly and super generous on filling up your glass before it's even empty.  I also must give praise to the donut balls. I once made the mistake of not ordering them with my brunch and will never do that again. They're warm and come with a delicious strawberry glaze, not to be missed.  I cannot wait to visit later in the day to see if their other meals live up to their bunch menu!

Came here for Sunday brunch. It was crowded with a pretty young crowd and loud dancy music. It's like a college bar except it's well-lit and youre there to sit down and eat instead of make regrettable decisions. While I did not find my decision to have brunch regrettable, I did not find myself impressed and wanting to return either.  Let's start with the mimosa. I know people love to go here for bottomless mimosas: 2 hours of all you can drink for $12; that's a bargain! However, I only got one since I'm not a big drinker. The drink tasted kind of cheap (which I was fine with from a place that has to make a profit off of bottomless mimosas), and it was a little warm (yuck!) and not as effervescent as I wouldve liked. To be honest, I'm a craft beer lover, so my opinion on other adult beverages is probably not to be trusted.  For food, I got cheese curds, buffalo chicken nachos, parmesan truffle potatoes, and a burger (I think it was the farmhouse).  The curds are awesome. I think the batter has pickle juice in it because the cheddar curds have a hint of dill pickle. This flavor is really brought out by the dipping sauce that is probably 50% dill by volume. I'd put these curds on my top 5 list in Madison.  The buffalo chicken nachos are pretty decent and filling. You get a big platter of house-made potato chips topped with strips of chicken breast soaking in buffalo sauce, blue cheese, diced tomatoes, and white cheddar sauce for only $9. Pretty good deal, but this was pretty much on par with appetizers at chain restaurants like buffalo wild wings, so I can't say that I loved these nachos.  The potatoes were pretty good. Sizeable cubes of battered and fried potatoes are topped with truffle-flavored cream sauce and melted parmesan cheese. I'm not going to pretend to be some truffle connoisseur and say whether or not the truffle flavor is authentic, but the truffle cream and the parmesan cheese seem to taste like a gradient with tanginess on one end and earthiness on the other. Great flavor pairing! The potatoes are hot, crispy, and just dry enough to take in the sauce nicely.  I am not the biggest fan of burgers, but they were pretty much the only thing on the menu. The toppings on this burger were interesting: bacon, cheese, fried green tomato, baby spring mix, and a sweet tomato jam. This tasted pretty good. The tomato jam provides sweet and acidic flavors to balance out the fatty and salty bacon, cheese, and beef. Still, I can't say this burger is blows me away.  Overall, I thought the food was good, but it wasn't THAT good. With all the brunch options in Madison, Dlux just doesnt seem like a stand out to me. I was going to give it three stars, but I remembered how great my service was. The waitress was fast, friendly, and helpful. She answered all of our questions, and she was accomodating when I wanted to change my fries to breakfast potatoes. I think the awesome service earned another star.  If i ever come back, i will get a milkshake. They look awesome.

I enjoyed my visit here. The wife and I decided to try it since we had a gift card.   We both decided on burgers since...that's what they do. They're pressed and no temps are taken - which turned out just fine. They have a decent beer list, and a bunch of drinks they're happy to make for you.  I got beer, and enjoyed it.  Service was nice, attentive without being overbearing.

Expensive and not very good. We had 4 burgers - 3 of us thought they were pretty tasteless and the 4th one liked it, but it wasn't worth the money. There are much better burgers in Madison. The space was energetic, but they need to do something about the sound level (put in some soft surfaces to absorb the noise). We had to yell to hear each other, and could not hear the waiter at all.

Truffle and parm fries. That's all you need. Now that you know this wisdom. Walk or drive over to DLUX and indulge in its amazingness.   DLUX is by far my favorite restaurant in town when it comes to getting a delicious burger with some kick-a** fries and milkshakes. The atmosphere is upbeat and has a great vibe. And lets not forget the bottomless mimosas!! I've been coming to this restaurant since it opened and I've never been disappointed. Delicious food with an awesome and attentive staff.

Yes, yes, yes. Madison, this is what I'm talking about. If you're looking for a good burger, from scratch shake, beer, and deep fried cheese curds, DLUX has your back.  I was pleasantly surprised by DLUX. It presents a unique atmosphere with food that I can only describe as Wisconsin cuisine (or at least what I interpret as such) done properly.  DLUX is essentially what I would describe as an "Upscale, fancy Steak N' Shake." They have to die for shakes and burgers on their menu. The shakes are EXTREMELY well done. I know you may want a beer, but at least one person at your table should consider getting a shake. Rumor has it that alcoholic shakes are an option, but I wasn't looking at the time.  When our party first walked in, we were greeted by upscale, modern decor. It definitely had a clean modern feel to it with 50s styled art plastered on the walls. Seating surrounds a central bar. You can quietly hear some indie rock playing in the background.  Service was prompt and we felt well taken care of the whole time. Our server was incredibly sweet, helpful, and made sure we had everything we needed. I was actually impressed that she was so attentive, considering that the place was close to capacity when we sat down.  The beers on tap aren't too extensive, but the variety is enough to satisfy the beer snob in me. There should be at least one of everything on tap to please different tastes. Just in case, there are a few staples like the Left Hand Milk Stout. DLUX also has 1 rotating tap for those who like to try something new. Sorry, no 45 rotating taps this time.  Our party ordered a round of drinks with orders of cheese curds and jalapeno poppers for appetizers. A quick, note on the jalapeno poppers, they aren't on the menu. The server merely hooked us up when we asked. Let's put it this way, they should be on the menu. The lightly battered jalapenos had just the right about of kick and the chipotle berry sauce was incredibly well done. The table ended up keeping it for dipping fries in with the burgers. DLUX, put those poppers on the menu, they deserve the limelight, especially the sauce.  If you've read my reviews enough, you know that we are on a quest to find THE BEST cheese curds in Madison. Let's put it this way, currently Graze has our favorite, but DLUX puts on a show with these curds. We now have to revisit Graze to rank them properly. The curds are lightly battered and aren't overly greasy. The inside has squeaky and not overly gooey cheddar. Just like the jalapeno bites, it came with an amazing sauce. House made buttermilk dill dipping sauce. Very well done, kudos for making your own sauce here that wasn't too thick or thin. The consistency was just perfect for dipping something melty and breaded.  My wife ordered a peanut butter cup pretzel shake. The flavor profile was spot on. I was actually shocked that I could detect pretzel flavor and that the peanut butter didn't over power it. Nice balance, great flavor profile, perfect consistency! I actually regretted ordering my porter, which was also quite delicious.  For the main course, I ended up ordering a Farm House Burger (not pictured, sorry I took too many large bites before remembering), which is topped with bacon, a deep-fried green tomato, Monterrey jack, baby greens, and a side of sweet tomato sauce. The burger was cooked through, and it will always be cooked through. DLUX has a rule saying they only cook burgers one way. Sorry if you like a little pink in your burger, but it appears the kitchen does a good job from over cooking the burgers. It was still sufficiently juicy.   The burger was quite good. Again, the sauce was amazing. A good dish cannot stand its own without a good sauce to go with it! The tomato sauce was slightly on the sweet side, which was quite strange at first. In this case it actually worked for me. The sweet sauce paired very well with the salty, smokey bacon and the acid of the fried green tomato. All of the ingredients in this dish paired so well together. I am genuinely impressed by this burger. I am a firm believer that one should never remove ingredients from a dish unless the customer is allergic to an element. The chef (hopefully) added each ingredient for a specific reason. This burger is a prime example of that. These ingredients get along and pull out the best qualities of each other. Awesome job!  Upon leaving, I noticed that DLUX also has trivia on Sunday nights at 9pm. DLUX, we will be back for your trivia, burgers, CHEESE CURDS, jalapeno poppers, atmosphere, great service, shakes, cocktails, beer. For me, you knocked it out of the park and do an upscale burger joint right. Please keep innovating. You have set the bar high for me, and I love it. Keep doing your thing!
Have been here twice now during my cross country travels. YUMMY each time, great cocktails, very good service.

The food here is mediocre, at best. The process of being seated is very disorganized.   As for the food...  I was shocked when I received my burger and it appeared to be a tasteless patty on a plain bun with mushroom and Swiss cheese thrown in for flavor. There are so many places in Madison with much better, more appetizing  burgers--at comparable prices. Overall the presentation quality of the food turned me off. Do not be fooled by what people think is the "glitziness" of this place.

I really enjoyed DLUX brunch. I was a big fan of their green goddess salad. They let me get a half salad with my sausage breakfast sandwich, which was superb (the apple butter really brought the standard breakfast sandwich up a notch). Great place to go before a day of tailgating.

Happy hour $2 off appetizers are so legit. Recommend the mac and cheese bites - 3 huge serving, fried pickles are amazing - love that batter, and the cheese curds, Bam! - your extremely healthy fried dinner for $10.  If you're in for a hearty meal, I like the Smoke Show burger, truffle fries, and for dessert the Chocolate & PB Shake (spiked with whiskey).   FYI extra sauce is $0.25 each in case you like the sauce.

Service was an A+   Ambiance was A+ with the decoration and music. Volume of the music was just right, you could hear it fine and didn't have to yell to be heard or strain to hear.  We went mostly to try the shakes. I didn't have one but I was told they were very good. We snacked on cheese fries too. I thought they were quite worth it. Yum

Came to this place for the 1st time.  The burgers here are  so delicious.  My husband joined me and we both had their signature cocktails that were absolutely refreshing.  We will go back to visit in the near future.

DLUX has great burgers and even better fries. I've been here a number of times and I have never had a bad time or meal. The same goes for the drinks - their specialty cocktails are always mixed perfectly.
This review is only for burger/fries/shakes - not brunch. Fan-damn-tastic. For what they do....they do it right.  Creative burgers and shakes. Great fries. Cool atmosphere. Nothing wrong here AT ALL.

We enjoyed a late lunch in their outdoor seating area on a Sunday. They had a extensive build your own Bloody Mary bar inside, and bottomless mimosas for only $10. Our waitresses were very friendly and tentative to us and are drink glasses. They always came around and topped off my mimosa before it was empty.  I had the BBQ burger which was delicious and the Parmesan and truffle cream sauce fries (the fries were okay). But my friends had the sweet potato fries and the blue cheese and bacon fries both of which were amazing! We did not have a chance to try their shakes but they looked so tasty.  Definitely would home back!

One of my Madison favorites! Most recently, we went around 7:30 on a Friday night and ended up waiting an hour for a table. They don't take reservations, so expect a wait during prime times (well worth it for the delicious food!) the restaurant uses a wait list app that allows you to check your place in line and see how long you've been waiting, so we ended up going to the Tipsy Cow for a drink while we waited.   For dinner we got the cheese curd appetizer, fried pickles, and the black bean burger with beats and goat cheese--My all time favorite veggie burger! We also ordered sides of cheese fries with green onions and sweet potato fries with spicy mayo. My go to drink is the double fina margarita, which they have on tap. Just to warn you, it's strong but tasty!! We were tempted to order a boozy shake for an after dinner treat, but were beyond stuffed from the amazing food we just ate.  Even the next day my friends were raving about the "fancy burgers" and the cheese curds! Check them out on a Monday for $5 burgers, or for their bottomless mimosa brunch on Saturday and Sundays--you won't regret it!

Stopped in Sunday for Brunch and left full with a healthy alcohol induced glow so mission accomplished.  Probably the best value out there are the $10 bottomless mimosas.  My brunch date went with that option as I went to the Build your Own Bloody Mary Bar.  Other than the kitchen sink, DLUX has every ingredient you could possibly want to throw in a glass. We both went with breakfast sandwiches and split a side of potatoes that came slathered with a scallion and cheese sauce.  While she wasn't as much of a fan of the potatoes, I thought they paired nicely with the sandwich and didn't hesitate to eat them all.  I don't know if this would be my go-to brunch place but it definitely has an appeal. A solid choice.
Apparently publicity is more important than their customer base.

Flavors are okay, service isn't great. I've had 2 decent service days and 3 horrible. Can't recommend the place anymore.   Ask for less sauce on everything or it will be soggy, less cheese, less syrup, less dressing, dressing on the side. Less truffle oil on fries. I wish they knew how to properly dress things but they don't.   It seems the cooks weren't taught how much flavor to add, they just know which seasons to use. (no chef would add so much dressing) I'm referring to the soggy buns, soup like salads, and the disgustingly soggy fries.  The place would be good if there wasn't so much sauce, dressing, oil, cheese, mix in the smoothies, if it flavors the item there is too much and ask for less!!  If you eat seasoning packets straight up with no food this is the place for you!!!

Let me preface: I am a fan of burgers with wacky crap on them.  Sure, there are places I go when I am seeking the sort of "pure, holy" cheeseburger experience (sorry Wisconsinites who will never see a Dick's Drive-In), but mostly, I want cheeseburgers with weird toppings.  To me, that is what the cheeseburger is about: creativity.  And DLUX is doing creative cheeseburgers like nobody else I know of in Wisconsin, and better than even some of my favorites in Seattle.  FH and I came here during a relatively slow time between lunch and dinner (around 2:00pm-ish on a Thursday).  We were greeted warmly and attended to promptly.  I got one of the grapefruit-lime homemade sodas and the FH got a red velvet milkshake based on the waiter's recommendation.  The soda was tasty, but probably my least favorite aspect of the meal, as the grapefruit flavor was much weaker than I expected.  Milkshake was phenom, and pretty much tasted like liquified cake and ice cream.  But the burgers.  The Burgers.  The.  BURGERS.  FH got the Pimento Cheeseburger, with perfectly cooked crisp bacon and wonderful homemade pimento cheese, creating a flavorful, playful take on the classic cheeseburger.  For me, however, their September burger of the month, a pear-and-brie concoction with bacon-pear marmalade was one of the best burgers I have ever had.  Gooey, melty brie and fresh, fruity pears blended perfectly with their well-seasoned beef patty and fluffy-yet-sturdy bun that managed to hold together under some pretty runny conditions.  I am tearing up a bit just thinking about it.  The flavors worked so exceptionally well together; whoever came up with that one deserves a medal.  As a caveat, the patties are cooked on the medium-well side, but I did not find them overdone or dry at all.  However, for those who like a pinker burger, you may have to make a request otherwise.  And the fries!  The thick, perfectly cooked fries would have been enough by themselves, but we got them in blue cheese/bacon and sharp cheddar/green onion varieties.  I thought they would just be sprinkled with toppings, but, as it turns out, these fries are covered in cheese sauce.  Creamy, delicious cheese sauce + amazing toppings = true french fry love.  They also layer the fries with the sauces and toppings just enough so that you don't end up with too many naked fries, which I thought was a nice touch.  Oh, and for the whole thing, we paid just over $30 before tip.  Are you serious?!  DLUX, you make me wish I still lived in Madison again, just a little bit.

Botttomless Mimosas? I'm there! $10, and I drank around 5, and I wanted to go for more. Well worth the cost.  I had the fried pickles, sweet potato fries with spicy mayo, and finally the margherita chicken burger. Fried pickles and sweet potato fries were delicious, and I couldn't stop going back for more. The fries were hot and crispy, and the fried pickles were fried just enough that the pickles were tangy and crunchy. Can't say the same for the chicken burger. I took out the mozzarella cheese, and the burger was just plain and pretty dry. It tasted like a normal chicken burger, which I won't complain about, but it wasn't anything special. My friend didn't enjoy her falafel burger either, which makes me wonder if I'd enjoy another entree. But I would go again if it meant sitting back with mimosas and more sweet potato fries.  I'm looking forward to repeating this experience (without the burger).
Absolutely love the food!  Great variety of diverse flavored burgers.  Truffle fries are great.  Milkshakes...yum!  Priced well.  Always my go to place for burgers.

I tried out DLUX after reading a few fantastic reviews, and now I get to add to them! Loooove this place. I'll get my downsides out of the way so I can get to the good stuff: 1. Our server, Eric, was very casual--he said things like "Still chowin' then?" and "Yeah, for sure man." I thought it was kind of nice and different to have a server that wasn't overly polite, but this might not appeal to everyone.  2. This is probably very old-lady-ish of me, but they turned the lights waaay down shortly after we got there, at about 6:30, and I wish they'd kept things a little brighter.  Anyway, on to the list of why I love DLUX: 1. Homemade, all-natural, strawberry-ginger soda. DONE.  2. My DLUX burger was delicious! They cook all their burgers to the same juicy perfection, and the arugula/blue cheese/port wine-onion marmalade combination was unexpectedly good. Perfect portion size, too. My boyfriend summed this up well: "You know, sometimes I don't like burgers that aren't huge. Except when they're this good."  3. The fries! Oh lord, the fries. I had sweet potato with sriracha mayo, and I loved the sweet/spicy balance. Boyfriend got the blue cheese & bacon fries, which were really rich and tasty.  4. The price. Every burger is EIGHT dollars?! Yes please. I know it gets a little pricier if you add on sides, drinks, and the like, but I'd say this place is WAY worth it. For a few extra bucks over what you'd pay at a more casual burger place, you get delicious, well-portioned food, and a great atmosphere.  Now I just have to plan my next trip to try the shakes...

Madison is my favorite food town, and I've eaten a lot of places, but this place is my all time favorite. The fries are amazing: the truffle Parmesan are to DIE FOR. Their burgers switch every once and awhile which is nice for variety. Make sure to get booze in your milkshake!
Dlux was awesome! Highly recommend this brunch location for anyone. Good was delicious and our server, Allison, was attentive and helpful!

I've been several times when in town for Ironman. Every time has been great. Great atmosphere, great food, great service! Fried cheese curds NO WAY I'm here without getting some, and these are as good as I've had.  Burgers have always been delicious and I don't eat burgers much. Kooky concoctions but don't worry they've got your standard.  Top it off with a crazy shake flavor like Toasted Marshmallow and I'm stuffed! Price is a tick high but I'm old and what they're selling you can't put a good price on. And that's good food and fun.
Parmesan Truffle Fries were amazing. The burgers are great and affordable. Overall pretty good spot to grab a bite on the square.

Food Is still great. I recommend the backyard bbq burger or the fried pickles. Get some sriracha aioli, too.   NO MORE 2-4-1s! They have stopped offering this deal. They made no announcement about it and I was so sad and disappointed the first time I came in after they had changed it. This is disappointing, but also seems to keep the number of college kids at bay.   $5 burger Mondays are amazing and definitely worth checking out.

Great burger place. I really like their black bean burger, which I had last time. This time I had their salmon burger. I thought it was good, not great. The salmon patty was cooked well; I just thought the sandwich could use a bit more flavor. (Maybe a little lemon?) The Parmesan truffle fries are heavenly.   Solid, friendly service. We waited an hour and a half for 6 people on a Friday night, which is to be expected in the downtown area.

Dined at DLUX on a recommendation from my mother, was not disappointed. Only a short walk from our stay at the Madison Concourse hotel.  The menu isn't huge, but is very adequate.  Everything on it is pretty affordable, with gourmet burgers being the main option at only $8. They don't allow a lot of changes to the burgers, but they're so good you won't care. Be sure to snag some sweet potato fries, they're some of the best I've had (and they give you the perfect amount).  If you're feeling sweet, snag a Red Velvet Shake, or a Krambach beer. Both went amazing with my Mushroom and Swiss.  The atmosphere is great too, very modern. Everything just seems new and fresh.  The draft beer prices are reasonable, but Miller Lite and similar brands run high at $4.  Honestly that's my only complaint.  Service was polite and fast. I'll definitely dine here again.
We had dinner here on a Sunday night. Good vegetarian burgers, like the fries too. Was pretty quiet, nice atmosphere.

Are you an undergrad? Then 5 Yelp stars, bro!! Bro, seriously. $10 all-you-can drink OJ & champagne!!! Hell yeah cocktails on tap, like they're beer! Plus, they're so sweet, it doesn't even taste like you're drinking alcohol LOL. But don't even bother with those cause we're ALL getting refills on our mimosas poured out of silver pitchers. We can get EVERYONE in a booth & then split the check 8 ways. Selfie cause we're so fng fancy right now. OMG load that flute up again, son, cause it's bottomless.  Now, are you 5 years into your mortgage just trying escape the worst for a moment before you have to go back to work on Monday but you can't taste the life-giving whiskey in this whiskey smash because all you taste is sugar and ice and how can they get 8 people in a booth comfortably when 6 of us with real adult anatomic proportions and not adolescent Bieber abs have to sit with one cheek off the seat and STOP TOUCHING MY LEG! No, I don't want to make my own Bloody Mary, I can do that at home. Wait, you won't let me get a delicious milkshake because I can barely button these shorts that fit fine last year, but you can get one?! Can I taste it? Oh god it's so good and tastes just like a campfire marshmallow. Hey, this spicy breakfast sandwich isn't half bad. Your burger isn't that good? Then let's get a bottomless mimosa to wash the bad taste out of our mouths and ultimately our souls. Wooohoooo!  3 stars.

Loved our first meal here.  Great atmosphere, good bar, friendly and capable service.  The burger was good and the curds were to die for - a definite contender for best in town.  Can't wait to go back.

Dlux is a great place when you want to feel fancy and eat fancy, but also want to indulge your inner 5 year old.  By that I mean, when you were 5, a classy meal was a happy meal with Strawberry Fanta. As an adult at Dlux, that means truffle fries, the farmhouse burger, and blackberry sage soda. See what I mean?  It's accessible classy. There's something for everyone.
Great twist on burgers. Delicious milkshakes. Boring weak drinks. Still like it better than ocean grill.

My mom came to visit from NY and we ended up going to DLUX 3 times in a week! She, and I loved it! We live 3 blocks away, so it's easy, convenient to get to, and SOOOO GOOD! I also love how nice the staff is, and how accepting they are of allowing us to bring our dogs to the outdoor patio dining area. Their cocktails are great, the food is always great, and the red velvet shake is amazing!!  We will be back a million times :)

Dlux is amazing. Super close to the capital. Very good food and amazing drinks (esp old fashioned). This place gets busy quick but sitting at the bar is perfect. I highly recommend going here if ever in madison.
Wow. This place is great! Such a fun and funky atmosphere with delicious food and shakes!

I've never had an actual beef burger at DLUX despite going many times over the years due to their only-cooked-to-one-temperature policy (I like my burgers well-done), but I'm still a fan. Their chicken burgers aren't my thing either, but I've found a lot of happiness in their veg offerings. My latest favorite is their Falafel Burger - a falafel patty topped with greens, tomato, cucumber, tzatziki, and a super delicious spicy garlic sauce. Put that on everything, please! Real suggestion: use it on the fries. I'm going to ask for that next time. Anyway, back to the burger - it's a super great flavor profile, but the texture is largely just soft. The cucumber slices were razor thin - piling on a couple more would do the sandwich a huge solid.   My dining companion on my most recent visit had the Asian Noodle salad, and it looked amazing. I don't offer order salads when out because it is one of the few things I can actually make just as well as most restaurants, but this was a contender.   Any of their fry choices are solid, and are great for sharing due to their rich toppings. Give the housemade strawberry & ginger soda a try.   Another thing that I highly recommend is coming in for a shake. I have it on good authority that to make them the crafter literally shoves a piece of cake or pie or whatever flavor-maker into the blender along with the ice cream. They are not messing around. I haven't had a chance to try the peanut butter pretzel yet, but it's next on my list.

Had the Backyard BBQ burger which was not too bad. The highlights were the Chocolate Peanut Butter Pretzel shake with the Bleu Cheese and Bacon fries. Salty, sweet, cheezy and BACON! What more do you need?

Average. Place looks nice but they seem to charge a bit more and I assume it is the decor. Probably would visit again but not to often. $15-$20 a person for lunch is a bit pricy to me for a burger, fries and a soda.

Outstanding place for lunch or dinner. Have had several burgers and sides and have been impressed every time. The cocktails on tap are fantastic and and change on a seasonal basis. Always something worth h your while- will definitely visit again soon!

Executive summary: I came here for the alcoholic milkshakes.  Mine was divine.  I'll need to return and update my review because I never looked at or sampled from the food menu, never visited the restrooms, none of that important yelp-ful stuff.  This trip was all about the milkshake.  I don't know about the boys but it brought this gal to the yard!  DLUX's interior is modern.  There's trendy art and mirrors on the wall, a central, square bar, and tables and  booths along the outside walls  They offer several milkshake options made with Sassy Cow Ice Cream.  YUM.  You can add booze to any of them.  Also, YUM.  I had the salted caramel pecan with bourbon.  Toasted marshmallow, chocolate peanut butter pretzel, and vanilla coconut are on my list for future visits.   They used to validate for parking for the lot under the building but I no longer see that listed on their website, perhaps times have changed.  Still, there are several ramps nearby and depending on the day and time of your visit you might find street parking as well.  I've been lucky enough to find street parking a few times when I visit this general area of downtown.

Came on St. Patty's Day weekend brunch. Waited 30 minutes for a table (was told 1.5hr, whooooop). Service was great. Robin is a sweetheart. Ordered their bottomless mimosas and a sunrise burger. I ended up drinking the equivalent of 3.5 mimosas, so they're well worth the price. The sunrise burger is amazzzzzing. The hash brown and jelly mix well with a chicken patty. Had a little mishap with my first burger, hence the 4 stars. Will definitely return though.

I'll admit it: I had my reservations (snobbish as they may have been) about this place before I went for brunch today. I have not had a proper burger there, but the meal I had this morning was outstanding.  The DIY bloody mary bar is terrific and must be a bartender's bestest friend. My companions also enjoyed the bottomless Mimosa (dangerous at only $10).  The doughnuts are perfection and the strawberry cream cheese glaze on the side is just ridiculous. I wanted to drink a glass of it.  The breakfast sandwiches are nothing fancy, they are just awesome sausage and egg sandwiches on soft rolls. It is the sides of potatoes and the four sauces offered (Cheddar/Green Onion, Blue Cheese/Bacon, Parmesan/Truffle, and Sriracha Aioli) that make a really good breakfast sammy an over-the-top, nap-inducing feast of gluttony.  LOVED BRUNCH.

Walking by, I see a sign that says they have milk shakes.  Sure, it's a cold-ish day in October, but I am so much a fan of milk shakes, and these are nice and thick, made with local ice cream, and deeee-licious.  Next time I'll ask them to skip the whipped cream on top.  I only had a black raspberry milk shake --only $5! -- and it was great.  So maybe this review is limited.   Deal with it.

Not enough seating for the high traffic the delicious food brings in. Reasonable pricing. Good specials, typically good service. $5 burger mondays and happy hour are two great deals. Closes for private events more than most places which can lead to disappointment. Great place for birthdays. Don't take reservations but really should.

Where in the world do you get high quality, yummy burgers for 8 bucks? Top notch cocktails under 8 bucks. I was visiting a friend in Madison who had been to Dlux a couple times. I loved the ambiance and from my experience in Chicago- a place this well kept means a little over average prices. But I was happily surprised, we had 5 cocktails, one veggie(amazingly delicious)burger and a chicken salad under 50 bucks. Loved the service, food and drinks.  Oh, with all the cool bars around this place, you can have one heck of a date night. ;)
Great bloody marys. Food is good too, especially brunch. Falafel and burgers are solid.

Here's the greaetest thing: fries ~ nope. They're good just not my greatest thing.  The gyro burger, salad, options, shakes ~ nope. nope and nope.   The *GREATEST* thing for me & I suspect for them too: THE SERVICE.   No! Not the table service, bar service, even the kitchen which I appreciate their efforts but any place that have servers that not only ask, "how are things?" but get a response then take an unsolicited action.... MY MY MY these are the people to have in your pocket.   What do I mean? It's like someone asking, "How are you?" and they really don't mean it. How are you able to tell they didn't mean to ask?  Answer: When they don't hang around for the real answer.  I'm guilty of it too when someone really answers the generic polite question of "how are you" but I catch myself and pay attention then follow up.   I officially *heart* these guys for the following reasons: 1) I took forever to write a review and wasn't going to until that whole scheduling thing stuck in my craw. Yet, I have always appreacited when businesses get involved on Yelp and respond to customers and seek an opportunity to develop and grow  - not all criticism is meant for negative use and abuse. I truly speak to encourage and improve and I welcome the same 2) Not just their involvement in YELP as I'm not an Ambassador of YELP but also my most recent quip was live and in action and I'm amazed at the response. I mean sincere, genuine response - not the let me pander to hear how great I am and think the world of myself. Nope~ I said my salad was ok. Actually, "Meh. Ok" and I was asked what could be done to make it better.  I said: nothing and expected no more as this is a business lunch and the convo was the real issue. Before I could walk out; I had an apology (totally not needed), I had a few questions thrown at me (I was rushing so I gave quick replies but said I'd call and give info) and I had a gift sake to take (I tried to give it back as "it's totally not needed, I'll just stick to the burgers"), Alex smiled and I said: I'm serious (about the burger only and call).   My call was appreciated as I could tell Alex was writing things done and had follow up questions. His voice poured with joy and excitement that I called back. Then it quivered with (yes, I just wrote quivered on a Yelp review) hope that I would return. At this point, I'm a fan for life.   I've said it repeatedly: I'M A SUCKER FOR SERVICE. I'll take your best service over great food anyday. For me, service let's me know the food will be good and makes everything taste better.   Beyond all that, the place is uber cute and now I really really want them to have the best level of success and become a Madison fixture.   I'm heading back for the last day run of the GYRO burger.

Wonderful food--service was great!! They've taken an American classic and boosted it a couple levels. You get value for your hard earned money. Best fried pickles ever--have the sweet potato fries with the siracha mayo. YUMMY!!!

Easy peezy lemon squeezy: Every burger is 8 bucks. Pick the one you want and order it. The pimento cheese sauce on the pimento burger was so good I would like to spoon it. That's love right there, folks. Ditto for the sriracha mayo that comes with the crispy-to-perfection sweet potato fries. Condiment heaven. Spooning paradise. The burger itself was ok -- a little thin and too heavy on the salt with its seasoning -- but the fresh-baked bun, crispy bacon, fresh veggies and that pimento sauce, oh that sauce, save it like a good band saves a so-so singer. The strawberry ginger soda beat the valencia crush in the house-made soda challenge hosted by us, at our table. The burger joint in a swanky, former upscale venue feels ironic. I live for irony. Maybe that's why I give DLUX four spoons, errr, stars.

I have been to DLUX numerous times, a few times for dinner and a few times for brunch and in both large parties and small. Similar to most Madison restaurants, they don't take reservations for small parties and that inevitably leads you to 1 hour+ waits on the weekends. So if you're trying to go here on a weekend night it is best to go early or late to avoid the rush, same goes for brunch. This is a frustrating and pretty unanimous policy for all restaurants in Madison, so just be aware. The atmosphere itself of DLUX is very hip and modern, they keep the lighting low at night with a centrally located bar that is the focal point of the room. But during brunch the place lights up with so much natural light from the front wall of windows.  As for the food, everything I have had on the dinner menu has been on point in terms of taste and quantity. All of the "Sorta burgers" have a lot of different pieces to them that pull together a wonderful taste in every bite. I am huge fan of both falafel and black bean burgers, so if you're a vegetarian these are great options that are chalk full of flavor. I haven't had many of the burgers, but there are certainly a lot of choices that come loaded with toppings, so you really can't go wrong.   One thing that is slightly annoying is the way that the burgers and sorta burgers don't come with a side, realistically just the burger itself isn't going to fill me up so you're probably going to end up getting a side too. It would just be easier if DLUX automatically factored those into the items on the menu. But when you do decide to add on a side item, the sweet potato fries and sriracha mayo are 100% the best choice. The sweet potato fries are some of the best I have ever had (and that is saying a lot because I get them as much as I can) and the sriracha mayo adds so much flavor that you start to realize sweet potato fries should always come with this sauce.  On another note for dinner foods, if you're feeling like going a little healthier and choosing a salad, both the south by southwest and asian noodle salads have my stamp of approval. They give you huge portions so you'll most likely be able to take some home with you and they, too, combine so many ingredients that the taste is fantastic and you'll probably end up eating it all.   My real reason for not giving it five stars is the fact that I wasn't that impressed with their brunch. Yes they do have bottomless mimosas, something that isn't common in Madison, but their only options for food are breakfast sandwiches and potatoes. If you're going for the mimosas then this is definitely a great place to go because you will most certainly get your money's worth. But if you're looking for a delicious brunch place with lots of options like eggs benedict, breakfast burritos, or omelettes, as I usually am, DLUX falls a bit short.

Everything I had here was amazing!!! I started my evening out with a Whiskey Smash- absolutely delicious & sweet with enough alcohol :-) I followed up with a DLux Burger (port wine-onion marmalade, creamy blue cheese spread and arugula). It was absolutely delicious but a bit messy to eat. This is by far the best burger I've eaten in Madison. I enjoyed a Salted Caramel Pecan milkshake with my meal. The milkshake was heavenly. It was probably the best milkshake I've ever had.  To top everything off, the service was excellent!!!

I'm updating my review for DLUX.  When I went at the end of August, I was a little peeved about their policies (they only cook burgers to one temperature-- medium well/well done-- and don't allow any substitutions).  I came home and wrote a long rant about the horrors of overcooked meat, among other things.  I just received a response from the Director of Hospitality at the Food Fight Restaurant Group, and it was truly impressive.  She really went above and beyond to answer all of my concerns.  I've written my share of bad reviews, but I've never gotten anything approaching this in response.  I'd still prefer a rare burger (and the risks that it entails), but the folks at Food Fight did a great job explaining why they've chosen not to offer that.  She also explained that it is, in fact, possible to make substitutions.  So here's the updated verdict:  This is a solid place.  They have extremely competitive prices for such a nice location.  The fries are very good (I tried both the cheddar/green onion combo and the truffle fries-- both were fantastic).  The shakes are simply out of this world-- I don't think I've ever tasted a better one. However, if, like me, you think that a great burger and a thoroughly cooked burger are mutually exclusive, you won't be thrilled with that aspect.  If, on the other hand, you tend to order your burgers medium well or well done, you'll have absolutely nothing to complain about.  Mostly, I'm impressed by how sensitive management was to my complaints.  I'm somewhat ambivalent about Food Fight restaurants in general-- they tend to have great interior design and menus, but sometimes fall a little short on execution-- but you certainly can't fault them when it comes to their professionalism.  I wish more restauranteurs were as committed to customer service and satisfaction as they are.

I like my burgers medium rare. Yes, I like it pink in the middle. Something about the possibility of getting e. coli really turns me on. And you know what? If you like your burger all dry and tasteless, that's cool. It's just not for me. Unfortunately, DLUX cooks their burgers to medium well, and that is a damn shame. I would like them a whole lot better if they would offer customers the choice of how long their burger is cooked, but they don't. Even putting Sriracha on my DLUX burger with its creamy blue cheese spread and onion marmalade didn't do it for me. It still tasted dry. I will say that the bun they used held up to all the condiments they put on there and didn't get soggy and fall apart. Props for that.  However, they do make up for a disappointing burger in other ways. Their salted caramel milkshake is solid, and the cheddar cheese and green onion fries are delicious. Womp womp on the burger though. 3.5 stars.

I'm happy to give DLux 5 stars.  I thought my husband and I would be waiting for hours to try out this new downtown restaurant on a Friday night, but it only ended up being about 30 minutes.  There is plenty of bar space available for waiting and it's such a great space so you don't mind hanging out for a bit and enjoying a cocktail.  Speaking of cocktails, I tried the 'Blackberry Fizz' and it was so deliciously perfect I half wondered if there was even any gin in the drink, but by the time I reached the end of my drink I determined there was - the flavors just melded together so beautifully.   I ordered the DLux burger, my husband the BBQ burger and we split the chips and sweet potato fries.  Everything was delicious - the flavors were perfect, the burger buns were just substantial enough, the fries were crispy, but soft; the chips were a little too crispy and could have used some more flavor.  Our service was excellent; very prompt and helpful.    We didn't try any of the shakes, but we'll definitely be back to give those a shot and sample some of the other burgers.

I really wanted to like this place because a good friend of mine was very excited to take me here but the experience was a bit... forgettable?  I enjoyed the decor and the atmosphere but the food and the service didn't really stand out to me. That's not to say DLUX is bad; simply just that I have very indifferent and mediocre opinions from my first visit.

I had one of the best burgers I have ever had in my life at DLUX.  It was called the Sunrise Burger.  A Perfectly Cooked Hamburger with a perfectly cooked fried egg, pepperjack cheese,housemade tomato jam, and shoes tring potatoes.  Everything in this burger tied together so well.  The tomatoe Jam added a touch of sweetness that really set the burger off.  They also have a variety of different types of french fries and shakes to go with your meal.  Put this place down on your list of places to try.

This review is about a year late, but this is where I tried by first bit of CHEESE CURDS. Even though I wasn't immediately impressed with the cheese curd (I grew to love them) the burger was delicious. This burger shop is in a cute little area close to the capital.   We went got downtown to look around, but much of the places were closed.

DLUX is our go to hot spot for brunch. The $12 bottemless mimosas is no joke. The waitresses don't mess around and are co Stanly filling up your glass. Their fruits bowls, potatoes, nachos.. Everything is amazing. Great people, great prices, great atmosphere. The outside deck in nice weather is perfect for people watching..bring your dog for the outside seating. They are happy to accommodate your pup.

The burger came out overdone and the fries were far too salty. The cheese spread on the burger reminded me of Velvetta. I came here hoping that this place would crack the Food Fight equation of bland food + being over-hyped + disgruntled staff (rightfully so)  Unfortunately it remains consistent with the Food Fight model. Boring drinks, bland+over-salted food, and a unfun time.

Absolutely love Dlux falafel burger. If you've ever eaten tuna or crab cakes, it reminds you a lot of the consistency and texture. It was fried to golden perfection and the hot sauce ( I asked for on the side) added the right amount of spice. Also, it served as a great dipping sauce for the fries which were crispy in their own right. Add the dill tzatziki, crunchy cucumbers and crisp lettuce, you have yourself a wonderful falafel. As someone who is not a vegetarian, I totally enjoyed my food. I would also recommend the mushroom/swiss burger. So juicy!  Considering I work 200 feet away, I will be making Dlux a frequence lunch joint.

Stopped here on a Saturday night for a nightcap.  This had a hotel bar feel but kind of felt like a bunch of teenagers were roaming around. The bartenders were noticeably young (not underage, just young). One bartender had his two friends there and they were sitting next to us at the bar - they were a little too comfortable, making it uncomfortable for us. But I digress.  We had heavy meals all day in Madison, so I was delighted to see $2 carolina styled coleslaw. It was not heavy at all, a good portion, and holy cow! $2!!  I also got a whiskey smash. Although I asked for easy syrup, still too sweet and I ended up having to add a bunch of water to balance it out. For $7, not bad but I probably won't be back.
The burgers were delicious! And reasonable. The place somehow doesn't seem to have grown into itself yet so the overall experience was lackluster.

As a self proclaimed burger connoisseur, I came to this restaurant with high expectations. As far as the restaurant itself it appears very classy and the service was excellent. I choose to sit at a elevated table facing the street which was a pleasant experience.  Now to the burger itself. I chose to order the spicy pepper burger with a side of fries. On appearance alone the burger look splendid with multiple toppings including grilled peppers and spicy cheese. It was slightly challenging to eat due to the size but the long to toothpick was helpful. After cutting the burger in half I noticed the patty itself was slightly overcooked and somewhat dry. Overall the meat itself was very chewy but somewhat flavorful.   The fries were excellent with a good amount of salt.  Overall the restaurant is very pleasant with excellent service and a modern atmosphere. As far as the burger, I have definitely had better and feel slightly letdown. Based on the reviews I will likely have to go back and try some of the other burger options that are available.
I had the green chili burger and it was fantastic! My husband had the sweet slaw burger and it was very good as well. I really liked the food.

If you cover a turd with sugar it tastes good till you swallow. That's dlux. The bartenders were on their phones the majority of the time and could care less about us being there. It was dead on a Saturday which is a sign within itself. Offering bogo on drinks means they can't keep up with others so my fault for trying it out. Fool me once, fuck you.

While visiting a friend in Madison, we hit up DLUX for burgers and drinks on a Saturday night. We waited about 20 minutes, but managed to snag a huge table to watch the Final Four in comfort. Good start to the evening!  While my other girlfriends ordered some amazing burgers, I uncharacteristically chose the Green Goddess salad with steak. We also shared sweet potato fries with siracha mayo and parmessan truffle fries - 3 stars but nice portions.   The salad was great - very filling, lots of fresh ingredients. The gals loved their burgers - a salmon creation, Asian-inspired choice, as well as a gluten-free friendly option. Good, original drink options too!  All in all a solid spot with good food and a fun atmosphere, and diehard Badgers fans who all fell silent at the buzzer when their beloved Bucky fell by 1 point.   What a shame...

Dlux is my go to spot for burgers and brunch.  I love the creativity of the menu. The downtown location makes this the perfect spot to grab lunch after the farmer's market or dinner before a show at the comedy club.  Enjoying mimosas on the patio is a Sunday morning favorite!

I've been to Dlux several times: three times for brunch, twice for dinner, and a few times just for drinks (love the 2-for-1 special on Friday nights). The staff is great and super friendly!  Brunch: Get here early or be flexible with maybe eating at the bar or counter because they get packed! Pretty sure they don't take reservations either. I love the unlimited mimosa special and it is mainly why I have yet to try the build-your-own Bloody Mary bar. I do wish they had more options for the brunch food menu though. I know this is a 'burger' place but not everyone is a huge fan of breakfast sandwiches (myself included). That's mostly why I'm giving it 4/5 stars, because I would love to see an omelette or Egg Benedict on the menu.  Dinner: Yum! The burgers are amazing. Also highly recommend trying a few of the french fry options - so far I've had the truffle cream and sweet potato/Sriracha mayo options. Both were great!

The best place we ate when in town for Ironman Wisconsin! Super friendly service, quick food, TASTY at that, and all around great vibes. The cheese curds here are a must, as is the chocolate peanut butter pretzel milkshake (we shared this as a dessert). Everything we had here was superb, and we were stunned at how quickly everything came out for how great everything was! Definitely coming back when I'm here for Ironman Wisconsin next year.

Some of the weirdest service from a food fight joint. My date and I literally felt like we were being talked about and laughed at...for whatever reason.  Honestly I don't get it..? The burgers tasted odd, and not what you would think from a place that bills them as the best. My milkshake tasted like dishwasher soap and was simply gross!   Won't be back for half assed food and ODD BALL service.

I'm actually giving DLUX zero stars.    I have been to the restaurant a couple different times & each time the service was absolutely Terrible!  To almost feel ignored or as a ghost in a restaurant is ridiculous.  I have have worked in the service industry my whole life so I understand sometimes it's not a 5 star experience. But I would never recommend this restaurant. Awful service & the food is not worth bragging about.

4 star review is based on Burger Joint to Burger Joint comparison - Above Average. Gourmet/ Upscale Burger Stop #4 for this trip.   We stopped in on our way through town. Clearly the place is popular. Though I would say more for drinks than for food. It was pushing 8pm on a Friday and the place was packed. We were told 25-35min wait. We waited and were seated in under 10 minutes, point!  We had 3 adults in our party & ordered: toasted marshmallow shake (good, marshmallows over-toasted in the recipient's opinion), red velvet shake (very good & extra point, as it was comped even tho we didn't complain when they forgot to bring it out), spotted cow beer (good),  green goddess salad with chicken (very good), sunrise burger with chips (very good), backyard BBQ burger with carolina slaw (very good). Burgers were on brioche buns, adding richness.  Our tab was $43, which was rather reasonable for 3.  Menu is limited, but solid selections.  Waters were brought immediately and never ran dry. Checked back with after a few minutes and 2x after. Service was up to par, perhaps even a hair above considering how busy it was & our lack of attention seeking. Zero service complaints.  I wouldn't make this my regular dinner stop, but I would certainly come back.

I enjoyed a Sunday brunch with friends. The wait was 20 minutes, which was not nearly as bad as the. 1.5 hour wait at other places around the university. That's due to Freakfest and the morning after a Badger game.  The great: Bloody Mary bar. Mighty tasty with a varied selection of toppings- meats, cheese, and veggies!  Espresso shake with Bailey's- soooo good and smooth!!! Perfect blend of Sassy Cow ice cream and Bailey's. It's the perfect compromise between childhood and adulthood.  The good:  Sausage sandwich. Good flavor and a bit of kick.   The breakfast potatoes. Crunchy. My boyfriend got the truffle and Parmesan cheese ones. They were swimming in a truffle cream and were very tasty.   Okay:  Chicken fried chicken. The chicken was seasoned well, but there was not enough gravy on it. It was a pretty dry sandwich.  Service was good given how busy it was. I'm only visiting, so I can't tell you much about parking, other than that we parked farther away and walked here.

DLUX is the type of restauant every city needs. It's a burger joint that can satisfy everyone's tastebuds. They have sorta burgers (non-beef patties), vegetarian and a gluten free menu.   8 bucks a burger and 2.5 for small order of fries. It's really all you need and worth it especially when ordering a sorta burgers with a side of fries (I think). Sorta burgers have ingredients you don't normally find at any burger joint and they are delicious. Whitefish and shrimp with asian slaw, Portobello caprese, white bean with tortilla strips...it goes on. And select any of their fries, you'd be happy with whatever you get. My fave is the sweet potato fries with sriracha mayo. Oh man, now I'm craving it again!  Dlux is definitely one of my all time fave...been there a thousand times! http://www.getnmahbelly.com/2012/10/dlux-innovative-burgers-and-more/

Hawaii 5-0 makes for a good tv show, and an even better cocktail! Be warned though, what tastes like a delicious, refreshing pineapple juice and fizzy water combo does actually contain a good amount of alcohol...so don't be fooled!  Anyhow, the real cherry on top of the proverbial sundae is the 2-for-1 deal from 11PM until close on Friday nights (and also Thursday and Saturday nights, according to their website)!! How DLUX even manages to stay in business with a deal this great eludes me, but I'm sure going to take advantage of it for as long as I possibly can!

We came around 11 on Friday for drinks and food. The two-for-one drinks deal is AMAZING as are the drinks themselves! We got the sugar mama and the margarita. I personally enjoyed the sugar mama more just because I'm a huge fan of citrus-y drinks and St. Germaine.  We also got a large order of the parmesan and truffle cream fries and the buffalo chicken nachos. Honestly, we should've just gotten two orders of the fries because those were the highlight of the night. The buffalo chicken nachos were a larger portion than we thought it would be. It was just a little too vinegar-y and there wasn't enough blue cheese to offset that vinegar taste. Still good! But not really what we were in the mood for.
Clever burger options and the toasted marshmallow shake is dreamy.

Despite my disappointment on my initial visit, I really do like to give a new restaurant at least two chances.  A sample size of one is just not sufficient.  Luckily, a friend was taking me to lunch.  I had the Sunrise burger and the cheddar cheese & green onion fries.  The bun was actually better than I thought, but again the burger was just plain adequate.  I was really excited for the fires, but they were totally flat, a huge disappointment.  There was one saving grace, the coconut vanilla shake.  This shake was absolutely awesome.  The vanilla ice cream was sharp and flavorful, and they did not skimp on the quality coconut.  I will actually go back, but for one item only, this shake.

This is the only place in Madison I believe that offers bottomless mimosas, so come for that alone!  It's a big fad in NYC and Chicago, I wish they had it in more restaurants here.  The staff is pretty good about refilling the mimosas which is necessary.  Chicken and Waffle is AMAZING!  Good portion size too, not too heavy.  Everything here is!

Happy hour from 3-630.  $2 off most drinks and appetizers.  Tried the Mac and cheese fritters.  Delicious, and very filling.  Moved on to the spicy Hawaiian chicken sandwich.  Also delicious.  The cheese fries were meh and was the only negative of the meal, but at that point I was so full from the amazing sandwich and appetizers.

Dlux is a good choice to end a walking tour of Madison's capital square. Happy hour is from 4ish to 6:30.  My Drink was a 5 star, hawaii five-o. My Burger was a good mushroom swiss with the dusty bun taking the starring roll. The fries were average with an excellent sauce. The best things I tried were the cheese curds, obviously Not frozen and spiced well, and thensample peanut butter and jelly milkshake. Bravo on that.  If their fries reach the quality of their sauce, Ill throw in that last star.
Fantastic service,  fabulous food.   We came in after 9 pm and got the best burgers.  I highly recommend the blue cheese and bacon fries!

First visit here and while the service was great and prices reasonable, the burger fell flat. We split the DLUX and green chilie. The buns are too big/out of proportion.  Burgers we overdone for our liking (you cannot order to your preferred temp) and green chilie toppings were relatively  bland. Chips and onion dip were ok.  We won't purposely go back, but if friends want to go,  I'll try a shake and chicken sandwich. Fries also sounded good.
You must try a spiked milkshake. To die for. Sweet potato fries are phenomenal as well and wait staff is always prompt and friendly. A great place to try!!!

The Green Goddess salad was AWESOME! I'm back home in NYC and going to try to replicate it for my lunches.   Atmosphere is great here. We got sat in huge booths the two times we went over Memorial Day Weekend, and loved the high ceilings.   Great service. We had alcohol, a salad and a burger one visit....and juice, two sausage breakfast sandwiches, and fries another visit. All was very fresh and delicious. Was really impressed with this place versus NYC places.

Overall this place was delicious and we will be returning to it on a regular basis.  Their draft menu is short with heavy IPAs  and only one stout (his favorite). The Margarita I got was small, but delicious.   Burgers were creative and delicious.  My only qualm was that it was overcooked. The waitress didn't even ask if we would like it to be cooked a certain way. Regardless, the burgers  were overall delicious.    My fiancee got the sweet potato fries with Sriracha mayo and I got the parma and truffle cream fries. Both were crispy, delicious and just perfect amount of sauce.   Lastly, we got a roasted marshmallow milkshake to go. It was amazing for a little dessert. Would highly recommend.   Service was great!   Like I said,  plan to return again on a regular basis. Delicious!

Dlux is a great place to go for both brunch and dinner. For brunch, the bottomless mimosas are definitely worth it because they are delicious and easy to drink. Although I am not a huge fan of bloody marys, the friend that I was with did the Bloody Mary bar and when I took a sip i surprisingly liked it! Definitely get the spicy vodka when you get the bloody because it adds such a nice kick. Our server was very nice and made sure we got our share of bottomless mimosas!  The cheese curds here are one of my favorites in Madison. They literally melt in your mouth and the dip that you get goes great with them. The Dlux burger has a delicious red wine sauce that pairs so well with the blue cheese on it. As a burger place however, I just wish you didn't have to pay extra to get a side.

Fun spot for brunch with Bloody Mary Bar, ( once was enough) as it's quit filling with artichoke hearts, blue cheese stuffed olives, cheese, cucumbers, beef jerky, etc. I nicknamed it a salad bar in a glass. Others enjoyed bottomless Mimosa for $10.00. Great burgers ( including Salmon with ginger, wasabi, that you can get a gluten free bun with for a nominal fee. We each had a different burger that all enjoyed. Previous reviews stated all the burgers were done medium, so I envisioned a dry burger, but they were juicy, yummy. The regular fries with blue cheese were good, but not great according to my hubby who likes them crispy, and they were not cooked long enough for his liking. My sweet potato fries were done just right, and when I asked for catsup, no problem. Wait staff is attentive. Next time I may try a salad as they looked very healthy. We'll return. Thank you.

I loved everything about this place.  It's definitely my new 'go-to' spot downtown.   I'm still thinking about the salmon sandwich and the blue cheese & bacon fries.   Great atmosphere----they manage to nail that "trendy and fun but still warm and inviting' thing. Bright with lots of windows and a fun view outside. Can't wait to go back and check out the patio!

I was super excited to check out DLUX on our trip to Madison, especially when I heard about the Boozie milkshakes. We went on a rainy Friday night and surprisingly there was no wait.   There were four of us and each ordered a different boozie shake. I went with the Red Velvet shake mixed with bourbon. I would stay far away from that shake if I went back. By the time I was halfway done it was like I was trying to suck soggy red velvet cake through the straw. It had a pretty gross consistency and was definitely not what I was expecting.  Fortunately the main meal was better than the shake. I went with the Porky's Revenge burger with a side of Blue Cheese and Bacon fries. The burger was cooked well and just overall tasted good. It definitely wasn't the best burger I have ever had but I don't have anything negative to say about it. The fries were delicious, highly recommend!  It feels harsh giving three stars for this but the milkshake really killed the meal for me. Everyone else in my party enjoyed their shakes a bit more though so stay away from the Red Velvet and you should be okay!
Traveling from Chicago and came to this place for brunch. Great food, bottomless mimosas for $12. Tori is the best server!! Sit in her section if you can!!

I went to this restaurant looking for a new Sunday brunch spot. I went here alone and was greeted by a waitress who said I could sit at a spot by the window since I was alone. She sat me down and did not check on me for another 15-20 minutes (I wasn't even given a water). I went up the bar and was rudely told someone would be by me when they had time. I ended up staying here for quite awhile. I ordered a bacon egg sandwich which tasted average along with a side of fruit. I probably won't be going back here.

This is my favorite burger spot in Wisconsin. All their burgers are delicious and consistently well made. The fries they offer are really delicious as well. On weekends they have bottomless mimosas during brunch!   This place tends to get busy on weekends, which is standard. Service is super quick and efficient and they keep your glass full!  Highly recommend the cheese curds here, yim yum!

Great drinks, nice ambiance, decent food, and amazing service! I'm a fan.  The decor was cute and the music was good. The bf and I went for dinner and drinks. There was a ~30-45min wait for a table, so we sat at the bar and got a drink each. The drinks were both stellar, and the bartender was very nice and helpful. I was debating between two drinks, and she gave me a sample of one to help me make my decision! Pretty awesome in my book.  We were seated about 20-25min after getting there, in one of the cozy booths. We ordered a burger each and a small fries each (sweet potato with sriracha mayo and the parmesan with truffle cream sauce). The waiter was very accommodating, as we changed our fries order about 5 minutes after ordering our food.   The food was decent. The menu gave me the impression that the focus was more the toppings and flavors than the meat itself, but the burgers were the opposite. They could have benefited from less salt in the meat and less butter on the buns, and though they say medium well is what they do, I really think they would've been tastier if the meat was done medium to add a little moisture.   Fries were good. I highly recommend the sweet potato fries with sriracha mayo, but the parmesan with truffle cream sauce were a little too heavy for fries. I think I would prefer if the fries (or at least regular fries) were included in the price of the burger, and you could pay $1 to upgrade to a different fries or side dish option.  The only weird thing we witnessed (and heard) was one of the waiters vacuuming the carpet just 2 tables away for a good few minutes. Nothing had spilled, just vacuuming the crumbs that inevitably end up on restaurant floors. That probably could have waited till after the place closed. Keep in mind that this was at 7pm or so.   We thought the food was a bit overpriced, even for the "fancy" style of burger and nice cocktails. $40 for burgers, fries, and drinks for 2 people seems a bit much. Definitely worth a try, especially for those delicious cocktails (need to come back for happy hour soon!). If they tone down the salt in the burgers and consider including fries with the burger order, I would easily give this place 5 stars.

I thought DLUX was great! We came here on a Friday night around 6, assuming that it would be really crowded and we were right. It's a small space but the staff usually gets people in and out in a good time. Also if there's open seats at the bar, those are fair game-which is what we ended up doing.   I had the Sugar Mama Cocktail to start and my fiance had a Spotted Cow. My drink was pretty strong but still amazing! For dinner, I had the Farmhouse Burger (without the bun haha) and I loved it. DLUX is pretty simple in terms of their burgers, it's nothing too extravagant or over the top, and the menu is only one page which I don't mind.   I plan on returning!

Overrated.   Small, overcooked burgers with supposedly creative toppings, and the boozy milkshake gimmick mostly results in a thin, runny milkshake.   The crowd when I went consisted mostly of middle aged types trying to look cool with over done hair and one too many buttons undone on the fanciest shirt they could find at Kohl's.   If you want a burger and a shake, you're better off going to Culver's.  No thank you whatsoever.

A very rousing atmosphere that makes intimate conversation challenging but DLUX is the place to be if you're looking for specialty burgers supported by modernized "classics" and milkshakes.  As side notes, the buffalo chicken nachos are light on chicken and buffalo and interestingly, served on home made potato chips, not tortilla chips. For a sober diner it was a little off-putting but once I had 3 drinks in me I could see the potential appeal.   If you order the cheese curds, take note that you only get 10 so plan accordingly. Do yourself a favor and order the sweet potato fries with sriracha mayo--star of the night.   The Standard and Black and Blue burgers fired on all cylinders. The Colonel Strosin fried chicken sandwich was a little dry but still decent.  And there's a nice little 2-for-1 craft drink list for late night patrons til midnight.

Have been three or four times and it's always great. Their mixed drinks are really good and I love the truffle fries. Only complaint is that the wait can get pretty long (especially for parties of 6+) and there is often no space at the bar to wait. Maybe they need a bigger space.

Im at odd about this place. Ive had good appetizers and cocktails here but I cannot forgive the fast that they do not cook their burgers anything but well done. In this age of stellar burgers they are fighting common sense and good taste. Their milkshakes are delicious and worth stopping in for.  I have been back but never to get a burger. Its a good place to grab a drink on a night out or to take a date.
The meat is only cooked one way for an $8.50 burger. The menu doesn't have many opinions. The service was great but I didn't get the modern style bar with a poor menu and not so good food.

My husband and I enjoyed our recent dinner.  It's an adult burger joint with a bar and cool décor.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating.  Our bartender did a great job meeting my request to make my drink, the "Sugar Mama," even sweeter.  My husband tried one of their housemade sodas and it was very good.  Would get both beverages again.  We LOVED the French Onion Dip.  Crispy housemade chips with housemade French onion dip.  LOTS of onions but oh, so delish!   My husband tried the Backyard BBQ burger and I had the Farmhouse.  Both were very good but the burger patties themselves lacked full flavor (think the Graze burger for those of you who've had the pleasure and joy).    The highlight were the shakes.  OMG, I have no words!  Simply scrumptious and nothing matches them.  We tried the Vanilla Coconut and Toasted Marshmallow.  We both agreed the burgers alone would not bring us back (too many wonderful burgers elsewhere) BUT the beverages and French Onion Dip were definitely a draw.

Wow, DLux not only has good burgers, but they also serve up a mean brunch!  Bloody Mary bar with accoutrements galore...bacon, pepperoni, blue cheese stuffed olive, cheese, sausage, artichoke, green beans, and the list goes on. And $10 bottomless mimosas. What a deal!   The breakfast sandwiches are delicious and incorporate the same unique toppings as the burgers (such as sriracha mayo and apple butter). Order potatoes to share with one of the yummy sauces (truffle what???). I already plan to go back with a group of friends next Sunday!

The food was good -- The clientele was horrible! There was a $13 bottomless mimosa deal going on so there was puke in the men's and women's bathroom.
