People were getting kicked out for breaking glass wear and having altercations with the bartenders and wait staff. The people at the bar were loud and chanting. Just real drunk. It was hard to enjoy anything about this place.

Good place! Nice location! Fun atmosphere!   Awesome kegged cocktails, LOVE LOVE the bottomless mimosas at brunch, and their Parmesan Truffle & Cream Fries are to die for!   They do have some salads, but this is a sandwich and sides kinda place - even at brunch. Especially at brunch. Don't go here if you are looking for a light meal.

Great burger spot! I had the black bean burger as a substitute and was not disappointed. The chips were well seasoned and fresh as well. Finally, I topped it off with a red velvet shake which was amazing! Would definitely recommend this place! Only catch is if you are going on a weekend or busy week night is to get there early as seating is limited

Blue cheese and bacon fries were nicely crisp, but the blue cheese sauce under the crumbles of blue cheese and bacon bits was too mild to add much flavor.  The lemongrass lemonade was disappointing - I was expecting more lemonade and less lemongrass and got instead a lemongrass flavored soda with none of the tartness of lemon.  Service was friendly and quick.

Love the decor in this restaurant. The half circle booths are very cool and very comfortable. Our service was great and the drinks were delicious.   We arrived during happy hour so our cheese curds were $2 off. Which by the way we're absolutely positively delicious. These are the real deal cheese curds. You put one in your mouth and the cheese pulls. They were amazing. Great batter. I think I'm going in there again just for some curds and a milk shake.   Happy hour also consisted of $2 off my draft beer which made it only $3. What a deal?!?! My wife had a really good margarita and that too was $2 off. Really good drinks there.   I ordered the Sunrise burger. Ate every bit of it. It's not the biggest burger I've had but honestly it was just the perfect size. The bun was perfect. The egg with pepper jack and onion rings were a perfect match. There was a delicious sweet taste to the burger that I loved.   My wife had the Farmhouse burger with a fried green tomato. She ordered a small order of blue cheese and bacon fries. I had the Parmesan truffle fries. OMG! These are scrumptious.   For dessert we shared a coconut milkshake. Wow! Wow! What a treat. So tasty. We will be coming back. I can't rave enough about this restaurant. Love it!!!

If you are in the mood for a burger and want some spicy options to break away from traditional American interpretations, this is a nice stop. Sweet potato fries with chipotle dressing are addictive. It's a bit upscale from most burger places as well. This would give  a higher rating if they had healthier options but I think that's more about my making a category mistake of looking for healthy food at a comfort-foodery.

If you like burgers & fries (um, who doesn't?!?), then you need to visit DLUX!  We went with a group of 4 & we all got different burgers. We all really enjoyed our burgers. But the real winner from this meal was the fries! DLUX has 4 kinds of specialty fries & we ordered a small order of each. Wow wow wow. The truffle fries were my absolute favorites!  Our friend was also celebrating his birthday & got to order a free birthday smoothie. He chose a PB + chocolate smoothie with some booze in it. He made the silly decision to share it with us & I think we drank more of it than he did.  DLUX is a winner for a casual dinner. One word of warning: this place is probably not good for a large group. It's kind of small & all of the tables were packed full when we went there.

Nothing like grabbing a great brunch before the farmers market. Warning, bottomless mimosa is delicious and dangerous. The Double Trouble was tasty and very filling. Shared a side of potatoes and both left incredibly full (and buzzed)...

We went there for dinner the other night  after my husband saw they had a mention in Madison Magazine.  The place was pretty quiet (as to be expected for a Tuesday) and we were seated right away.  The atmosphere is decent- decor is modern and trendy- my only complaint was that we were seated in a corner and it was pretty dark- there were no lamps or candles or anything, so the space felt kind of cold and bland. Other parts of the restaurant seemed to have better lighting.  Our waiter was pretty attentive and our food came very quickly- we were actually surprised at how fast it was.  We ordered the Dlux burger and the Farmhouse burger and a large order of the fries with parmesan and a creamy truffle sauce.  I also had one of the house sodas (the strawberry and ginger one) and my husband had a beer. The food was very good. The Dlux burger was pretty messy to eat because it had a soft cheese on it, so it was pretty gooey, and the Farmhouse burger was also tasty.  The fried green tomato was an especially nice addition.  The fries were also very good, but needed to be eaten with a fork because they were fairly messy.  And the strawberry-ginger soda was tasty and refreshing, though next time I would order it with only a little ice- the way it was, it was mostly ice and very little soda, and what little soda there was got watered down very quickly.   Overall we thought the food was good and the prices were very reasonable.  The portions are not gigantic (which I like), but someone who is looking for a more hearty meal may want to order a side or two.  We were too full for dessert, but I am definitely interested in going back to try the Sassy Cow milkshakes. Also, note that they do validate parking if you park in the ramp around the corner from the restaurant.
Had the best experience here last night. Great music and atmosphere. Jake, our bartender was the best I've ever had! Very friendly and made great drinks. Would recommend this place to anyone

I've been here so many times and it never disappoints me. Whether you eat anything, are vegetarian or need gluten free friendly options--DLUX can appeal to your needs. I've come a couple of times for dinner. You have the option to get any burger and swap out the beef with chicken or the veggie patty. The "DLUX Burger" is my go to with the black bean patty. The blue cheese really sticks out and makes it extra mouth watering.   Most of my visits are for brunch -- two words. Bottomless mimosas.  So affordable and so fun. Please treat your waitstaff well -- they're very generous with their mimosas and won't forget about coming to refill your glass! Brunch menus are a bit harder for me because I don't eat all meat (just seafood) or like eggs, but this most recent time I had their "Green Goddess" salad and it was delicious. The apple gives it a nice, tart crunch and the goat cheese makes it so creamy and savory. You have the option to add meat to it as well -- I added the salmon and it was cooked very well and made it feel more filling. This is definitely a place we bring our friends who visit from out of town!

Came here about 3 or 4 times already since I lived in Madison. It's a little pricey, a small amount of cheese curds were $8! There was no more than 8  in the bowl. The only issues I had was the price and it was a little too loud when I was last ate there. I couldn't talk to my boyfriend nor could he hear me because of how loud it was. I love the music but it was too loud. Our waitress was ok, not the best.

A group of coworkers and I made a dinner stop here.  The drink menu and the food menu are playful and interesting.  We all had different drinks and we all liked our choices.  We all had a burger of some kind.  My mushroom and swiss was one of the best I've had.  I did miss the corn dip that had been on the menu when DLUX first opened.  I get menus change but that dip was so awesome.  My friends had no complaints either.  Some day I will try the brunch as I hear good things about that.

Maple and waffle shake? Ridiculous. Buffalo chicken nachos? Crazy. Cheese curds? Nearly perfect. Burger? It had a fried green tomato on it. And it rocked.  Anyway, you could say I enjoyed my most recent visit. Just a little.

Well someone has to say it, DLUX is DLICIOUS!   The menu is not extensive by any means-but from what I can tell, what they do, they do well.  We ordered the parmesan fries, sweet potato fries, backyard bbq burger and the green goddess salad.  Everything was excellent.  The parmesan fries didn't get finished but every other plate was licked clean!  The bbq burger had the perfect amount of bbq sauce, the sweet potato fries were nice and crispy and the salad had the best honey cilantro dressing.  I can't wait to come back for a boozy brunch with bottomless mimosas.

Great place to enjoy a birthday dinner!  We happened to show up during happy hour, which ended at 6:30, so we had discounts on tap beers.  This was a bonus as well as a free shake for the birthday boy/man.  Everybody tried a different burger and fries/sides were ala carte.  This worked out well as that allowed us to order some appetizers, and then we didn't have a ton of left overs.  Great burgers, country burger was delicious as we'll as the burger special of the night.  Definitely worthwhile for a gathering place for dinner with friends.  We shall return!

Good solid burger place. Lots of selection and good service. Outdoor patio is especially good - great view of the capital in a relaxed setting.   Try the DLUX burger with blue cheese and arugula. I had the chk patty since they didn't guarantee grass fed beef. My son had the "standard " and he really liked it (of the kid finishes all of it you know it's good). Then my wife had the salmon burger and she really enjoyed    Again...service, setting is great. Food is good but nothing special either.

I have a confession: this is my second version of this review. I sat down and wanted to write a mediocre review. I wanted to play on the lack of Es in DLUX, how your Expectations went away along with them, and how SMPL might be more fit.  But you know what? The longer I tried to write it, and reflected on my dining experiences, the harder it became. The truth is, these are good, quickly prepared, /mostly/ simple burgers. They're made and served by genuinely attentive and friendly people. I'm positive you'll have a good-to-great experience when you go. It's one of the better ways to transform $8 into something tasty.  I'm looking forward to where DLUX will go from their pretty exciting beginning. There are good ideas in the heads of the people running the show. They've already completed a fantastic transformation of the former Ocean Grill space, and if they keep their topping offerings fresh (and maybe figure out how their kitchen can support heftier burgers with a range of temperatures), I can see DLUX becoming a lasting member of the Square. --- For a burger, I'd suggest the signature DLUX (you can't ruin a caramelized onion) or the Backyard BBQ. The blue cheese and bacon fries are excellent, as are the sweet potato fries with a side of sriracha mayo. I really want to love the Parmesan and truffle cream fries, but the current presentation is more reminiscent of poutine, which results in tragically uneven application of thick cream sauce (and the truffle oil contained therein). I'll certainly be checking out if there are any unwritten rules applied to the fry section next time.   At this point, you've reached the best part of your meal: the time when you get to pick a milkshake! But why stop there? Why not make use of that nearby well-stocked bar and come up with a very special treat? Some combinations I can personally vouch: toasted marshmallow with Rumchata, or red velvet with peppermint schnapps.

I came in hearing that the burgers were gonna be great, maybe even deluxe! But when we left  we felt pretty underwhelmed. Lots of their flavors were masked by stronger ones on the burger, but that doesn't mean I didn't enjoy my blue cheese with port wine caramelized onions!  They also serve fries a la carte which was kind of a bummer. The server seemed sort of annoyed, but we did come in about 20 minutes before the kitchen closed. We also had tap beers at our table. but the seating wraps around the bar so we could see that the night life was lit.

I live down the street from DLUX and have been there a few times... and always had a great experience.  Every time I've gone it's always been incredibly busy, which I think is a good sign for any restaurant.  I am obsessed with the red velvet cake milkshake, so rich and tasty.  I've never ordered it with alcohol but now that I know it's an option I'll have to try it out :)  The Standard (sub chix) is my favorite sandwich on the menu!   The atmosphere is very beautiful and staff is really helpful! :)

Food wasn't in the same category as the many other fabulous places I've eaten in Madison this week. Greasy, overly salty, generally not tasty. My two colleagues and I have loved so many restaurants in town, but this food left us all disappointed. Did not like the cheese curds, farmhouse burger, or berry/sage soda. Fries were good.   Very kind service, nice interior design. Might have been a better experience to just come for cocktails.

A friend and I went here two weeks after the Yelping Between the Buns event because we were really happy with the food at the event. Food still tasty, although there were some qualms with the service.  Beverages: Friend had the house made strawberry ginger soda, which has a light flavor with a bit of zip.  I had Salted Caramel Pecan shake with bailey's added.  We were a bit disappointed that they had no alcoholic shakes on the menu since we sampled them previously; I hope they add alcoholic shakes to the menu soon.  Spicy corn dip appetizer:  As others have said, this is really tasty. I probably never would have ordered this without prompting...but it goes really well with the dipping fritos (which are less spicy than the fritos I am used to).  Has a bit of sriracha on top for kick.  Burger: All burgers are cooked to one temperature, no pink, also no substitutions except for substituing beef burger with chicken or mushroom.  I had the DLUX burger, with arugula, blue cheese sauce, and onion marmalade. NOM. The onion marmalade is the key factor.  Fries: Fries are ordered separately in either a small or larger size.  We had the parmesan&truffle oil, which came with a bechamel parmesan sauce and truffle oil on the fries.  Very tasty, although hard to make sure each fry got some sauce...maybe a side of sauce would be nice too...?  Only downside was the service, which was friendly but failed to 2 key things. I think DLUX would benefit from staff to bus tables and refill water.  When our entrees were delivered, our appetizer plate was clearly empty, but they didn't clear the empty plate, which was odd.  I also ran out of water so I had to go to the bar to get a refill.    Overall, super tasty, would go back, also one of the few downtown places to have a full menu late night.

I have dined here three times since my first visit, and DLUX is consistently delicious. I have taken family and friends here now, and they all loved their experience! My favorite shake is the Chocolate Peanut Butter Pretzel, and I was happy to learn the shakes can be split or ordered in half sizes. I will continue recommending this restaurant to guests.

If you like salty food--this is the place to go!!  I love that they have a VISION and they stick to it from the food to the decor! The BF had to order two burgers to feel full and I would have too but the fries I ordered (I've had them before at a yelp event and they were MUCH better back then) left a salty taste in my mouth so I held off.  Food came out really quickly and we both loved our burgers:DLUX, White fish, and backyard BBQ! His fish burger was AMAZING and I wish I had ordered it, but I loved mine as well.   The Blue cheese and bacon fries have been delicious in the past but I didn't like them this time...I'll be back to try again though!!

My wife, sister and I went to DLUX with the intent on having good burgers and fries.  We definitely got what we were looking for.  Our waiter was very honest, nice, had a good sense of humor, and was attentive.  Since we had never been there we asked his opinion on many of the burgers and fries to see what his favorites were.  He was very open in letting us know them and didn't just say everything on the menu is great.  The menu had some decently unique options that looked to be great combinations.  We decided to get 3 burgers and 3 orders of fries to share so we could all get a taste of the different things.  For burgers we got the DLUX burger, the Farmhouse, and the White fish and shrimp.  All were quite tasty but my favorite was the Farmhouse, "monterey jack, fried green tomato, bacon and baby greens with a side of tomato jam".  The tomato jam really brings it all together.  For fries we ordered blue cheese bacon, sharp cheddar green onion, and parmesan truffle cream.  These were all fantastic.  The cheese was layered perfectly and the amount of blue cheese was just right to not be overwhelming.  I couldn't pick a favorite of these, they were all awesome.  I founded the prices to be quite good for the quality of food and environment (around the capital, somewhat hip).  $8 per burger, $3 for a small order of fries.  We were seated immediately and the food came out promptly.  On top of everything we had our 2 month old baby too.  The restaurant wasn't too loud but had a nice constant level of noise (talking, music, misc) that kept her in a trance.  Overall I don't really have anything bad to say other than the young ladies that gave us a dirty look for having a baby when we walked in.  If I could I would give it a 4.5 just because I reserve 5 for things that rock my face off.  Very good place, would recommend to others.  Not really for families with children that would be loud and wanting to run around.

Wowza! Cool place - decor is different - upscale but not by too much if that makes sense. Interesting cocktails. We had a recommended appetizer by our server / corn relish with dip fritos. We then split a burger (because it was late) - burgers are a la carte $8 I believe but OMG simply the best burger I've had in a long time! It had some sort of pimento cheese,bacon, and pepper jelly....not totally sure what that is nor do I care because I can't stop thinking about how good that was! We were in Madison for 5 days and this was my favorite. Can't wait to go back!

Forgettable experience here and almost didn't bother with a review, but I figured someone might find useful. Essentially came by for a last drink for the night after wandering State street and capital square as it was one of a handful of spot that seemed to be open still late on a Saturday...  PROS: -Cheap drinks, my whiskey smash only cost $7 -Our bartender/server was good. Promptly provided menus upon seating and quick to take our orders  CONS: -Whiskey smash was overly sweet, but can't complain too much as it was cheap af compared to what I'm used to paying in Chicago -Ambiance... Feels like corporate hotel bar, some weirdos/hobos wandering around entrance and eventually ran into one of them in the restroom -Overhearing the other bartender talking to the couple next to us (seemed like they were friends) about how wasted he got last night and how he was barely making it through his shift -Seemed like a younger college crowd all around and everyone seem to know someone working there and saying what up to a point where you just feel out of place  Anyways, not really my scene I guess or just not feeling the vibes here. If coming here for drinks, I'd pass and go elsewhere.  'Til next time.  187/365

Honestly, very meh food overall. However they do have bottomless mimosas at brunch, which is a huge plus. Without that, this place would probably only have 2 stars...that being said, if that's what you're looking for and you know what you're getting into (ie drunk brunch), go for it!

I have went two times this month since I found out the impossible burger was there! The plant based burger is amazing and I can't express how much I hope they decide to add it to the menu as a permanent item! Vegan aioli is amazing and the sweet potato to fries compliment  the burger perfectly!

This place is great. Food is top notch and they have a fun brunch with bottomless mimosa's.   I tried the Porky's Revenge burger and it was delicious. Burger was cooked perfectly, and the pork belly was the perfect addition. The bun and toppings tied everything together.   We were there for brunch, so our table shared their homemade donuts. They are fresh and warm when you get them. They come with a fruit sauce that is awesome. I highly recommend.

Came here for weekend brunch, and the place was packed! Luckily, we found a few spots at the bar after waiting a bit. The chicken and waffles were very tasty, and the sweet potato fries were pretty good with the Sriracha sauce. My favorite was the Philly burger. Super tasty! This place is great for brunch and lunch!

Great burger. Could be a bit larger, but what it lacked in size was made up for in flavor. Hands down the best cheese curds I've ever had. The accompanying dill dip was good, but app could have been a masterpiece with an additional side of marinara. Atmosphere is lively and comfortable. Nice place. Recommended.
Good burgers and they're peanut butter milkshake is amazing.

Beautiful decor, tasty cheese curds, and very nice serving staff. Always there when we needed them! I enjoy the burger selection and that they politely ask (on the menu that is) so hold off on the substitutions. I bet that makes their job a lot easier than most restaurants! Well done!!

I visited Dlux this evening (Wednesday, 5:30pm) for the first time and was very impressed, both with the food/drink and the service. When I arrived, I was a little flustered for a few reasons - one of them being that I needed some change for the meter in the ramp I had parked in. When I asked the bartender, Michael, if he was able to give me change for a $10, he informed me there was a free ramp right down the street, for Dlux customers. He also engaged me in humorous conversation and immediately put me at ease. I moved my car, and it was on to the drinks.  I had a double fina margarita, which, to my surprise, was premixed and dispensed out of a gun. Nonetheless, it was delicious! So much so that I had two more.  Unfortunately, my date bailed on me early on, but I was hungry, so I stayed for dinner. I ordered the green chile burger, which was hot and cooked to perfection. A side of sweet potato fries was the perfect complement to the burger. I definitely recommend this place and plan on returning, especially now that I know about the brunch bottomless mimosas! I also want to go on record saying that having worked in customer service myself for the past ten years, I have extremely high standards in that realm. They were not just met but exceeded here!

One of my favorite restaurants in Madison! I don't know where to begin.  When you walk in, at first you feel like the place might be too fancy for you, but after perusing the menu, you realize that this is one of those places that makes delicious food and provides an elegant atmosphere at a reasonable price.  One item to highlight is their kegged cocktails. They make a variety of different fruity cocktails from scratch and serve them on tap. I got the citrus one and it was one of the best mixed drinks I've had in quite a while.  Besides the drinks, the food is pretty impressive. We got the squash soup, sweet potato fries, and a mushroom burger. All were excellent and ended up being quite affordable.  One thing to watch: expect a wait if going Thursday-Saturday; we tried to go last Thursday and ran into a 45 minute wait.

We came here after arriving at the Alliant Center for the FMCA International Rally.   We were so hungry after not eating all day and loved the reviews of this place.  We arrived at 4pm and I had the DLUX burger and hubby had the green chili and cheese burger.  They were both great.

I went to DLUX after hearing a coworker rave about it.  Maybe she saw things I didn't, but I wasn't impressed.  First off, when I walked into this place, it felt far too "hip" for a guy like me.  I'm not of the going-out and being cool type of crowd that this place feels like it caters to. I'm more of the stay-at-home and avoid others type crowd.  I like less crowded places. I was able to get past the initial vibe of DLUX's hipness and sat at the bar (because a table would have been a 15-20 minute wait).    The bartender was a really nice guy.  The beer, although expensive, was really good.  The real issue I have was about the food.  The burger was $8.50. That's not a bad price for a burger.  However, fries are extra.  So, my actual price was about $12.50 for a burger, plus $6 for a pretty small beer (so you have to order two to get through the meal).  It cost me more than twenty bucks for a basic beer, burger, and fries?  Are you kidding me?  I sat and watched the Brewer game and enjoyed my overpriced beer until the food arrived.  I got the Couch Potato burger, which is a burger with chips and a homemade onion dip on it.  It was very onion-y, which I enjoyed, but the burger was 90% bun.  The bun was great, don't get me wrong, but it had the size and consistency of a travel pillow.  It was a massive pile of bread covering too small a burger for its size.  Each bite was huge, but it was mostly bread.  That wears thin after a bit.  The bill was too high for the quality of food I got.  This is a place that's trying to survive on its hip reputation and downtown location.  Maybe I'm too simple of a rube and I don't fit into that culture, but if I'm eating glorified bar food, I want to pay bar food prices.    The burger was decent, but for that sort of money, I'd much rather go to Five Guys or Dottie's.  Sorry, DLUX.  It was fun, but probably won't be back.  There are better burgers in town.

Giving this place a 3 1/2 star rating. Been here 3 times now for happy hour. Their drinks are pretty good and I have split the salmon burger with my mom at the bar and it was really good. They do not really have a good variety of appetizers/ bar food though.  Would probably not come back for dinner, everything is ala carte so if you want any sides with your burger it is not included in the price of the burger. They are also 1/4 lbs burger which is just not my preference of burger size. There are plenty of other places in Madison for a burger so DLUX is not my first choice.

Came here with 3 of my girlfriends for girl's night and it was great! It was a Friday night so we had to wait a while, but it was well worth it!  Once we were finally seated, our waitress was super friendly and offered my friends a lot of recommendations for what to mix with what for their boozy milkshakes. They ended up going with the Vanilla Coconut shake with Bailey's and the Toasted Marshmallow shake with Rum Chata and they were kind enough to share a sip with me. So delicious!!  I got the Farmhouse burger which featured bacon, cheese, a fried green tomato, greens, and a side of tomato jam. I didn't know what to expect of the tomato jam but was pleasantly surprised with a flavor both sweet and spicy.  I ordered a side of the regular fries which were good, but I ended up regretting my choice after tasting my friend's Parmesan and Truffle Cream fries. If you are debating trying them, just go for it, you won't be disappointed!

This has quickly become one of my favorite places in Madison and I'm surprised I haven't been on Yelp to review it sooner.  I've been 4-5 times in the last year and every visit has been fantastic.  Everything here is spot on.  They have a cool downtown night-life feel, with excellent industrial and graphic design for everything from the outside sign to the booths to the food presentation.  The staff is friendly and knowledgeable from my experiences, the drinks are great and include a lot of their own interesting creations that make you want to order them, and the food is D-licious.  Speaking of the food, it's an unbelieveable value.  Burgers are all around $8 each (which is what they specialize in), with sides being $3-4.  For a fancy downtown joint the prices are unheard of, so we've capitalized on this by making it our go-to spot before going to the bars or comedy club.  And the burgers are scrumptious, I love the Carolina coleslaw BBQ Burger and the (California?) Burger with fried egg.  The parmesean truffle fries are ridiculously mouth-watering and the sweet potato siracha ones are pretty high class as well.  I wish I could find the recipe for both sauces, although I'd probably eat way too much of it then.  The portions are also perfectly sized so that you are plenty full but not spilling out the sides of your pants.  Lastly, they have a burger of the month now, the last one I had was the Taco Burger which more than met my expectations.  I can't say enough good things about them, get down there and have a fun night out or just stop in for a quick work lunch, either way hopefully you enjoy it as much as me

Highlighting a few items I have a crush on lately has become necessary.  So everyone with a soul loves ice cream, unless you do have a soul but also a serious intolerance to dairy. Even then, you'll just have to pop some of those magical fast act lactaid pills and get yourself a Chocolate Peanut Butter Pretzel Shake at DLUX. Yes, it is necessary. The rich chocolate ice cream blends with an intense dose of peanut butter in an amazing way, but it's the pretzel that rocks this milkshake. What had once been an incredibly indulgent, yet somewhat typical chocolate peanut butter milkshake is now transformed by the salty deliciousness of the pretzel. Not only does the pretzel offer a flavor contrast, but more importantly it enhances the peanut butter flavor with its salty bite. If unique and bold flavors is what you seek, then this is the shake that will make even lactose intolerant folks jump for joy.  Now sweet potato fries are all the rage these days. And if you're looking for arguably the best of the best, you must make a stop at DLUX. Their sweet potato fries are crisp, yet not fried so much that the sweet potato loses its characteristic sweetness. The fry is cut a bit thicker so as to retain the integrity of the sweet potato. The fries are then served with a scrumptious Sriracha mayo. DLUX, I'm impressed. Sweet potato fries and hipster Tabasco? Props for fueling the latest foodie trends.

This is one of my favorite places in Madison. The burgers are amazing, and their appetizers are to die for. It's a cool, calm place. They make my favorite cocktails in Madison. This is my favorite place to hang out with a small group of friends late at night. Their late night menu offers discounted apps and drinks. Their food on the brunch menu is limited, but is definitely delicious.  I had a mushroom egg breakfast sandwich and breakfast potatoes, which was very good.  The best part of DLUX for brunch are the 10 dollar bottomless mimosas.

I was not as impressed as I should have been for what I paid. The food for one was pretty good. The asian sesame salad and sweet potato fries were both delicious! However, the service could use work... had to wait 20 minutes for a waiter to even check with us. We were ready to order by the time he got there to ask about drinks. He said he'd be right back to take our orders and then it was another 20 minutes before we were able to order. The place seems very understaffed because our waiter didn't check in over the course of the meal at all and took a long time to come collect our bills after handing them to us.  In short: food - good. service - needs a lot of work.  worth it? maybe after two drinks

I was skeptical at first because of the limited choices in burgers that they had but once I bit into the one that I ordered I was hooked.  However, Service was kind of slow and I did ask for no onions but stores but still receive them so that is why I have to give them four stars.

Coming here after approx. 17 hours of fasting, so we expected to have something beyond good to conquer our hunger and thirst. Having read some good reviews, we were planning to give DLUX a try! And here is how our story at Dlux started....  Welcomed by a male wait staff, we were seated at the corner. I took a look at the space, interior, decoration. As a no bar person, I didn't feel intimidated at all with their overall interior.  They do have a bar but the restaurant (as a place to have a proper meal, not only drinks) stands out too. The ambience feels so romantic with only little lit and people eating there seemed to enjoy their food and their conversation.   Right after we sat, the waitress came with two glasses of water. Her name is Colleen and she's been awesome since the beginning till the end of our dinner session. She explained today's special: some beef burger (with ham, too bad for us) and Pistachio milkshake! yay!   I ordered that special milkshake and hubby ordered the salted caramel one. Two of them rocked! But still, everything with Pistachio is good and that was like the best milkshake ever---- the Pistachio milkshake highlighted our evening.  We started our meal session by having the french onion dip. It came in a big portion so hubby and I could share. It was another good choice. Colleen was being very awesome and accommodating when I told her that we couldn't have something with pork. She came up with another yet also flavorful burger. So, our main dishes were shrimp burger and portabella mushroom burger, with the sweet potatoes with mayo as the side dish. Hubby loved the sweet potatoes, which came in a medium size. During our meal, she always made sure that all was well and our glasses refilled. Overall, our story at DLUX was a happy ending one: We had an awesome waitress, and the drinks and meals we ordered were THE BOMB.   IT WAS a D(e)LUX(e) dining experience. Till next time, Dlux! We'll def. be back :)
Love this place. Could eat the chips and french onion dip every day!

DLUX has a unique selection of burgers.  My favorites are the DLUX and the Backyard BBQ burgers. The buns which are toasted on the inside, yet soft and fluffy on the outside.  The buns hold up well which is a must when you're enjoying a juicy burger loaded with goodies.  (One thing to be aware of is that all burgers are cooked to one temperature, so don't expect to order your burger medium rare.)   The Parmesan truffle fries and sweet potato fries are my favorite sides. On the weekend, you can get delicious breakfast potatoes which are crispy on the outside and soft on the inside...add the Parmesan truffle sauce and you will not be disappointed.  The shakes are a nice treat. My favorite is the chocolate peanut butter pretzel shake with bourbon.   Tip: On the weekends, they have bottomless mimosas and a build your own Bloody Mary bar.

Great and unusual menu.  The Harvest Burger special was amazing!  Bleu cheese bacon fries are equally as great.  Awesome service capped it off.  Ian was super attentive, and honest and helped me get soup for the homeless man down the street.  Thank you!

Have been wanting to try this place for quite awhile and glad I finally did! Although, I should have done a little more research about going on a Sunday. They have brunch with bottomless Mimosas, so there was a 45 minute wait at noon. We were there for lunch, so did not sample the brunch. I had the spinach and beet salad and the chicken sandwich with bacon, onions, cheese and avocado. Both were amazing! The salad was huge, but I ate every bit of it. The chicken sandwich was really tasty and served on a bun that held up. Did not sample the fries but they looked delicious, a must for next time. I will definitely go back to try some other menu items, but not on Sunday!

Came to DLUX for brunch based on others recommendations, and wasn't impressed by the selection. The good was good, not great, but there just weren't that many choices. I did love the truffle breakfast potatoes (I'm a sucker for anything covered in truffle oil). And the breakfast sandwich I had was extra cheesy, so I'm not complaining. My boyfriend and I loved the bloody mary bar, one of the few places we've been to where you actually get to make it yourself.  I've heard that DLUX is famous for their drinks, but we only tried the bloodies. DLUX is in a great location, right off the capitol (though this sometimes makes parking difficult on weekends) and has a large window for people-watching. The interior is very trendy.

As an avid Food Fight fan, I was excited to finally try DLUX .  We arrived later, around 8 pm, and found the place still to be bustling enough to be fun...assuming it's because their food is so good.  While I've heard pretty mixed reviews on the place I went in without any pre-conceived notions.  Our server was very friendly and open to making suggestions.  We were excited and surprised to see Lagunitas IPA on tap here (yes I know we live in Wisconsin, but we love their craft brew from Cali too!).    Appetizer: the queso with corn served with fritos...kind of gross, but kind of good.  Reminds me of the velveeta with rotel dip you make in the crockpot.  Wouldn't order it again.  Burgers:  We had the mushroom and swiss and the sunrise burger (with bacon added).  Both were just OK...the bacon and swiss was cooked to our liking, but as a basic burger with just a few toppings, it wasn't anything special.  The sunrise burger had the egg cooked over hard (I thought most times they were at least over medium) and had no sauce or ketchup on it at all.  The addition of bacon I thought was priced reasonably at $1.25.  Fries:  We split the bacon blue cheese fries.  The fries were cooked well, but were drenched is some sort of other cheese, not blue cheese, then sprinkled with blue cheese crumbles and bacon.  If you want real blue cheese and bacon fries, head over to the Tipsy Cow just a few blocks away...those are amazing.   Ambiance and interiors were "meh".  Our topic of conversation was how many other better burgers there are downtown (Sardine's bar menu, Tipsy Cow, Old Fashioned)  Overall this place was just OK...if I want a good burger and fries downtown there are MUCH better options...I'm surprised it's a Food Fight restaurant!

My coworkers and I were looking for a spot for dinner. Our initial choice was Old Fashioned, but the wait time was 2 hours. We decided to kill that idea and walk around and try something else. Since I've already tried Old Fashioned, I was glad to try something new.   By the end of the night, I was glad to have stumbled into this spot. The restaurant was not entirely packed, but there was a good amount of customers. The five of us sat in a very tight booth, this place probably won't be able to accommodate large parties too well. At night, the restaurant was dark, had loud music, and tv screens plastered everywhere. Overall, this was a great place to chill.   I ordered the Sunrise Burger, it was great! I'm a big fan of burgers and I love them even more when they come with a fried egg. This place did not disappoint! They also added  shoestring fries in the burger. I would recommend having the tomato jam on the side. I liked it in my burger, but my coworker didn't. My only complaint, the patty wasn't hot...it was just warm. However, I still enjoyed it. All their burgers are $8, but you have to order your fries on the side for an additional cost. Their cheese curds were good, but if rank them third (My preference...The Old Fashioned, then Craftsman, then DLUX. I did not like Great Danes). The rest of my party enjoyed their meal.   The service was great. Our waitress dropped by many times to refill my beverage. She also checked in to see if we needed anything. Overall, I recommend this place to people looking to avoid the crowd and enjoy some good burgers.

Favorite trendy burger place. I order the DLux burger and it is awesome every time. Great sides, fantastic drinks and awesome shakes. They use local ingredients and you can taste the difference . Good veggie options too so good for the vegetarians in my family as well.

Bottomless mimosas...enough said. The service is usually pretty good. I've had the portobello mushroom burger and it was amazing, although messy. I love all their fries. Their breakfast food is only so-so.

The place was packed on Saturday night, usually a good sign, but I think people are going to get over this place quickly. Strange service, greeted with "What's up." nothing more. Food is tasty, when it's cooked, I got served a burger that was still raw... considering it's a burger joint, that really shouldn't happen. I won't be back.

Went here for dinner tonight.  We had the Pimento burger, and the Farmhouse burger. We got 3 small orders of fries to try.  The blue cheese fries, the cheddar & green onion fries, and the sweet potato fries with the Sriracha mayo. My Farmhouse was pretty darned good.  Hubby's Pimento was good too.  The blue cheese & the cheddar fries were both very good.  The sweet potato fries ROCKED.  Soooo good!  We split a Salted Carmel Pecan shake.  OMG.  The best damn shake we've EVER had!  We'll be back.
